story:
¿Qué?

Lunas solas es el evocador reflejo de la vida de una mujer hastiada de ser, de estar, en busca de unas respuestas que tan solo acabarán por generar nuevas cuestiones.

Manuela, una columnista que, entre la decepción y el desencanto, ha perdido los ideales con la llegada de la madurez, se ve envuelta en una trama de intrigas y espionaje donde nada es lo que parece. Su matrimonio, sus padres, su vida entera son una farsa.

Con la noticia de una riada en un pueblo de Almería, su pequeño universo se desmorona y los acontecimientos la obligan a una huida por diferentes rincones del mundo, en la que descubrirá las dolorosas mentiras arrastradas desde el pasado y las creadas en su presente, tal vez necesarias para salvar la vida.

Más allá de los engaños que contaminan las relaciones de familia y la distancia que crean en las complicadas relaciones entre madres e hijas, existe un lugar en alguna parte para la aventura, para encontrarse sin caretas y descubrir lo que no nos contamos.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy se nos presenta Ros García Garrido.

Criada y educada en Madrid, tras dejar la universidad y pasar unos meses en Inglaterra, trabaja para diferentes empresas como asistente personal, secretaria de dirección y traductora; colaborando con Miliki en los guiones de TVE y de su libro de memorias: Recuerdos.

En 2002 se traslada a Almería, donde ha escrito tres novelas hasta la fecha, Batido de amapola, Los colores del mar (publicada en 2014) y Lunas solas.


Ros García Garrido tiene mucho que contar.

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 850€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Lunas solas que saldría pocas semanas después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Ros García Garrido vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
La organización Salud y Acupuntura para el Pueblo es una organización puertorriqueña sin fines de lucro. El grupo de auriculoterapistas han estado realizando clínicas de acupuntura alrededor de la isla, libres de costo. Los donativos que se reciben han sido utilizados para continuar el trabajo. Se han realizado alrededor de 18 clínicas, con más de 1,300 personas tratadas; hemos logrado compartir, informar y educar sobre la importancia y la necesidad de recuperar el control de nuestra salud, además de compartir todos los beneficios de esta milenaria práctica de la Medicina Tradicional China. Creemos que la salud es un derecho básico del ser humano y no un privilegio de quienes puedan pagar tratamiento. Queremos un pueblo saludable, informado y con acceso a todos los sistemas de salud existentes.

Un miembro de Salud y Acupuntura para el Pueblo ha participado por años con organizaciones que hacen trabajo comunitario en Haití. Hemos recibido una invitación para llevar nuestro trabajo a la hermana república. Estas organizaciones son: GARR (grupo de apoyo a refugiados y repatriados), PAPDA (plataforma haitiana para un desarrollo alternativo) y SOFA (clínica de solidaridad femenina).

 Como la solidaridad es la ternura de los pueblos....

- Viajaremos a Haití a realizar varias clínicas de acupuntura en las comunidades.

- Capacitaremos a (10) personas para establecer clínicas fijas, permitiendo la accesibilidad y la continuidad del servicio.

- En la medida posible supliremos a estas clínicas con materiales de trabajo y material informativo.

Pedimos tu ayuda para poder sufragar los gastos

El dinero recaudado será utilizado para:

- Materiales (agujas, semillas, alcohol, entre otros) para las clínicas.

- Impresión y traducción al creole del material informativo para los participantes de clínicas.

- Impresión y traducción de manuales al creole para la capacitación de los futuros auriculoterapiastas de Haití.

- Suplir materiales (agujas, semillas, alcohol, pinzas, entre otros) para las (10) personas que se entrenarán y mantendrán las clínicas funcionando en Haití.

- Transportación del grupo de auriculoterapistas a los lugares de clínica y capacitación. 

Estaremos compartiendo este trabajo de forma voluntaria y con muchos deseos. Es por esto que pedimos de tu ayuda, por poca o mucha que sea, nos permitirá cumplir con los costos básicos de este proyecto. Si eres una de las personas que han recibido los beneficios de nuestro trabajo, te exhortamos a que nos ayudes para poder compartirlo con nuestros hermanos en Haití. Queremos unirnos y promover la solidaridad y el trabajo en equipo; es lo que nos mantendrá en pie como pueblo y como caribeños.

Gracias por tu atención y por tu colaboracion. Por favor danos una mano, comparte esta campana en las redes.

Por una salud accesible, informada, integrada y solidaria.

Salud y Acupuntura para el Pueblo

story:
Coming to a small town near you!

When I was thirteen, my family moved to a Hudson, Quebec. It's a small rural town with very little to do, many wooded areas, and no real form of law enforcement.

While the grown-ups were busy with their own dramas (millions of dollars were siphoned out of the municipal taxes, leading a scandal in which many people lost their jobs and someone almost died, for instance) the kids were busy dealing with the sort of weird crap that city kids can't imagine.

Bear on the loose? Check.

A school janitor with a larger office than the principal's, complete with a PS3 and painted in the Montreal Canadiens' colours? Yup!

Lesbian scandals? Naturally.

Secret marijuana farms? Of course!

Multiple New Year's parties in more than one town spoiled by one guy's complete inability to hold his liquor? We got that!

A Halloween party in a bar 300% over capacity that WASN'T stopped when the smoke bombs went off and the cops showed up? Got that too!

Of course, there were also more serious moments, involving racism, sexism, homophobia, gun violence, and abuse - and we're going to touch on that too.

And before anyone panics - we're changing the names to protect the not-so-innocent.

Julia Miele and I (Jenna Pearl) will be writing A Town Called Hudson. The cover will be designed by the ridiculously talented Jasmine Eladas, and the interior of the book will be filled with masterful illustrations of Louis Bertolini.

You can check out Jasmine's art here.

You can check out some of my past work here and here.

Here are two of Julia's articles here and here.

Louis doesn't have an online portfolio, but we'll be uploading illustrations throughout the month!

story:
The Story of Natural Reflectors

Natural Reflectors explores the idea of how can we instill in our actions a mindset of intentional reflection taken from the power of nature’s cycles. We can look to nature for inspiration, but like any other new challenge, creating and working on your own process can feel awkward. With practice, we can make it part of our approach to everything. We can shift our mindset, play the long game, and become natural reflectors.

My name is Jennifer Peavey and I am the author of Natural Reflectors. Ultimately, I wrote this to show there are possibilities beyond what we have been taught and told and with that new perspective, I hope to help people think differently about how to connect with matters most in their lives.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover there is a world of inspiration to be found within nature; from how an apple comes to be, to the rhythm of tides, to our own breathing. What we learn can be applied to how we move through our days and lives. In this book, I hope to impart in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for developing your own process for how you will successfully accomplish any project, task or initiative you desire. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you stave off burnout, take control of your life, accomplish what matters to you and enjoy every minute of it.

In this book, you'll learn about how our fast-paced culture discourages individuals from reflecting on where we are, what we have accomplished, and where we want to go. You will also learn how a healthy process must have both elements of reflection and action. You'll hear stories such as...

  • Bill Burnett from Stanford’s Design Your Life Lab explain to us how we cannot make good decisions without listening to both our mind and body.
  • Stacy Levy, an environmental artist, who follows nature’s processes in urban environments to pull out the stories that surround each of us, so we have the chance to see it, appreciate it, consider it and maybe even learn something new from it.
  • Carl Honoré tell us how our behavior is heavily influenced by our definition of time.
You will love this book if you have ever thought that there must be a better way to find meaning and purpose in your everyday life, if you are tired of living on autopilot, or if you are seeking a greater connection between yourself and the world around you.

Natural Reflectors is a nonfiction book that speaks to corporate employees feeling lost in the shuffle and are seeking some sense of control, entrepreneurs who are looking for focus, and creatives who want to take their thinking to a new level.
 

The Book - Natural Reflectors

The book is written in three parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1 - 4. This part will explore where we are in life today and how we got here. It is a hard part of the book that explores how we are addicted to action and how reflection is truly a good thing, but also why we are better off if reflection and action are used together to create a balance that only we can define and judge.

Part 2 contains chapters 5-8. This part will layout a set of principles of how to develop one’s own process. It begins with opening the mind to the idea that there are other ways of managing the various aspects in our lives and that nature has been managing these aspects beautifully long before we were put on this earth. This part will explore how to glean and nurture what insights nature has to offer.

Part 3 contains chapters 9 + conclusion. This part will be a first step in how to apply what we learn from nature’s insights and how to become a natural reflector.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this fall.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!
 

About the Author


Jennifer Peavey comes from a varied background of engineering, design and innovation. She has specialized in finding the common ground from these disparate fields and is known for making paradigm shattering connections between topics and groups that often do not interact.

In whatever she works on, Jennifer enjoys discovering and coming to understand the authenticity of people, products, and experiences. She finds that the most effective way of breaking through to the essence is to create tangible experiences where she and others can learn all the aspects of a problem, study or movement no matter what their background or biases. This book is her way of making not only her journey in developing her own process tangible, but to create a space for others to experience a taste of what it could be like to find new ways of thinking, doing and being for themselves.

Jennifer feeds this with a curiosity for learning new things and connecting with others in an authentic way. Her latest adventures have been in raising, training, and learning from her best friend, Lucy, the ultimate black Labrador, and in pursuing her lifelong dream of becoming a working artist.

For more information, you can connect with Jennifer Peavey at jennifer.theblacklab@gmail.com and at jenniferpeavey on LinkedIn, @JenniferTheBlackLab on Instagram and Facebook and @peavey_jennifer on Twitter.
 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #NaturalReflector and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Jennifer Peavey

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #NaturalReflector and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!Thanks again,Jennifer Peavey

story:
Short Summary

Hello friends! John Jairo Valencia and I, Nasha Minoo Katrack, are finally done illustrating and writing our first children's rhyme book "Fern Boy."

This children’s book (for ALL ages) is about self-discovery and plant ally-ship. Through Fernboy’s journey we see that we can find ourselves through nature, and we can look to nature for guidance on how to create social change all whilst cultivating a reciprocal relationship between ourselves and mama Earth.

As Adrienne Maree Brown says, "Ferns and their fractal patterns are the inspiration to look for small-scale solutions that propagate outward and impact the whole environment.” Fernboy’s journey takes us through apathy, longing, urgency, joy and acceptance. It aims to encourage us to feel all of our feelings no matter how uncomfortable.

We would be so grateful for your support, it would mean so much to us.

With Gratitude, Nasha & John

What We Need & What You Get

We would love if you could help us birth this story into the world! We are seeking to raise $2,000 dollars in order to publish Fern Boy. This would help us pay for the formatting, printing, and distribution of our book.

  • $1,000 - Printing + Binding 80 books
  • $400 - Packaging, shipping and distribution
  • $400 - Artist labor (audio book & video production, illustration, writing & editing)
  • $200 - Layout editing

The Impact

We believe Fern Boy is a book that will encourage both children & adult's alike to connect with nature, build acceptance of their emotional-worlds, and expand their awareness of the interrelationship between themselves and the world. Though Fernboy's name has "boy" in it, this book was written and illustrated by two non-binary artists. We hope that this book will be a light for all the nonbinary children and adults out there. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our vision & this fundraiser!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Lamar Smith and I am the author of Jack of All Trades: Rise of the Party Promoter. I wrote this book because I want people to embrace being themselves. And I felt my experience throwing parties could help someone. There is a big social divide caused based on who can and can’t party on college campuses. The difference between regular students and students in Greek Life is staggering. And I want my book to exemplify those differences.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover what it’s like to go to a big PWI. Also, I want you to see this book as an opportunity to see the importance of being yourself, escape from the stress of quarantine and social distancing, learn alongside Jackonovan about the importance of friendship, love and as he finds himself.

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2020]

The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, E-book Formats)

The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Winter

  • When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish

A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book

Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)

Early access to the Introduction of my Book and some additional sections of my manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback

The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover

I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book

And more...

About the Author
Lamar “L.A” Smith is a recent Master’s graduate from Arizona State University’s Cronkite school. The whole book is loosely based on my life, I just fictionalized it a bit. Most of the situations in the book were inspired by things I did or people I know did. I wrote this book because I feel writing books are a great way to have an eternal impact on the world. Also, because I wanted to help people realize the importance of being themselves. Outside of telling stories I love sports. And I am passionate about college because I feel a lot of media doesn’t give an accurate depiction of collegiate life and I felt my depiction could help people prepare for social life in college.

For more information you can connect with Lamar at inside380@gmail.com and @jackonovan on Instagram and @inside380 on Twitter.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible shipping date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #jackonovan or #greekvsgdi and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Lamar “L.A” Smith

story:
Who Am I?

My name is Sarah and I am the author of a new children's book called I Wish I Were A Superhero. I'm a wife, a performer and a former children's entertainer who enjoys cosplay, roller skating and playing fetch with my dogs. I also really, really love superheroes.

 

My Little Superhero

The idea for I Wish I Were A Superhero came from my love of superheroes and my admiration of the imagination of children. I feel that superheroes can show children a limitless amount of possibilities; ways for having strength and doing good. My hope is that my story can inspire children to explore all interests and work hard for their goals. And, of course, dinosaurs are cool.

I am partnering with the incredible illustrator Tara Lehning of taralehning.com to create the final book. I was instantly drawn to her gorgeous art style. I loved her pieces that displayed an effortless combination of realism with a cartoon innocence. She has a true mastery of anatomy, which gives the characters, and especially the lead dinosaur, the feeling of movement and excitement. I could not be more pleased with the pieces she has already created for the book and I cannot wait to see all of the final images!

 

More About the Book

 I Wish I Were A Superhero features a young dinosaur (so cute, right?) that plays dress-up and acts out different possibilities for the type of superhero they could be. 

The charming and perfectly child-like dinosaur design can fascinate children of all backgrounds as a universally appealing lead character. 

The dinosaur explores options like physical strength, speed, intelligence and technology. Nothing is off limits! They can choose any path and be amazing. 

The entire story is told in a charming rhyme, sure to be a fun read for the family!

 

How You Can Help

The goal is to receive enough pre-orders and contributions to cover the costs of finishing the art, printing and distributing the book. After the first copies of the book are sent to campaign backers, the book will be available for on demand printing from Amazon, Barnes and Noble and hopefully from a personal author website.

Books will be shipped about 2 months after the campaign ends, ideally sooner.

If you are unable to provide financial support, please consider these other options:

  • Tell your friends, co-workers, and social groups! 
  • Share this campaign on social media!
  • Like the Sarah E. Paul Author Facebook page - fb.me/sarahepaulauthor

I sincerely hope you will consider helping create my dream children's book. Your interest in this project could open up future opportunities to create additional heartfelt stories for children.

story:
A Little About Me, My Book, and My Campaign.

About Me: Hi There!  My name is Sam Kaplan.  I'm 33 years old and I'm in my third year of grad school for clinical psychology.   Over the last two years, I somehow managed to write my first novel!   I assure you that writing a novel while in grad school was an incredibly foolish undertaking--it required countless sleepless nights, a huge toll on my social life and copious amounts of coffee.  Despite the sacrifices I made (or perhaps because of them), I've never been prouder of anything I've ever done.  I've dreamed of writing a novel since I was a boy, when I would stay up into the early hours, curled under the covers with a flashlight reading book after book after book.  Now that the novel's finished, I can finally say it--I'm a novelist!

Unfortunately, writing a novel is the first mountain of several.  The road to getting published is daunting and arduous, and debut authors can struggle for years before getting their first novel published.  But there are ways to make the path easier--which is why I need your help. 

Brief Synopsis:  "Are You Okay? " is about Matt, a 31-year-old Brooklyn-based musician who thinks his life is wonderful.  His band just signed a record deal and the women keep getting hotter and hotter.  However, back at home, Matt's family is falling apart.  His dad is going crazy and his brother is raising two girls (aged 7 and 13) on his own.  

When his dad gets arrested for stealing a horse, Matt has to pack his bags and try to put things back together.  As he deals with his bipolar father, his depressed brother, and his two adorable but fragile nieces, Matt is haunted as he relives his painful childhood memories.  Oh yeah, and there's also a love story (of course): Matt returns to find that he's suddenly--and troublingly, given his lack of interest in monogamy--attracted to his oldest childhood friend, Julia.

"Are You Okay?" is a full-length novel that will (hopefully) make you laugh out loud a bunch and cry (in a good way) once or twice.  Written with passion, pathos and pee-your-pants humor, (a la Nick Hornby, Dave Eggers and Jonathan Tropper), "Are You Okay?" is about music, masculinity, sexuality, addiction, mental illness, and above all, love and family.  

What Your Donations Will Help Me Get

How Publishing Works (Today): In order to get a best-seller, you need a great publisher, and in order to get a great publisher, you need a great agent.  Getting a great agent is hard, ESPECIALLY for first time authors.  Your manuscript needs to be polished, you need to attend writer's workshops and you need a built-in marketing platform.  Which is where you come in.

Whether you can spare $5,000,000 or just $5, your contribution will be a HUGE help in what can be a very painful process.  Here's what your contribution will go towards: 

Novel Coach/Manuscript Editor ($1,400):  I've found a fantastic professional editor, Sarah Cypher at threepennyeditor.com, who provided me with a sample edit and did FANTASTIC work with the first few chapters.  I'm so excited to work with Sarah.  I'm confident that she will help take my novel to the next level.  Her services include in-depth line editing, a thorough, 15-page developmental critique, and pre-pubication services such as getting excerpts published in magazines.  This is the big one--these days, almost no debut novelist gets published without the help of a seasoned professional editor.

Santa Barbara Writers Conference (around $650): Writers Conferences are a great way to meet with agents, other novelists, and publishers.  The best part of writers conferences is that authors get to meet face-to-face with agents who work in their genre and are actively looking for new authors.  If I don't raise the funds in time for the Santa Barbara Writers Conference (June 6th), there are several other conferences throughout the year, such as the S.F. Writers Conference (usually in early winter).  

Website/Marketing( $200-$500): In order to build my "marketing platform", I need more of an online/social media presence.  Around $200 will help me get a great website, and anything I raise above that amount will help me direct higher traffic to websites like Twitter, Instagram, Goodreads and Amazon.  Having an impressive marketing platform can be the difference between getting a great agent and one who's simply adequate.  

What You Get

I'm giving away plenty of goodies in exchange for your donations: signed copies of the novel, advance galley copies, music from the book, and even the chance to name one of the characters!

The Impact

I really believe your contributions will help me take my book to the next level, which will make the process of getting published a whole lot less painful than it otherwise would be.  With your help, I believe "Are You Okay?" will be on the shelves in Spring or Summer of 2017.  If you love reading, love laughter, love tears, or just love me, then please donate whatever you can spare!

Risks & Challenges

There is but one risk: I don't get published.  I have spent literally ONE MILLION HOURS working on this novel, and if I don't get published I will probably explode or something super dire like that.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that's okay!  Here are some other ways you can help:

  • Get  the word out and make some noise about my campaign.  Share on facebook, twitter, or just email to your friends or family.  
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
Thanks again for your love and support!
With your help, my dream of being a published novelist will hopefully come true!
-Sam

story:
My Story

This campaign is to raise funds to publish a book of extraordinary handwritten stories written by people on the front line in Afghanistan.  The book tells their stories, it is their self portrait.

I'm an artist, based in the UK, and in 2011 I volunteered to go to Afghanistan as a war artist.  I spent a month on the front line and wanted to find a way to get inside the heads of the people I met: soldiers and civilians, Afghan and Western.

I asked everyone I met on the front line to write their unique story or a poem on a postcard and collated these stories in a series of 'Diary Rooms'.

Here's a TV interview with BFBS which tells the story about how the book came about:

http://bit.ly/1cVLJLw

One of the hundreds of postcards written on the front line:

In my time on the front line I was shot at and was with a patrol that was targeted by an IED (Improved Explosive Device) as I went to remote areas to collect the stories. Hundreds of people wrote their stories to form a unique self portrait of what it's like to be 'human' in a war zone: men and women, soldiers and civilians. The people who wrote their stories revealed extraordinary things about themselves, their lives, their losses and their hopes and fears.

What was the end result? The ‘Diary Room’ walls filled up, hundreds of stories were written, mostly on the coloured cards, but sometimes on scraps of paper, cardboard ripped from ration boxes or scribbled on blank medical forms. One soldier took an empty packet of semolina and wrote ‘Yummy’ on the side. A female medic wrote what it was like to treat her first casualties and save their lives, a chef described cooking and distributing Christmas dinner to hundreds of soldiers scattered about the front line, a bomb disposal expert described what it felt like to go to Afghanistan as a battle casualty replacement for someone who had been injured. Some of those who wrote stories went on to be killed and seriously wounded.

Overall the response I got was staggering and included excerpts such as:

‘Your mind clicks into a gear that you never knew you had, and you bark orders like your life depends on it … and GUESS WHAT: IT DOES!’

‘My abiding memory of Afghanistan? … it will be a humble local farmer who one day took me by surprise by asking after my family. ‘You are far from home. You must miss you family very much. We are very grateful.’

‘The young soldier was brought to me following an IED blast…I didn’t need to ask more questions – his eyes told the whole story. As wide as possible and conveying such a sense of bewilderment, uncertainty and terror that I shall never forget them.’

‘I’m going to write about the day to day struggle of being away … what your girlfriend was wearing last time you saw her, what she did, said, what she smelt like, what she will look like and if anything will have changed while you have been away and if you will put up with the changes when you get back … if you are close to someone that is away out here know that you will always be in their minds because there are two wars being fought, one which is publicised and one which goes on in a soldiers head when everything goes quiet….’

These extraordinary stories describe the war which goes on in a soldier's head when the fighting stops, as in this excerpt below:

The book: 'In Our Own Words'

This campaign is to help produce and publish the book 'In Our Own Words' containing these powerful stories, poems and some of the photographs I took whilst I was in Afghanistan.  I am determined to make this book happen, to help tell the stories of those who wrote from the front line.

It's important that these stories are published and seen by people because they tell the human spirit in war.  These dusty handwritten postcards, written there and then on the front line, provide an insight into this and other conflicts never before seen.  All of the people who wrote their stories had a strong need to write about what it felt like to be there.

Readers of this book will be moved by the stories and poems and what they reveal about the human spirit.  It will also challenge and perhaps change perceptions about war, soldiers and the conflict in Afghanistan.  This story by a Marine in the USMC:

In 2013 the US journal 'War, Literature and the Arts' published a really great abstract about the project at: http://wlajournal.com/25_1/pdf/Eland.pdf

The project has been described by the international press as 'groundbreaking', for more information please read these selected press reviews:

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/asia/the-helmand-project-2361391.html

http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/2012/10/12/soldiers-stories-afghanistan-derekland_n_1960550.html

http://blog.frieze.com/afghanistan-a-war-artists-blog/

Doonesbury also covered the story in the USA in December 2013:

http://gocomics.typepad.com/the_sandbox/

Getting this book published

We need to raise £17,500 to get this unique book published in time for a book launch and exhibition of the original art work in November 2014 at the Middlesbrough Institute of Modern Art in the UK, at: http://www.visitmima.com, below:


These costs break down as follows:

  • Design of UK and US book and ebook versions £4000
  • Printing: two UK print runs and one US print run and ebook production £10,000
  • Promotion, marketing, distribution and storage £3,500

I volunteered to go to Afghanistan on a not for profit basis and the book has a charitable link where proceeds from it's sale will go to the British charity 'Combat Stress', The Veterans's Mental Health Charity, at: http://www.combatstress.org.uk

"A small but significant number of Veterans leave the Armed Forces with psychological wounds. These can lead to depression, phobias, anxiety, relationship problems and, in some cases, Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD).

Combat Stress works with Veterans of the British Armed Forces, and members of the Reserve Forces, through effective treatment and support for mental health problems.

Everything that we do is free of charge to the Veteran. Our work is made possible through statutory, non-statutory and voluntary fundraising. We simply couldn't do what we do without the generosity of the Great British public."  

A Medical Officer write, below:

Funds raised will go into the physical production of a high quality book which will include the images of the handwritten postcards, photographs I took whilst I was in Afghanistan and essays.  I'm working on the book design with Ned Hoste at the fantastic 2H Design in the UK, at: http://www.nedof2h.net  Below is a story written by and Afghan soldier with translation:

We plan to publish an immediate 1000 physical copies of this book for distribution in the UK, with an ebook being available globally.  In our second run we plan for a second UK print run and a physical book in the US.

This book is about being human

2014 is the year when British troops will be withdrawn from Afghanistan.  It is also the 100th anniversary of the start of the First World War.

This book, 'In Our Own Words', will add considerably to the global public's view of war and conflict and what it is like to be involved.  These handwritten postcards are vital and essential in a digital age and need to be read.  There is nothing more honest and revealing than a person's own handwriting, written at a time of stress in a war zone. Readers will be enormously touched and at times shocked by these extraordinary stories, as in this excerpt:

Other Ways You Could Help

Please help by sharing this story using the Indiegogo share tools and enable 'In Our Own Words' to be published.  Many thanks!

If you want more information about me please visit www.derekeland.com or drop me an email to derekeland@hotmail.co.uk if you have any questions.

Many thanks for reading, I'm very grateful if you can help and please spread the word!

Derek
story_txt:
My StoryThis campaign is to raise funds to publish a book of extraordinary handwritten stories written by people on the front line in Afghanistan.  The book tells their stories, it is their self portrait.I'm an artist, based in the UK, and in 2011 I volunteered to go to Afghanistan as a war artist.  I spent a month on the front line and wanted to find a way to get inside the heads of the people I met: soldiers and civilians, Afghan and Western.I asked everyone I met on the front line to write their unique story or a poem on a postcard and collated these stories in a series of 'Diary Rooms'.Here's a TV interview with BFBS which tells the story about how the book came about:http://bit.ly/1cVLJLwOne of the hundreds of postcards written on the front line:In my time on the front line I was shot at and was with a patrol that was targeted by an IED (Improved Explosive Device) as I went to remote areas to collect the stories. Hundreds of people wrote their stories to form a unique self portrait of what it's like to be 'human' in a war zone: men and women, soldiers and civilians. The people who wrote their stories revealed extraordinary things about themselves, their lives, their losses and their hopes and fears.What was the end result? The ‘Diary Room’ walls filled up, hundreds of stories were written, mostly on the coloured cards, but sometimes on scraps of paper, cardboard ripped from ration boxes or scribbled on blank medical forms. One soldier took an empty packet of semolina and wrote ‘Yummy’ on the side. A female medic wrote what it was like to treat her first casualties and save their lives, a chef described cooking and distributing Christmas dinner to hundreds of soldiers scattered about the front line, a bomb disposal expert described what it felt like to go to Afghanistan as a battle casualty replacement for someone who had been injured. Some of those who wrote stories went on to be killed and seriously wounded.Overall the response I got was staggering and included excerpts such as:‘Your mind clicks into a gear that you never knew you had, and you bark orders like your life depends on it … and GUESS WHAT: IT DOES!’‘My abiding memory of Afghanistan? … it will be a humble local farmer who one day took me by surprise by asking after my family. ‘You are far from home. You must miss you family very much. We are very grateful.’‘The young soldier was brought to me following an IED blast…I didn’t need to ask more questions – his eyes told the whole story. As wide as possible and conveying such a sense of bewilderment, uncertainty and terror that I shall never forget them.’‘I’m going to write about the day to day struggle of being away … what your girlfriend was wearing last time you saw her, what she did, said, what she smelt like, what she will look like and if anything will have changed while you have been away and if you will put up with the changes when you get back … if you are close to someone that is away out here know that you will always be in their minds because there are two wars being fought, one which is publicised and one which goes on in a soldiers head when everything goes quiet….’These extraordinary stories describe the war which goes on in a soldier's head when the fighting stops, as in this excerpt below:The book: 'In Our Own Words'This campaign is to help produce and publish the book 'In Our Own Words' containing these powerful stories, poems and some of the photographs I took whilst I was in Afghanistan.  I am determined to make this book happen, to help tell the stories of those who wrote from the front line.It's important that these stories are published and seen by people because they tell the human spirit in war.  These dusty handwritten postcards, written there and then on the front line, provide an insight into this and other conflicts never before seen.  All of the people who wrote their stories had a strong need to write about what it felt like to be there.Readers of this book will be moved by the stories and poems and what they reveal about the human spirit.  It will also challenge and perhaps change perceptions about war, soldiers and the conflict in Afghanistan.  This story by a Marine in the USMC:In 2013 the US journal 'War, Literature and the Arts' published a really great abstract about the project at: http://wlajournal.com/25_1/pdf/Eland.pdfThe project has been described by the international press as 'groundbreaking', for more information please read these selected press also covered the story in the USA in December 2013:http://gocomics.typepad.com/the_sandbox/Getting this book publishedWe need to raise £17,500 to get this unique book published in time for a book launch and exhibition of the original art work in November 2014 at the Middlesbrough Institute of Modern Art in the UK, at: http://www.visitmima.com, below:These costs break down as follows:

story:
My name is R.J. Cavender and I love working with writers and artists.

That's why I'm hosting a writers retreat at the historic and haunting Winchester Mystery House in beautiful San Jose, California - August 11th-13th, 2016.


We'll be staying at the Dolce Hayes Mansion about a 20-minute drive from Winchester House, and it's just another amazing structure, a haunted hideaway place I'm excited to take my guests! 

If you want to join us, simply register by choosing a package here on this campaign and I'll send you the code to receive the group discount rate when you make your hotel reservations.

*Editing Packages and Event Registration does not include your hotel room or transportation fees. Hotel room rates are listed at the bottom of the page.*

But your registration does include all our group discount perks, select editing packages, inclusion on any outings over the weekend, and a guaranteed evening private group flashlight tour of the historic Winchester Mystery House in San Jose.

Join us on our Facebook group page and help us plan the trip together for 2016:


https://www.facebook.com/groups/485666841592733/


We don't want to set a rigid schedule or any programming that would take away from your writing time, since this is a retreat and not a convention or conference. So no dealers room, and very limited programming. Instead we're offering a unique experience with a great group of authors and publishing professionals, in a fantastic spa resort, while visiting a location that's both beautiful and haunted with history.

Each package includes different perks that should fit the need of all authors, whether you're looking for some feedback and a polishing of your work...or you're just needing a great place to write and get away. Let us host your once-in-a-lifetime writing escape, and we'll promise you a great time in a scenic and spooky locale.

For the last few years I've served as the pitch session coordinator for three horror writers conventions, two of which I was also a co-chair. So I've had some solid experience seeing how hosting events operates from the inside. And I put together the sort of trips I know I'd enjoy, inspirational ones that we'll all remember for years to come. I hope you find this idea as exciting as I do, and I truly hope you'll join us for this unique and haunting writing experience! The Winchester Mystery House is truly amazing...and the Dolce Hayes Mansion is truly a sight to behold, as well.






Private evening group flashlight tour tickets for The Winchester Mystery House are available on different perk packages and we'll be visiting the mansion for our tour on Saturday August 13th, sometime after dark (time to be set soon by tour hosts.)

Event registrations/packages for The Winchester Mystery House Writers Retreat are transferable, but non-refundable. If you're not entirely sure if you can make it, please don't register. Or go with the minimum perk. Funds for this event will be spent as they come in, securing rooms, vehicles, and other event expenses. Cancellations will create problems, so commit to this now...don't flake out...and we'll see you then!

Cancellation and refund protocol with the hotel and every last detail to reserve rooms are listed below. Confirmation of perk/package redemption will come directly from me within 24-hours, with instructions on how to redeem your room discounts at The Dolce Hayes Mansion with a group code once you've registered.

We hope you'll join us! -- August 11th-13th, 2016. San Jose, California.



*Hotel Reservation Information* 

https://www.hayesmansion.com/

Attendees will be responsible for phoning in their reservations at The Dolce Hayes Mansion reservation line at (866) 981-3300 Monday – Friday 9am-4pm.

To receive special group rates, attendees must give the group discount code they received upon registering through this campaign.

Individuals will be responsible for paying their own room, tax and incidental charges. Guests will call The Dolce Hayes Mansion to make a reservation from the group room block and may be required to pay a deposit equal to 1 night  room rental.

Dolce Hayes Mansion will provide you with a truly unique and elegant setting for the Horror Writer’s Retreat.  Surrounded by emerald green lawns, gardens of vibrant flowers and towering palm trees, the 115-year-old estate has been transformed into a luxurious hotel-resort, spa and conference center. We have guestrooms available and would love to have your program with us!

Single or Double Occupancy Guestroom Accommodations @ $179.00+ per room, per night:

All guestrooms features a large desk and work areas, multiple phone lines, data-ports, voice-mail messaging, in-room safes, irons and full size ironing boards, robes, blow dryers, coffee makers and refrigerators. 

  • Double Bedded rooms include two queen size beds and two vanity stations
  • Additional guests are $10.00 per person, per night with a maximum of four guests per room
  • Jr. Suite available at $229.00+ per room, per night
  • 115 year old mansion suite available @ $279.00+ per room, per night

Food and Beverage:

We are a full service hotel offering room service, on site restaurants and a bar.

Recreational Facilities: 

Dolce Hayes Mansion’s recreational facilities include an outdoor swimming pool, dry saunas, tennis, volleyball, jogging trail, adjoining 20 acre garden park, and championship golf at nearby courses – including a private championship course that winds through the beautiful Coyote Valley just 10 minutes from The Hayes Mansion.  Special itineraries, such as sightseeing tours of the wine country and the Monterey Peninsula plus several other historical landmarks and shopping areas can be arranged.  These additional programs will be quoted separately based on the type of activities selected.

Concessions:

  • Complimentary wireless Internet
  • Complimentary parking
Group rate of $179.00 per room, per night will be applied to guest’s entire 3-night stay-- August 11th-13th, 2016. Single or double occupancy. 

Individual Cancellation Policy: Individual cancellations received within 30 days of arrival will be charged at the full rate for the entire stay, whether or not the group block commitment has been met or exceeded.

Cutoff Date

The block of rooms will be held until July 12, 2016.  Those rooms not reserved prior to this date will be released for general sale.  Reservations requests after this date will be taken on a space available basis at the higher of the contract rate or rate available at that time.  Should such requests be accepted, such room nights will be credited to your block for purposes of any calculation of attrition.

Room Assignments

The reservation department will attempt to accommodate specific requested room types, but cannot guarantee specific room types, locations, or room numbers.  Requested room types that are not included in the group block will be charged the prevailing  guestroom rate at the time the reservation is made.

Pre/Post Group Rates

The group rates will be honored on space available basis for group attendees up to 3 days before or after the group’s scheduled stay.

Check-in/Check-out/Change Rooms

Check in time begins at 3:00 pm.  Room availability cannot be confirmed until that time.  Check out time is 11:00 am. 

No Shows & Early/Late Departures

Rooms which have been reserved by and whose occupants fail to show on scheduled day of arrival will be billed for the total lodging amount for the contracted time.  Early departures and/or late arrivals will be charged the contracted nightly rate for the entire reserved stay.

Splitting Room Charges

If group attendees are to pay for their own rooms, tax and incidentals AND are sharing rooms, the following must be considered: The Dolce Hayes Mansion is unable to divide certain charges (telephone calls, restaurant charges, incidentals, etc.).  It is the responsibility of the individual whose name appears on the reservation folio to finalize all charges between the occupants BEFORE check out.

It is the responsibility of the group leader or meeting planner to inform all attendees of the above.


We hope you'll join us! -- August 11th-13th, 2016. San Jose, California.




If our campaign goals are met in time, I'm going to include a FREE ticket for  the Rosicrucian Egyptian Museum in San Jose to each one of my event guests and Guest of Honor Authors. I've set up a group tour for 30 of us on Friday afternoon for their guided Expedition Tour. A short museum workshop in mummification will follow.

Architecturally inspired by the Temple of Amon at Karnak, the Rosicrucian Egyptian Museum houses the largest collection of Egyptian artifacts on exhibit in western North America -- including objects from pre dynastic times through Egypt's early Islamic era.

Haunted houses and mummies! Kinda badass, huh?

 http://www.egyptianmuseum.org/


Once we pass our first stretch goal, I'm sure I can think of other creative things to add onto this campaign. First off, though, I'd like to make sure all of my Guest of Honor Authors and event guests have free tickets to both Winchester and Rosicrucian and this I can accomplish once our goal is met. I'll figure out something else neat to do, though, I'm sure...given any extra additional funding!


We hope you'll join us! -- August 11th-13th, 2016. San Jose, California.

story:
What we Are

text Magazine is the idea that poetry should be available everywhere.  You can find a free newspaper or leaflet at most coffee shops, and read some articles or mundane facts, or even jokes. But why not leaf through a little culture, a little creativity?  


text Magazine is a bimonthly magazine available throughout Nanaimo, BC in coffee shops, bookstores, art supply stores, galleries, and more. It's constantly looking for ways to expand, and soon will be available in other cities across Canada.  It's completely free to read, professionally designed, and full of local and international talent.  

Shaleeta Harper from Vancouver Island University started and funded this project, and the first issue came out in September 2014 with lots of help from Philip Gordon, a fellow student.  The third issue, coming out in March 2014, is partially funded by Shaleeta, and partially by advertisers, but she's rapidly going broke, and the magazine can't be maintained without more advertising or more help from people interested in keeping the arts accessible. 

We have hired a skilled advertising manager to help us find the funds for the project, but it will take a little while to make the connections with local businesses.  Also, next March we can apply for funding from the Canada Council for the Arts, and will no longer need to rely completely on advertising and other peoples generosity.  We work completely on a Volunteer basis, and keep running costs as low as possible. Our printer is working at a reduced rate to keep our costs down, and our Graphic Designer is giving us an excellent deal-- even our advertising manager is only working on commission. Regardless though, in print magazines cost quite a lot. 


What We Need 

The magazines bank account currently has 113.00 in it, from the 4000.00 balance Shaleeta donated at the beginning, and the advertisements we've sold over the past six months. Each issue costs about 2000.00, and we have two issues to go until we will have a stable groundwork of advertisers. We do not pay ourselves. We aren't a registered non-profit, but we do this on a completely Volunteer basis. Lets break these costs down a bit:

  • Our Graphic Designer  works very hard to get everything just right, and we pay her about 350.00 each issue. We received many quotes, and this is an amazing deal for her talent. 
  • Our Printer gives us a deal, but after taxes the cost is still approximately 1350.00 to cover paper, ink, and time. 
  • Distribution. Mailing fees are high, and they just keep going up. We need to send a copy of the magazine to each contributor, and maintain levels in each of the local businesses. This costs stamps, envelopes, magazine stands, and transportation fees. This is a minimum of 200.00 an issue, or just 25.00 a week. 
  • Other stuff. Websites, printing costs for advertising sheets, business cards, and banking fees all add up pretty quickly.  These run at least 100.00 an issue, and we haven't even signed up for a submission platform yet. 
If we can't reach our goal, we aren't giving up.  We'll get second jobs around school, or push an issue back a few weeks, or reduce advertising costs again... Any money raised won't go anywhere but this magazine. We want this to happen, and it will. We would just love a little extra help.

What you Get If you Donate:  


Pretty much whatever you want. We want to provide the kind of perks that you want to see, so feel free to send suggestions to textlitmag@gmail.com. Make Philip do a handstand on camera for 10.00 or something. We're game. 
If you have a business you would like to promote, we would also be happy to advertise it within our covers for a very reasonable rate. Please e-mail  textlitmag@gmail.com or shaleetaharper@gmail.com to discuss that. 

The Impact

You aren't just providing artistic reading material for people in Nanaimo who might not otherwise look at poetry and art, you're also helping artists and writers.  New and established authors and artists can submit their work to us, and gain valuable publishing credits, plus be read by more of the public. If we can branch out to larger cities, we can provide this service to more people.

Shaleeta and Philip have both worked on Portal magazine successfully in the past, and both are in their final years of the Creative Writing program at Vancouver Island University. 

Risks & Challenges

Challenges to the magazine are many, but we've already surmounted most of them.  Getting acknowledgement and submissions is a big step, but we received nearly a thousand various submissions for issue two thanks to Philip Gordon's social media expertise. 

Another hardship is finding places to distribute... but we've reached 16 locations in just two months, and are adding more every week or so. We've received only positive comments so far. 

The biggest hurdle is funding.  Despite efforts to sell advertising, most companies use large companies to sell ads, rather than selling to small local businesses. We've been reaching out, and have some purchased, but nothing large enough to keep us going.  We have reached all the goals to receive funding from the Canada Council for the Arts, except for the length of time we've been publising. We just need to maintain the magazine until the application is accepted.  (March 1st 2016) 

Other Ways You Can Help

Hey, maybe you're as broke as us! That's okay, we understand. Maybe instead you could help us by sharing this campaign around as much as possible?
story_txt:
What we Aretext Magazine is the idea that poetry should be available everywhere.  You can find a free newspaper or leaflet at most coffee shops, and read some articles or mundane facts, or even jokes. But why not leaf through a little culture, a little creativity?  

text Magazine is a bimonthly magazine available throughout Nanaimo, BC in coffee shops, bookstores, art supply stores, galleries, and more. It's constantly looking for ways to expand, and soon will be available in other cities across Canada.  It's completely free to read, professionally designed, and full of local and international talent.  Shaleeta Harper from Vancouver Island University started and funded this project, and the first issue came out in September 2014 with lots of help from Philip Gordon, a fellow student.  The third issue, coming out in March 2014, is partially funded by Shaleeta, and partially by advertisers, but she's rapidly going broke, and the magazine can't be maintained without more advertising or more help from people interested in keeping the arts accessible. 
We have hired a skilled advertising manager to help us find the funds for the project, but it will take a little while to make the connections with local businesses.  Also, next March we can apply for funding from the Canada Council for the Arts, and will no longer need to rely completely on advertising and other peoples generosity.  We work completely on a Volunteer basis, and keep running costs as low as possible. Our printer is working at a reduced rate to keep our costs down, and our Graphic Designer is giving us an excellent deal-- even our advertising manager is only working on commission. Regardless though, in print magazines cost quite a lot. 

What We Need 
 The magazines bank account currently has 113.00 in it, from the 4000.00 balance Shaleeta donated at the beginning, and the advertisements we've sold over the past six months. Each issue costs about 2000.00, and we have two issues to go until we will have a stable groundwork of advertisers. We do not pay ourselves. We aren't a registered non-profit, but we do this on a completely Volunteer basis. Lets break these costs down a bit:  Our Graphic Designer  works very hard to get everything just right, and we pay her about 350.00 each issue. We received many quotes, and this is an amazing deal for her talent. 

Our Printer gives us a deal, but after taxes the cost is still approximately 1350.00 to cover paper, ink, and time. 
Distribution. Mailing fees are high, and they just keep going up. We need to send a copy of the magazine to each contributor, and maintain levels in each of the local businesses. This costs stamps, envelopes, magazine stands, and transportation fees. This is a minimum of 200.00 an issue, or just 25.00 a week. 
Other stuff. Websites, printing costs for advertising sheets, business cards, and banking fees all add up pretty quickly.  These run at least 100.00 an issue, and we haven't even signed up for a submission platform yet. 

If we can't reach our goal, we aren't giving up.  We'll get second jobs around school, or push an issue back a few weeks, or reduce advertising costs again... Any money raised won't go anywhere but this magazine. We want this to happen, and it will. We would just love a little extra help.

We've been reaching out, and have some purchased, but nothing large enough to keep us going.  We have reached all the goals to receive funding from the Canada Council for the Arts, except for the length of time we've been publising. story:
Welcome to the Senyaza Series


On our Earth, the Flood destroyed the nephilim. But in the Earth of Senyaza, the nephilim averted the Flood...

Welcome to the world of the Senyaza Series, where the illicit human-blooded offspring of angels and demons and gods have organized into the powerful Senyaza Corporation. Together they’ve worked for millennia to secretly protect humanity from the celestial powers that crave dominion, while securing themselves against an uncertain future. But after centuries of a supernatural status quo, the jagged wheels of fate have once again begun to turn, with two little girls as the winding key.

The children are sheltered, innocent, but those who recognize what they are will move mountains and burn cities to control them. Enter Marley Claviger: an ordinary woman who finds herself in an extraordinary position. When the girls come into her care, she must become the guardian of the children of revelation… no matter what she discovers.

To date, six volumes of the Senyaza Series have been released, with many more stories yet to come. Rather than following a single protagonist, the Senyaza Series is the story of a rapidly changing world. While it has many obvious elements of urban fantasy, as time passes, more and more cyberpunk and science fiction elements will (have already) come into play.

Some of the protagonists are nephilim. Some are human, some are monsters. A few of them are something else. All of them are interesting, complex characters with unique voices you'll enjoy hearing in audiobook format.
 

What We Need & What You Get

We're producing, at the very least, the audiobook of Matchbox Girls, the first volume of the Senyaza Series.  That's Marley's first book and you can see above for an idea of what it's about!

The basic perk for this fundraiser is a previously-Patreon-exclusive short story from the Senyaza universe, presented in audio and ebook format. Both the short story audio and the full-length audiobook(s) will be narrated by Sarah Sampino. The funding goal represents what's required to pay for her narration and the first audiobook's production. Practically speaking, some percentage of the funding will go to perk fulfillment, but what percentage depends on you!

Further funding will go toward promoting the first audiobook and producing later books. While exact values vary based on fulfillment requirements, if we reached $10,000, I believe that would cover all six books currently released.

Other available perks include:

  • (Limited) A free copy of the Matchbox Girls audiobook once it's complete.
  • I make digital art! I'll do a Senyaza-related commission for you and send you a high quality print! Or you can choose a print of previous (Senyaza and unrelated) works! Here's a gallery. 
  • I write! I'll write a short story about the Senyaza character or characters of your choice.
  • I write more! I'll name a character after you in an upcoming Senyaza novel.
  • Signed paperbacks! Get all six currently released paperbacks for below the cover price. (US only). Ebooks included.
  • Step aboard! Get all six of the Senyaza ebooks in the format of your choice for a limited-time low price!

The Impact

I love audiobooks, and more and more, I'm not alone. For many people, it's the primary way they keep reading good books in a busy life. The Senyaza stories are fun and entertaining reads with depth, and I'm excited about bringing them to a whole new audience. Your help will keep this ship sailing.

Risks & Challenges

If something comes up, I'll do my best to get perks out in a timely fashion anyhow. Not only have I already made arrangements with Sarah for the audio, I've researched printers for the art and tested out the shipping line for the paperbacks. Production prices may change, but I've planned some flex in my costs too. We can do this!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, you can still help.

  • Let people know about these cool books you've discovered, especially if they enjoy shows like Supernatural or American Gods.
  • If you've already read a Senyaza book, write a review,
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Goal Reached... Now What?

In the spirit of the holidays, I have two announcements about the “All Ways” campaign to make! ☃️ 

In the spirit of giving, I will be donating 50% of all funds over my goal to the charity ASAN (Autistic Self-Advocacy Network). ASAN’s goal is to empower Autistic people to take control of their individual lives as well as providing a space to organize as part of a common community that needs to be a part of the disability rights conversation. ?

In the spirit of laughter, if I raise $8,000 in my Indiegogo campaign, I will film myself reading a chapter of “All Ways” while eating hot pepper. ?️ Those of you who know me know that I am famously a “Plain Jane” when it comes to the food I eat, (Yes, I will order a non-toasted plain bagel.) so this will probably blow my taste buds out. ?

 

Story of My Book

All Ways is about two brothers, York and Andreas, who go on a cross-country road trip together. Both brothers are coming to terms with how they feel about “adulthood” in different ways and building upon their sibling bond before they part ways, as York goes off to college in the fall. While on their journey, they’ll also be grappling with a “missing piece” of themselves that they’ll never find: their Autistic identity. To its core, this book is about their sibling relationship, finding their independence, and growing up without knowing an important piece about themselves. 

My name is Kelly Coons and I am the author of All Ways, which is inspired largely by my late diagnosis of autism. I wrote this book because:
  • When I was a kid, most of the books I was recommended about autism were really just about a neurotypical character “learning something” from an Autistic person. They usually weren’t about the Autistic person or even autism in general, and I wanted to go against that narrative by having Autistic characters front and center in this story. 
  • The Autistic characters I was introduced to typically already had their diagnosis and the tools they needed to help understand how they interact with the world. Diagnosis as a child is not typical for many Autistic people, including women, non-binary people, and people of color. Early diagnosis is a privilege that not everyone has access to, and I wanted to reflect that in this book (especially since that was my own personal experience).
  • I wanted to tackle some well-known stereotypes about Autistic people and show how they can inflict harm — like how the “genius” trope creates a very hard standard for Autistic people to live up to.
  • I think, during this era of racial reckoning, people are cognizant (or forced to be cognizant) of their implicit biases. Thus, I think this is a great time to share this book to start a dialogue and tackle peoples’ biases about autism and Autistic people. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will learn about the rich interpersonal lives of Autistic people and reevaluate your own biases about autism. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to learn alongside York and Andreas as their relationships evolve and they discover more about who they are.

You’ll follow big brother York as he plans and executes a road trip for his younger brother, Andreas—who loves maps!—to visit the college he’ll be attending in the fall. They’ll be making a long trek from Ridgecrest, California all the way to Albany, New York, with tons of stops along the way! York is afraid of leaving his brother for four years and really wants this road trip to be a way for them to bond before they’re separated. Also, they want prove a point to their mother—who thinks they’re way over their heads—that they can do this. On this road trip, they’ll make new friends, confront painful memories, and learn how to transition into their new lives apart and plan for their future together. Of course, the kicker is neither of them have been diagnosed with autism yet—they know they’re “different” (like Andreas being non-verbal), but they don’t know why—and that provides some challenges as they navigate this cross-country adventure together. 

You will love this book if you identify as Autistic or love an Autistic person, you’re itching to go on a fun road trip, or you have a soft spot for wholesome family bonding.

All Ways speaks to teens and people in the Autistic community who want to grapple with autism and interpersonal relationships in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that All Ways inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:
  • How are sibling bonds shaped by abusive/neglectful parents?
  • How does one seek community when they lack language about their identity?
  • How does autism and toxic notions about masculinity intersect?
  • How do Autistic people interact with each other and other people?
  • Can a book “about autism” really be about autism when the characters don’t know they are Autistic?
I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing autism and interpersonal relationships will change us all for the better. 
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this spring.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook.

When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition.

When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!
 

About the Author

Kelly Coons is an English major at Smith College. She loves reading classic books and re-imagining them as if they were modern stories.

Kelly was diagnosed with autism spectrum disorder when she was 13. As such, she had a coming-of-age story that was mostly deemed as neurotypical. However, she always felt isolated and, until her diagnosis, believed that she was to blame. After her diagnosis, she became passionate about disability advocacy and promoting Autistic pride. She believes that people are disabled less by their bodies and brains and more by society.

Kelly has wanted to live in the Pokemon world since she was 7 years old. She has also plunged into a Dungeons & Dragons addiction — please send help!

For more information, you can connect with Kelly Coons at kelly.coons00@gmail.com, Kelly Coons on Facebook, Kelly Coons on LinkedIn, and kellycoonswritesabout_____ on Instagram.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #AllWaysWednesday and #AllWays and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Kelly Coons

story:
HOW DID THIS RACE START?

Writing is our passion, and after we became parents of a baby born with a CHD (Congenital Heart Defect) and needing an open heart surgery at 4 days old, everything became more meaningful. Writing stories for children became our new focus. We were running too much and going too fast, but this cause slowed us down! Creativity and imagination are great ways to bond with kids and help them develop their skills. That's our mission!

 THE STORY

Once a year in the Seasons' World, a big race is held. Each season has its own racer: Annie Springs, Sam Summers, Kim Falls and Will Winters. During the race, one of the racers will have to choose between winning or saving their world...

 THE CHARACTERS

Annie is a colorful bunny and she drives an Easter basket car, she represents Spring. 

Kim is a pumpkin-headed girl who drives a Thanksgiving Turkey car, representing Autumn.

Sam  is a sun-headed boy with palm tree hair who drives a Dolphin car, representing Summer. 

Will is a snowman with reindeer ears and Santa-inspired clothing who drives a Christmas tree car, representing Winter. 

 

WHY SUPPORT THIS PROJECT?

  • Inspiring, imaginative story with a moral lesson about friendship 
  • Fun and colorful illustrations
  • Limited, exclusive and personalized rewards!
  • Support independent writers and illustrators
  • Help spread awareness about CHD (Congenital Heart Defects)

 

THE TEAM

Gabriel Rhopers - Author, Writer, initial concept designs.

Andressa Rhopers - Co-Writer, Portuguese and English

Emily Lescas - English Reviewer

Carmen Ewing - English Reviewer

Max Andrade - Illustrations

Vinícius SQ and Daniel SR - Initial designs and Colors

Be part of this project! Choose a reward and be our hero!

Share with your friends!
story_txt:
HOW DID THIS RACE START?
Writing is our passion, and after we became parents of a baby born with a CHD (Congenital Heart Defect) and needing an open heart surgery at 4 days old, everything became more meaningful. Writing stories for children became our new focus. We were running too much and going too fast, but this cause slowed us down! Creativity and imagination are great ways to bond with kids and help them develop their skills. That's our mission!
