story:
My name is Grant Dever and I am the author of Lead The Future. I wrote this book because I want to empower the next generation of leaders to solve the big challenges that humanity faces.
 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover your own leadership ability, frameworks for decision-making, and the spark to get started. In this book, I hope to instill you with the same passion and optimism that I have for our future. And then, ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you start tackling the challenges that keep you awake at night.


In this book, you'll learn how to lead others through an optimistic vision and how you can prepare yourself to thrive in our uncertain, dynamic world.
 
  • Emerging industries - The world's first trillionaire may have already launched their revolutionary product. Technology is rapidly changing our world and creating high-leverage opportunities that previously were not possible.
  • Decision-making - Explore frameworks and tools that will help you to cut through the noise. Featuring stories and ideas from Ben Horowitz, Nicholas Nassim Taleb, and Tina Seelig.
  • 80/20 Principle - We do not live in a world of averages but a world of extremes. This book will provide you with the information you need to create simple systems that will empower you to focus your attention and energy to solve the problems that you’re passionate about.

 

You will love this book if you are tired of doom and gloom and want to lead others to improve your community and solve problems, big and small.

Lead The Future is a non-fiction book that speaks to high school students and other emerging leaders who have big aspirations and an interest in leading others to create a more prosperous and human future.

 

The Book - Lead The Future


The book is written in 4 Parts....

Part One- Covers the story of an unconventional, revolutionary leader who you likely have never heard of. We will explore the timeless principles of leadership and how technology is magnifying the impact that individual leaders can have on our world.

We will:
  • Learn principles that are critical to leadership, as identified by the research of James M. Kouzes and Barry Z. Posner, the authors of The Truth About Leadership and numerous other classic texts on leadership.
  • Explore what it means to be a leader and how you can get started and actively hone your skills by reframing how you think about leadership.

Part Two- Will dive deep into the mental models of a few of the most influential, promising, and controversial leaders of our time.


We will:
  • Consider the world from both a deterministic and probabilistic lens and how this should impact your decision-making process.
  • Contemplate lessons and applications of, Co-Founder of WIRED Magazine and famed technologist, Kevin Kelly’s essay 1,000 True Fans and expand on his ideas by synthesizing it with Kanye West’s model of self-love.
  • Interrogate the merits of pessimism, the risk of widespread cynicism, and the opportunity presented by leaders’ choosing to wield optimistic visions for our future.

Part Three- Will explore the traps and challenges that come with assuming the responsibility of leadership.
  • I will share my own personal struggles adapting to the responsibilities of leadership. We will explore various strategies to avoid common problems that leaders face.
  • We will reconsider our relationship with failure and present tactics you can employ to build a culture that promotes risk-taking and open dialogue.

Part Four- Will explore a variety of topics that are relevant to the demands placed on a leader and the habits that empower leaders to focus their energy and attention on their passions.

The world is a complicated place and, with the internet, there’s a near infinite stream of pro tips and best-practices. This section will give you the 10% of information you need to get 90% of the desired results. Enabling you to save your attention and energy for working on your projects and create habits which will enable you to avoid burnout.
 

To conclude, we will outline a clear path forward and associated tactics to end this book, not only calling for individual action, but as an opportunity for definite optimists to connect and pursue collaborations.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2019.
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter.

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

 


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
 

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • One-on-one video call to discuss your ideas, answer your questions, and connect
  • Interview to be featured on my podcast/Interview to be featured on your podcast
  • In-person private talk & Q&A 
  • And more...

     

About the Author
 

Grant is a high-energy, creative leader who served as Student Body President or Class President throughout his studies at the University of Rochester. Following graduation, Grant helped create and launch the Barbara J. Burger iZone at the University of Rochester Libraries, a program, space, and community designed to empower students to solve the problems that keep them awake at night.

Grant has always been an optimist and dreamer. He views strangers as future friends and loves few things more than listening to or interviewing someone about their passions. Grant fervently believes that we can create a more prosperous and human future and he wants to collaborate with and empower others to build it.

If you’ve ever been in a room with Grant, you’d know it because he’s a ‘hear him before you see him’ kinda guy. He loves making others laugh, but often tells Dad jokes, solely for his own amusement. Grant aspires to become a polyglot and achieve conversational proficiency in German, Mandarin, and Spanish.

For more information you can connect with Grant at grantdever@gmail.com or at @grantadever on twitter or Instagram.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help
 

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #LeadTheFutureBook and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

     

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Grant

story:
THIS GIRL IS SUPER

 

Hello culture vultures! 

My name is Tree, and amongst the variety of paths I've taken in my life - Musician, Dreaming Guide, Death Doula and Tarot Reader - I also danced down the acid and amphetamine path as a young club kid from 1990-1995.

Recently I was going through a bunch of old boxes and crates in my house, and I unearthed all of my old club land rave scrapbooks and photo albums. As I sat laughing and reminiscing over the wildly colourful fashions , bugged out expressions and enlarged pupils of the ravers in my collection, It dawned on me that these photos were of some value. I had captured a glimpse of the underground 90's club scene, unique fashion tribe and youth culture that really hasn't been too well documented as this was pre-internet, pre-smart phone, and pre-digital cameras! 

As a young raver between 1990 - 1995, I would bring disposable cameras to clubs, raves and festivals and document the colourful and creative kids that would attend. Travelling around the North American rave circuit,  I snapped images of club kids throughout North America including: NYC, Toronto, Tucson and Montreal. I chose to bring plastic disposable cameras because often I would end up on some kind of trip and end up losing the damn things!  But the disposable cameras that did survive the night would end up getting developed and I could then recall all the moments of drug fuelled bliss, ecstatic dancing and the rough comedowns. Once the film was developed , I would then cut out the images of the ravers and glue them on cosmic backgrounds that I found in science magazines. This was pre-Photoshop!  This analogue collage effect was the only way in which I could capture the feel and spirit of the time: spaced out kids looking to escape the cynical world into a cartoon cosmic universe.

 

THE BOOK 

£1,000 is being raised for a beautiful self published hard cover coffee table book on North American Club Kids:  1990-1995.  The book is perfect for those who are fans of subculture, clubland, rave, style tribes, early 90's fashion, youth culture, acid, hair dye, techno and personal archives.

The book will be 104 pages (tbc) and include a photographic archive of Tree's raver club kid scrapbooks and albums: 

- North American club kids between 1990-1995

- Rave flyers & Memorabilia 

- Tree's big eye acid art

- Tree's 1990's journal entries

Donate £20 as a pre-order for the book and receive it via post when it has been published! 

We aim to publish a very limited first edition run of 100 books.  If we do not reach our funding goal then we will publish a smaller print run of the book. 

 

Spread the word out in club land!  Share this campaign! 

See you at the book launch!

Tree Carr

xx

story:
Thanks to you, our supporters, this crowdfunder has reached its target!

We really appreciate all your support.

But we want to do more, so we are adding a stretch target for our campaign 

If we can raise another £300 and get to 120% of our initial funding goal we would have the funds to record a dual language audio version of the poem.

The Somali poet Weedhsame and his poet translator Daljit Nagra will be together in the UK this October. This gives us a unique opportunity to make an audio recording of 'Catastrophe' featuring the voices of these two poets.

If we are successful and reach this stretch goal we will make the recorded poem available for free online for everyone to enjoy.

So if you haven’t joined in yet it's not too late, or if you have donated and you want to help us get the project to the next level this is your chance.

Even penny you donate helps us bring this awe inspiring poem to new audiences across the UK.

Read more about this awe inspiring poem below.

You are people who can succeed.

You are people who can build a home.

You are people in your own right.

Catastrophe is an electrifying poem by the Somali poet Xasan Daahir Weedhsame. A howl of anguish about the displacement of the Somali people, it offers a provocation to western Europe, unable to hold focus on the devastating refugee crisis playing out on our shores, and a message of hope to all who have had to flee their homes to seek sanctuary across the sea.

In October the Poetry Translation Centre will publish Catastrophe as a dual-language poem-poster, including a dazzling English translation by British poet Daljit Nagra and scholar Martin Orwin. The poster will also feature a specially commissioned illustration by the artist Bryan Talbot.

How can you help?

We want to get this poem into the hands of as many people as possible, particularly young people. Our translation and artist costs are supported by Arts Council England, our core funder, but we need your support to get this unique project to the printer!

Our initial target is £1,500 - this will enable us to print 500 copies. Every pound raised over this target will help us to reach more schools up and down the country with reading copies and classroom resources.

What rewards are we offering?

You can choose a perk by hovering over the descriptions on the right-hand side of this page. The simplest way to help is by pre-ordering your own copy of Catastrophe for £7 that we will post out to you on the day of publication. For £15 we are also offering invitations to our launch event in London, featuring Weedhsame and Daljit Nagra.

You can order a Somali poetry package for £50, which includes Catastrophe, two PTC chapbooks, a book on Somalia’s greatest living poet Maxamed Ibraahin Warsame Hadraawi, and a new collection (hot off the press!) by UK-based poet Asha Lul Mohamud Yusuf. This is a great way to discover a rich, living poetic tradition.

Become a Poem Seeder for £100: get all these other benefits, plus we will provide a UK-based class or youth group with a set of Catastrophe poem-posters and reading resources on your behalf.

We will also be offering Bryan Talbot’s original artwork and sketches for pledges between £30 and £350. Bryan Talbot has been described as the ‘David Bowie of British Comics’ and his sticking artwork has appeared in 2000AD, Batman: Legends of the Dark Knight, Neil Gaiman’s Sandman and in the Costa Award-winning Dotter Of Her Father’s Eyes. His next artwork could be hanging on your wall.

Why is this project so important?

Last year when images of the mass migration began to fill the UK news Weedhsame’s poem took on a new significance.

Catastrophe was written about the ‘Tahriib’ or sea migration, the search for a better life in another country. This perilous journey is familiar to most Somalis living in Europe, and its impact looms large in Somali Culture. Weedhsame’s poem has resonated with Somali audiences at home and in the diaspora, cementing his reputation as one of the finest poets of his generation.

By capturing this story, laying out both the human tragedies and great national cost of this mass migration, Catastrophe offers a vital new perspective to the ongoing refugee crisis.

This poem gives a voice to the nameless people we see in news reports about mass migration.

Getting this poem out to young people and a range of communities across the UK will help reawaken awareness of the biggest mass migration of people Europe has seen since the second World War.

Sounds good. Can you pull it off?

We need to get the word out far and wide to get this project to reach our funding goal. Much of this project is already secure: the poem itself and Daljit and Martin's translation is already complete, while Bryan is hard at work on the artwork.

Now we just need your help to get it to the printers and out into the world.

The Poetry Translation Centre has been translating poetry from around the world into English for over ten years. We have a solid track record of finding the most significant poets from across the globe. We work collaboratively with leading translators and the best UK poets to introduce these unheard voices to English-speaking audiences.

With this project, the biggest challenge we face is helping the poem find its audience. Working with Daljit Nagra, Martin Orwin and  Bryan Talbot, all big names in their fields, will help us reach more people. We have strong ties with the Somali community and will be running events with the poets and Bryan Talbot in October to help get the word out.

What if we fall short of the target?

If we don’t reach our full funding target we will still be able to use your contribution to fund a smaller print run and hold workshops with Weedhsame when he visits the UK in October for Somali Week.

What else can I do to help?

Please donate if you can, and otherwise help us shout about this project on Twitter and Facebook. Tell your WhatsApp friends, share this story online and over coffee. Let the world know about:

  • This urgent, poem telling the story of the Refugee Crisis from a new perspective
  • Our big-name collaborators, including BBC Radio 4 poet in residence Daljit Nagra and Bryan Talbot, the ‘David Bowie of British Comics’
  • The chance to bring this poem to classrooms and youth groups across the UK, broadening perspectives and sparking awareness

You can let us know about schools or other groups that might want to receive copies Catastrophe in October. Maybe you know of a library or community group that is celebrating Black History Month. Get in touch and let us know.

Thank you for reading about our project. Find out more about our work at poetrytranslation.org.

For £15 we are also offering invitations to our launch event in London, featuring Weedhsame and Daljit Nagra.
You can order a Somali poetry package for £50, which includes Catastrophe, two PTC chapbooks, a book on Somalia’s greatest living poet Maxamed Ibraahin Warsame Hadraawi, and a new collection (hot off the press!) by UK-based poet Asha Lul Mohamud Yusuf. This is a great way to discover a rich, living poetic tradition.
Become a Poem Seeder for £100: get all these other benefits, plus we will provide a UK-based class or youth group with a set of Catastrophe poem-posters and reading resources on your behalf.
We will also be offering Bryan Talbot’s original artwork and sketches for pledges between £30 and £350. Bryan Talbot has been described as the ‘David Bowie of British Comics’ and his sticking artwork has appeared in 2000AD, Batman: Legends of the Dark Knight, Neil Gaiman’s Sandman and in the Costa Award-winning Dotter Of Her Father’s Eyes. His next artwork could be hanging on your wall.
Why is this project so important?
Last year when images of the mass migration began to fill the UK news Weedhsame’s poem took on a new significance.
Catastrophe was written about the ‘Tahriib’ or sea migration, the search for a better life in another country. This perilous journey is familiar to most Somalis living in Europe, and its impact looms large in Somali Culture. Weedhsame’s poem has resonated with Somali audiences at home and in the diaspora, cementing his reputation as one of the finest poets of his generation.
By capturing this story, laying out both the human tragedies and great national cost of this mass migration, Catastrophe offers a vital new perspective to the ongoing refugee crisis.
This poem gives a voice to the nameless people we see in news reports about mass migration.
Getting this poem out to young people and a range of communities across the UK will help reawaken awareness of the biggest mass migration of people Europe has seen since the second World War.
Sounds good. Can you pull it off?
We need to get the word out far and wide to get this project to reach our funding goal. Much of this project is already secure: the poem itself and Daljit and Martin's translation is already complete, while Bryan is hard at work on the artwork.
Now we just need your help to get it to the printers and out into the world.
The Poetry Translation Centre has been translating poetry from around the world into English for over ten years. We have a solid track record of finding the most significant poets from across the globe. We work collaboratively with leading translators and the best UK poets to introduce these unheard voices to English-speaking audiences.
With this project, the biggest challenge we face is helping the poem find its audience. Working with Daljit Nagra, Martin Orwin and  Bryan Talbot, all big names in their fields, will help us reach more people. We have strong ties with the Somali community and will be running events with the poets and Bryan Talbot in October to help get the word out.
What if we fall short of the target?
If we don’t reach our full funding target we will still be able to use your contribution to fund a smaller print run and hold workshops with Weedhsame when he visits the UK in October for Somali Week.
What else can I do to help?
Please donate if you can, and otherwise help us shout about this project on Twitter and Facebook. Tell your WhatsApp friends, share this story online and over coffee. Let the world know about:

This urgent, poem telling the story of the Refugee Crisis from a new perspective
Our big-name collaborators, including BBC Radio 4 poet in residence Daljit Nagra and Bryan Talbot, the ‘David Bowie of British Comics’
The chance to bring this poem to classrooms and youth groups across the UK, broadening perspectives and sparking awareness


You can let us know about schools or other groups that might want to receive copies Catastrophe in October. Maybe you know of a library or community group that is celebrating Black History Month. Get in touch and let us know.
Thank you for reading about our project. Find out more about our work at poetrytranslation.org.

story:
Help us SPLIT THIS ROCK!

We are a diverse group of queer & gender fabulous Arab and Arab American poets, artists and activists, holding different religions, nationalities and migration stories.  We've been invited to present a Group Reading & Workshop @ Split This Rock, the nation’s premier social justice focused poetry festival!

Struggle, Resilience & Transformation: Queer Arabs in the Diaspora
Andrea Assaf, Janine Mogannam, Amir Rabiyah
2 PM, Saturday, March 29 @ Human Rights Campaign, Room 2

At Split This Rock, in addition to performing our poetry, we are committed to facilitating inclusive dialogue, fostering creativity, and holding an affirming space for people living on the intersections of race, class, disabilities, gender, sexuality, war, and immigration.

As queer and gender non-conforming Arabs, we want to represent ourselves, since we often are spoken for. Split This Rock is a great opportunity to connect with and support other artists who want to tell their own stories through poetry.


What We Need

We are asking you, OUR COMMUNITY, for your support. 

We need to raise $5000 by March 20

Your donations will help make this trip, reading & workshop possible!

Your contributions will go toward airfare, transportation, housing, and festival registration, as well as artists’ fees and a small per diem for food and other associated costs.  No contribution is too small!  And the PERKS are fabulous!!  (SEE SIDEBAR)

Why It Matters

As queer Arabs / Arab Americans, many people and institutions attempt to speak for us. As people with a broad spectrum of identities, we often move through society with parts of ourselves made hyper-visible, and others invisible. At Split This Rock we will share our stories from our own perspectives and experiences.  Through the sharing of our poetry and the questions we wrestle with in our lives and creative work, we hope to connect with folks from many varied communities, including other artists of color, queer folks and allies.  

Many of us share similar histories of negotiating multiple identities, colonization, intersecting oppressions and displacements. Our presentation will create a space for participants to reflect on their own histories and identities. Through this collective act of witnessing, and shared reflection, we hope to build a sense of compassion and connection between us and all attendees, which we will bring back with us into our communities as we work towards recognition and social justice.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word!  Facebook, Tweet, Google, re-post, re-tweet ... Call friends, send friends, text friends ... Encourage everyone you know to donate, or to MATCH your donation!


About the Poets

Andrea Assaf is a performer, writer, director, & cultural organizer. The founder & Artistic Director of Art2Action, she has a Masters degree in Performance Studies &a BFA in Acting, both from NYU. Andrea's performance work ranges from original, interdisciplinary solo &collaborative productions, to spoken word &community-based arts.  She’s published her poetry in the U.S.. Mexico, England and Poland, most recently in Mizna: Prose, Poetry & Art Exploring Arab America.

Janine Mogannam is a poet, radical librarian, &second-generation San Franciscan, by way of Palestine. She is a three-time VONA Voices workshop alumna & winner of the Friends of the San Francisco Public Library’s PoetsEleven poetry contest. Her work has been featured in 580 Split, Kweli Journal, & is forthcoming in Dismantle: An Anthology of Writing from the VONA/Voices Writing Workshop.

Amir Rabiyah is a queer, mixed, disabled & two-spirit writer currently based in Oakland, California. His work has been published in Mizna, Gender Outlaws: The Next Generation, Collective Brightness: LGBTIQ Poets on Faith, Religion & Spirituality, Troubling the Line: Trans & Gender Queer Poetry &Poetics and more. He was a student/teacher/poet in June Jordan's Poetry for the People program at UC Berkeley in 2008-2009.



THIS CAMPAIGN IS SPONSORED BY ART2ACTION INC.

www.art2action.org

story:
Short Summary

Bernadette Mayer's revolutionary first books are long out of print, available in the caches of  the secondary market at high costs, by loan or via single-page facsimiles online at Eclipse. While these early books have played an oceanic role in the formation of generations of poets, they are difficult to secure, meaning that opportunities to read, let along examine comprehensively, these books prove challenging at best, largely reducing their operative life to rumor and/or partial engagement, such as may be derived from New Directions' Bernadette Mayer Reader. This has left a woeful gap in the continuum of American experimental poetry, which Station Hill proposes to bridge.   

Eating the Colors of a Lineup of Words: The Early Books of Bernadette Mayer will include (listed below by order of publication date):

  • Story (1968)
  • Moving (1971)
  • Ceremony Latin (1964) (1975)
  • Poetry (1976) 
  • Eruditio Ex Memoria (1977)
  • The Golden Book of Words (1978)
  • Red Book in Three Parts (2002)

& (BONUS!)

  • "The Old Style is Finding Out Something About a Whole New Set of Possibilities," an unpublished collection roughly coincident with Story and partially published in Poetry.

[You may note two books are missing: Memory (1976), which is forthcoming with Black Widow Press; and Studying Hunger (1975), which was largely superseded by Station Hill's own 2011 publication of the totality of that work in Studying Hunger Journals.]

Eating the Colors... will be a landmark publication, and one we hope may act like a lightning rod, bringing focus to the energy that's swirled for decades around Mayer's early works. In this, we hope to organize not just a new vista of reading excitation but also a place of instigation for the current generation and those to come to engage, get the juice and, by the grace of Mayer's preternaturally realized first poetic forays, carve fresh arcs of devotion to the Sphere of Atmos. 

What We Need... 

We currently have all the books except "The Old Style..."  in a single digital document. To make the book, we need $7,300, which includes an initial print run for 500 copies. To meet this goal, we are asking you to help fund about half (1/2) the production costs, or $3,700 - but can take more! While Station Hill could well use this support to defray costs, we also want to spread the chance to show up at this important place.

Below are the necessary tasks with percentages of the total based on a work rate of $15 per hour marked in fractions of the whole (like they used to calculate whale-boat crew shares): 

  • Produce digital copy of the "The Old Style..." manuscript (1/49)
  • Reconcile transcript of all seven books with originals (1/60)
  • Negotiate integration of "The Old Style..." within chronology (essentially what's new vs. what appeared in Poetry) (1/49)
  • Build tables of contents & front matter (1/243)
  • Build index of titles and first lines (1/121)
  • Typeset contents and cover of book (1/3) 
  • Print Eating the Colors (initial run of 500 copies, with POD delivery thereafter) (1/4)
  • Promote Eating the Colors as it deserves (1/7)
  • Pay off author advances, so Mayer may collect royalties on sales immediately  (1/7)

You will note the bulk of costs are printing and design/typesetting as well as promotion, which may in part include funding Mayer on some trips to read.

....& The Great Things You May Get

We will include in this volume a dedicated page on which the people or organizations that helped fund Eating the Colors... are listed, with an acknowledgment of our thanks. The cost for this is $100, which seems a bargain relative to this project's importance and its infinite "shelf life." Or you may preorder  ($40, inc. shipping),  to receive a signed copy of Eating the Colors... when it is published. Or, you may take both paths, which means a reduction for the signed book in which now your name/organization appears ($135, inc. shipping). 

The Impact

"Resting
three men rest. They move.
Men talking
a girl looking at a box
There are three men in a boat. They work"

-from "Three Men," Poetry

Other Ways You Can Help

Not all of you will be able or want to assist financially, but nevertheless you may get the word out! 

Please pass the word!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Breve reseña

El Festival de Globos de Cantoya,  comenzó en 2004  en la Comunidad Autónoma de Cherán. Una comunidad situada en el corazón neurálgico de la región p’urhépecha en el estado de Michoacán, los globos elaborados de papel china, han estado ligados a la convivencia de la comunidad, niñez y juventud principalmente, quienes los elaboran con la sola idea de verlos surcar el cielo después de un día de lluvia, un suceso mágico que divierte a toda la comunidad.

Desde 2005 y gracias al impulso del Colectivo Marku Jarhoajperani, anualmente se convoca al festival que logra reunir a creadores, que con el uso de nuevos materiales y procesos más seguros, ponen toda su creatividad y talento en diversidad de globos, cuyas formas, tamaño y colorido son expuestos a los ojos del público en la plaza comunitaria.

Brief review

The hot air balloon Festival, started in 2004 in the autonomous community of Cheran. A community located in the main center of the Purépecha region in the state of Michoacan. Balloons made of tissue paper, have been linked to the communal living of our community, especially to children and youth, who create them with the thought of  seeing them cross the sky after a rainy day, a magical event that's fun for the whole community.

Since 2005 and under the efforts of the Collective Marku Jarhoajperani, we invite the creators to the annual festival that manages to bring them together, and with the use of new materials and safer processes, they are allowed to put all their creativity and talent in a variety of balloons, whose shapes, sizes and wonderful colors are exposed to the public eye at the community main plaza.

Lo que necesitamos 

Se necesita financiamiento para los materiales, los premios de los globos ganadores, así como la música del festival. 

Con tu financiamiento podremos tener: 

*Material para elaboración de globos: Papel china, pegamento, tijeras, alambre galvanizado (cal. 19, 20, 22), parafina, toalla de cocina (rollos desechables), cinta diurex, cinta masking.

*Los premios para los globos ganadores. Se tienen 4 categorías: infantil, femenil, intermedia, libre y se premia el 1er, 2º y 3er lugar. 

*Apoyo para los  músicos, alimentos y agua para todas las personas participantes.

*Papelería y mobiliario para el equipo de organización y logística.  

*Equipo técnico: Pinzas, tijeras, soplete y gas (tanque).

What we need.

Funding for materials needed, the prizes for the winners in the hot air balloon contest and  the music for the  festival.With your financing we can have:

* Materials for balloons making: Chinese paper, glue, scissors, galvanized wire (cal 19, 20, 22.), Paraffin, kitchen towel (disposable rolls), diurex tape, masking tape.

* Prizes for the winners in the hot air balloon contest. Divided in four categories: free, children's, women's, intermediate, and rewards for the 1st, 2nd and 3rd place in each category.

* Support for musicians, food and water for all participants.

*Basic supplies and equipment for the organization and logistics team such as paper, pens, markers, pencils, folders and others.

* Technical equipment: tweezers, scissors, torch and gas (tank).

El impacto

El Festival de Globos de Cantoya, es el único festival en México impulsado dentro de una comunidad autónoma indígena. Buscamos que cada año el festival pueda ser más conocido y  con mayor participación comunitaria. 

En el último año, logramos tener 200 personas inscritas en las distintas categorías y una población de poco más de 4 mil personas que participaron  disfrutando el espectáculo.  

El festival apuesta a una convivencia que resalta, el trabajo comunitario, colectivo, la dignidad, creatividad y vínculos inter generacionales entre la niñez, juventud y las personas adultas, al mismo tiempo, es una fiesta que abona a la disminución de los problemas sociales y rescata los valores como como comunidad autónoma  respeto, la igualdad, seguridad, el arte, entre otros. 

Impact

The hot air balloon Festival is the only festival in Mexico driven within an indigenous autonomous region. Each year we look for the festival to be more recognized with an increase in community participation.

In the past year, we had 200 people enrolled in the different categories and a population of just over 4000 people who participated enjoying the show.

Our festival tries to highlighting the coexistence, community  and collective work, dignity, creativity and intergenerational links between children, youth and adults at the same time. The festival is a party that contributes to the reduction of social problems and rescues our autonomous community values ​​such as respect, equality, security, art, among many others.

Riesgos y desafíos

Al ser Cherán una comunidad autónoma en resistencia, buscamos que las actividades culturales y artísticas sean parte de la dinámica comunitaria y no actividades impuestas desde afuera. Por lo que buscar de manera independiente y autónoma los recursos para su realización es un desafío permanente. 
En otros años hemos tenido limitaciones para tener los premios completos o buscar apoyos en especie, pero este es nuestro primer año que queremos que la comunidad fuera de Cherán, las personas como tú, interesadas en apoyar procesos comunitarios en resistencia puedan también poner su "granito de arena".
El riesgo de no completar nuestra meta, es que tendremos o premios simbólicos o menos insumos para los Globos de Cantoya, pero a pesar, de ello, podremos realizar el 11º festival. 

Risks and challenges.

Cheran being an autonomous community in resistance,we seek and think that cultural and artistic activities are part of our own dynamic in the community  and they are not imposed from outside. By trying to obtain in an independent and autonomous way the resources for the festival we face an ongoing and permanent challenge.

During the past years we have had limitations to fund the awards and to obtain different kind of materials, but this is our first year that we want that the community outside of Cheran, people like you, interested in supporting community processes in resistance, help us, With little help from everyone we will accomplish our goal.

The risk of not completing our goal is that either we are going to give symbolic prizes or have less materials for the making of hot air balloons, but despite this, we  still can make the 11th festival.

 
Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Difusión a través de las redes sociales, gestionar materiales y equipo técnico necesario para la elaboración y elevación de globos, compartir esta información con muchas más personas. 

Different ways to help.

Sharing this project through social networks, provide materials and technical equipment required for the making and elevation of hot air balloons, share this information with many more people.

 El Festival de Globos de Cantoya, es el único festival en México impulsado dentro de una comunidad autónoma indígena. Buscamos que cada año el festival pueda ser más conocido y  con mayor participación comunitaria. 
En el último año, logramos tener 200 personas inscritas en las distintas categorías y una población de poco más de 4 mil personas que participaron  disfrutando el espectáculo.  
El festival apuesta a una convivencia que resalta, el trabajo comunitario, colectivo, la dignidad, creatividad y vínculos inter generacionales entre la niñez, juventud y las personas adultas, al mismo tiempo, es una fiesta que abona a la disminución de los problemas sociales y rescata los valores como como comunidad autónoma  respeto, la igualdad, seguridad, el arte, entre otros. 


Impact

The hot air balloon Festival is the only festival in Mexico driven within an indigenous autonomous region. Each year we look for the festival to be more recognized with an increase in community participation.
In the past year, we had 200 people enrolled in the different categories and a population of just over 4000 people who participated enjoying the show.
Our festival tries to highlighting the coexistence, community  and collective work, dignity, creativity and intergenerational links between children, youth and adults at the same time. The festival is a party that contributes to the reduction of social problems and rescues our autonomous community values ​​such as respect, equality, security, art, among many others.

    Riesgos y desafíos  
Al ser Cherán una comunidad autónoma en resistencia, buscamos que las actividades culturales y artísticas sean parte de la dinámica comunitaria y no actividades impuestas desde afuera. Por lo que buscar de manera independiente y autónoma los recursos para su realización es un desafío permanente. 
En otros años hemos tenido limitaciones para tener los premios completos o buscar apoyos en especie, pero este es nuestro primer año que queremos que la comunidad fuera de Cherán, las personas como tú, interesadas en apoyar procesos comunitarios en resistencia puedan también poner su "granito de arena".El riesgo de no completar nuestra meta, es que tendremos o premios simbólicos o menos insumos para los Globos de Cantoya, pero a pesar, de ello, podremos realizar el 11º festival. 

Risks and challenges.
Cheran being an autonomous community in resistance,we seek and think that cultural and artistic activities are part of our own dynamic in the community  and they are not imposed from outside. By trying to obtain in an independent and autonomous way the resources for the festival we face an ongoing and permanent challenge.

During the past years we have had limitations to fund the awards and to obtain different kind of materials, but this is our first year that we want that the community outside of Cheran, people like you, interested in supporting community processes in resistance, help us, With little help from everyone we will accomplish our goal.
The risk of not completing our goal is that either we are going to give symbolic prizes or have less materials for the making of hot air balloons, but despite this, we  still can make the 11th festival. 
Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar
 
Difusión a través de las redes sociales, gestionar materiales y equipo técnico necesario para la elaboración y elevación de globos, compartir esta información con muchas más personas. Different ways to help.
Sharing this project through social networks, provide materials and technical equipment required for the making and elevation of hot air balloons, share this information with many more people.

story:
For me 2014, marked the beginning of my own spiritual awakening. Part of exploring into a higher consciousness is to expand through knowledge. Moments of my own journey have inspired me to positively influence others by sharing information along with my most deepest thoughts and experiences. - Blue Honey's Mama, Chelsea

What is Blue Honey? A transformative E-zine/website sharing conscious based content.

Who is Blue Honey for? Those seeking optimal states of well being for their mind, body, and soul.

What are the key topics of content? Psyche, arts, body, and revolution.

What are some covered subjects? Natural foods, meditation, drug harm reduction, binaural beats, and visionary artists. 

When do I plan to launch?  October 2, 2014 ( MY BIRTHDAY!)

Mission:

  • Change the world by being the change I want to see
  • Support all unique research and non-mainstream news
  • Educate on alternative health and living for the soul
  • Spread consciousness 

Content Goals:

Daily Posts ~ 10+ posts all tagged under "My Honey" topics.

Multimedia ~ Book reviews, graphics, music, and videos, including interviews with artists, healers, scientists, and other cosmic creatives. 

Interactivity ~ Feature submissions, question/comment box, and trip reports. 


The Budget

I'm asking for your help through a campaign so I can move to a presentable digital platform. $1,000 + pledged will cover all of the initial expenses to launch mybluehoney.com. This will enable me to be marketable for, do more multimedia, build a following, and go more in-depth on hot topics. 


Marketing Goals:

  • Connect with non-profits and organizations for psychedelic therapy research
  • Establish a relationship with conscious driven community and followers
  • Build a contact list  of artists, scientists, professors, and journalists for interviews


Risks & Challenges

Currently I am enrolled in the New Media Journalism program at College of the Canyons in Valencia, CA. With courses in journalism, marketing, and news reporting, I have made Blue Honey part of my daily assignments and homework. Time management is a challenge that may arise, But, my passion and commitment to a better, more holistic lifestyle is the drive to my perseverance. Now because I do have a business plan, I'm aware of smart budgeting and setting practical goals. Last but not least I have support from friends, instructors, as well as my extended cosmic family. 

I ask that you take a chance, open your mind to the LOVE I have to share. 

Your feedback is much appreciated, just as much as your continuous support. 

Namaste!

story:
I am asking for support to write my book "The One Breast Goddess" - Sharing ways to invest in your soul. I was born with a rare syndrome called Polands, with this I was born with a smaller left hand side, a turned in left hip and no left pec major. From this my left breast never developed. Growing up in a society of wanting to look beautiful and be 'perfect' I was totally ashamed of who I was and lived the first 28 years of my life lying. 

Over the past 4 years, I have been through a transformational journey and am now filled with true joy and bliss leading an authentic path. I feel a calling to share my personal story and even more the tools I have used to face my fears, my guilt, shame and how I could come to the other side saying 'This is who I am' love me as I am. When I have shared my story at public speaking events I have helped both woman and men to connect to the stories they are ashamed of and help them to feel empowered by their imperfections. 

I am hoping to raise a minimum of $8000 so I can cover the costs of a writing retreat in Queensland and the costs to publish the book. I am offering e book downloads, signed copies of the hard book, Skype one on one coaching sessions and I am also available to speak at schools, unis, corporate functions, entrepreneur events and acting industry events. All money raised will go towards me being in the best place to share this story. Please help me share my message - be truthful to all parts of you. I hope you enjoy the book :) Thanks for your support.

Testimonials

"Clare Elizabeth Dea speaks intelligently, passionately and powerfully. She brings an energy to her teachings that is at once full of wisdom and no-nonsense practicality whilst being imbued with a sense of care and love. She nudges us towards finding the truth in our stories by openly sharing her own vulnerability. It is through this brave honesty of self-awareness that a true path towards personal growth can be forged. People of any age will benefit from reading Clare's work. For those who are embarking on the journey of conscious personal development for the first time, right through to those who have passed through every trend, training course and wave of knowledge; there are opportunities for insight, encouragement, and ultimately finding your message of truth. Amidst the craziness of this world, Clare's book could not be more timely." 

-Eliza Charlie

"My first interactions with Clare were on a business level during the early days of developing for The Actors Process - I was to develop the opening musical theme.  Fast forward almost 12 months and I consider Clare one of my closest friends, and amongst my most valuable creative colleagues.  

Her words inspire, challenge and amaze on a regular basis, both inside the classroom and in general conversation.  I can confidently say that her influence has been the biggest guiding hand for me during an incredible time of personal growth and transformation, and I have nothing but the utmost love and gratitude for her and what she does."

-Chris O'Neill
Frostfire Audio

"I have long said Clare creates better people – let alone better actors – cause I've seen it happen before my eyes. I first trained with Clare in 2011 and it was transformational..and the longer I train with her the greater the shift - personally and creatively. She is the guru to us, but what makes Clare's training truly unique is it IS the bridge between being stuck in limiting patterns and unconscious blocks AND arriving in your creative potential. She bridges the personal healing process to creating authentic, truthful performance. And the highlight of our week is going to class... She is truly devoted to transforming and tuning your instrument to the demands of being a working actor or creative artist. I've witnessed it, I've felt it. I've lived it. Clare truly is carrying on Meisner's legacy and with her help it has the power to shift the paradigm for humanity."

-Jean-Paul D'Aubbonnett

"Before I began working with Clare I was committed to and passionate about my career as an actor but I was emotionally blocked as a person. Like most people I had walls and protectors up that were stopping me from embracing and loving all of myself and showing the world all the gifts that I have to offer. I have only been working with Clare for 7 months but in that time I have become more aware of the fear and protectors I have inside of me. Clare has taught me how to value my protectors without giving them too much power. At the same time she has taught me how to embrace parts of myself that I never even knew I had. Embracing all parts of yourself is a lifelong process but under Clare’s guidance I have started the journey and am filled with a level of excitement, passion and self-love that has been missing from my life."

-Katherine Bransgrove

"Living 80kms away made it hard for me to enrol in Clare’s weekly classes, so I began attending all her weekend courses that she had over the months and then enrolled in a weekly VIP Audio course where I could just listen to pre-recorded audio’s that Clare had composed in my own time… But this still wasn’t enough!!!  I had totally fallen in love with the Mesiner technique and the way Clare taught it that I couldn’t resist enrolling in her weekly Wednesday night classes… 

Clare’s teaching approach is very unique… As a facilitator she creates this amazingly safe, supportive and powerful environment that is so empowering, it leaves you feeling inspired and alive… Since I began my Meisner voyage with Clare I have felt passionate, more present, stimulated and my everyday life seems to flow in a more positive and fulfilling way. I feel more grounded and much more positive about the future. 

Whether or not it’s for development in your acting and/or personal life, I highly recommend Meisner Melbourne and that you contact Clare Elizabeth Dea… 

Start living a more magical, authentic and fulfilling life now!!!"

-Vivian Langham

"Clare's teaching has enabled me to step into alignment and into my full power, both professionally and personally, as I have not only been receiving new information and techniques, but also the crucial support I need to be able to utilise them advantageously, in my performance endeavours and also in day to day circumstances. 

I would recommend Clare's work to performers of any discipline, but also to anyone feeling lost or stale in their daily lives, as her teaching allows you to open up to your full self, and to the opportunities that are surrounding you."

-Lara Vocisano

story:
Hi guys -

The Big(ish) Book of (somewhat) Hilarious Poems is a collection of poems my writing partner and I have done. We are planning to use these poems to publish an illustrated book, complete with a recorded CD in the back.

This is where it gets interesting – we are going to get UK comedians to record the poems to make it really interesting (and commercially viable).

The book will support the Great Ormond Street Children’s Hospital in London – our main goal is to combine our love of writing with our passion for social change.

So far we have approached several celebrity agents and have some people onboard (in principle at least).

To ensure the best possibility of success for the project, we will be using about 6 of the poems and illustrations to create a pitch book. We will get a good 30 of these printed and distributed to some of the bigger publishing houses in the UK.

The only issue is that given a pitch book needs to look and feel as close to the final product as possible, we need someone to help us finance the print costs – around $2000.

Below are some videos of the poems being read – hope you like!!

Thanks for your time and any support you can give to help fund this idea will be greatly appreciated!

Poem 1 – The Bed Monster:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=scfwkzFqKcI

Poem 2 – The Hungry Baby:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b-pS3KJpY0w

Poem 3 – Gail the Snail:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=im-e2y4IHlw

Poem 4 – A Giant Step:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wiCIK-3nSeY

Poem 5 – Marvin:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LfSC1pH5xzc

story:
Short Summary

Colleen Kirley and Olivia Zuccherato baked heart-shaped cookies on February 14, 2011. They wrote about it online. (You can see some of the original posts at www.foodwillneverbreakmyheart.com)One year later, with multitudes of help from talented friends, they've put together a magazine devoted to the stories behind the food we eat.

It's called Food Will Never Break My Heart, and it's an annual journal about love and food and loving food.  

The stories have been written, the photos and illustrations are all on the pages. Now, all they need is the money to print it. 

With your help, they can make their cooked-up dream a reality.

What We Need & What You Get

Our final cost for printing will be close to $5000. This $4000 will kick-start our campaign and ease the burden of having endless bakesales. 

Contribute over $25, and we'll send you two magazines for free, (hot off the presses) and you can gain free entry into our launch party. 

If you contribute $200, We'll send you two free magazine, you will gain free entry into our party, AND we will put your name or organization into the masthead of our magazine along with our contributors. 

Contribute $500, you'll get two free issues, free entry into our party, your name in the masthead, AND a free half-page advertisement for your business or organization. 

If you are able to contribute $1000, you'll get two free issues, free entry into our party, your name in the masthead, and a free full-page advertisement for your business or organization. 

If you have $2000 for our cause, we'll give you all of these perks, and we'll put your advertisement on the outside back cover of our magazine. 

When we get these funds, they will be going directly to printing costs and to pay our talented designer. 

The Impact

This publication is much more than just a magazine about food. It's an outlet to showcase the diverse and extrodinary talents of young people in Toronto. 

We have journalists writing about awkward first dates, exceptional photographers capturing the art of canning, working illustrators sketching out their favourite recipes, and much more!

Some of our incredible contributers include: Gemma Warren, Emily Sebrins, Kat Vanwhoevan, Scaachi Koul, Rudy Lee, Anthony Menencola, Sophie Yalkezian, Dave Lock, Sarah Harrison, Lindsey King, Brian Trinh, Thomas Vanderzaag, Sam Nolan, Andrea Manica, Aabid Youssef, and so many more!

This magazine will end up in the hands of hundreds of Torontonians in the downtown core. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We are currently planning an epic bake sale to take place in October. If you can contribute baked goods, or your time, we would be so greatful! 

We are also looking for volunteers all the time! We need writers and illustrators to contribute to our website and future publications. Also, if you are interested in social media or public relations, we would love to have you on our team!

You can e-mail Colleen (colleenkirley [at] gmail [dot] com) or Olivia (oliviazuccherato [at] gmail [dot] com) if you are interested to help out in any of these ways.

story:
Taruni's Book and the India Chapter

Taruni's journey of healing has been one of those experiences that touches many lives along the way. In dealing with the loss of her husband from cancer she has moved half way across the world; written and self-published a book on death and grieving; volunteers at hospice, offering patient care and bereavement support; and is also running a free-twice-monthly grief support group in Manhattan.

Now she is writing a book for commercial publication titled - A good day to die.  This book will describe in more detail the experience of caring for her terminally ill husband, the dying process, and the healing journey after his passing. To accompany this book, will be a handbook on grieving, intended as a resource for professionals working in the area of bereavement and for the bereaved. 

I am launching this campaign to help her write this book.

My goal is to send Taruni and her late husband’s ashes to India and then to Australia at the end of this year. I feel strongly that this trip represents a cycle of completion for Taruni in the life long process of grieving. And I feel that it needs to be now because she is embarking on these writing projects

I want to help ensure that this book gets written and this trip is the next stage of her story. Her book will help and support thousands of people who struggle with reality of loss. 

Will you please make a donation towards realizing this important journey and project?  I appreciate your support so much.

Supporting a Journey of Healing

This December 17 marks five years since the passing of Taruni’s husband, who she affectionately calls JP.  I only met him once, and briefly, but in that brief encounter, I saw what a kind and saintly person he was. His three year battle against brain cancer was both a grueling and spiritual ordeal for Taruni and JP. Throughout it all and up to the end Taruni, did what I can only describe as one of the most wonderful, selfless, and important things one person can do for another. She gave JP a truly spiritual and loving passing from this life to the next. I am in awe of Taruni.

Since that time of loss and trauma, I have seen her grow and heal; sometimes slowly, sometimes painfully, but with firm determination. The trip will begin by taking JP’s ashes to Mayapur, India, to cast them into the River Ganga. Following that, she will go to Australia. She has not been back since JP left his body. 

So, I thank you in advance for considering this request and for helping me to get the Bear (my nickname for her) to India and Australia. 

A Book that Will Make a Difference

I have set the goal for this campaign at US $3650. Even so, my hope is that we will exceed that goal because I want to contribute any amounts over the cost of the trip to the development and publishing of Taruni’s new book on death and grieving. She has already completed a first edition, which she self-published (excerpts here). 

This trip, and any additional monies will go a long way to help Taruni create this book. Because of who she is and the strength of her writing, I think the world will be a better place if we all support Taruni and her project.

So please give what you can afford. And, thanks again,

Atma
story_txt:
Taruni's Book and the India Chapter
Taruni's journey of healing has been one of those experiences that touches many lives along the way. In dealing with the loss of her husband from cancer she has moved half way across the world; written and self-published a book on death and grieving; volunteers at hospice, offering patient care and bereavement support; and is also running a free-twice-monthly grief support group in Manhattan.
Now she is writing a book for commercial publication titled - A good day to die.  This book will describe in more detail the experience of caring for her terminally ill husband, the dying process, and the healing journey after his passing. To accompany this book, will be a handbook on grieving, intended as a resource for professionals working in the area of bereavement and for the bereaved. 
I am launching this campaign to help her write this book.
My goal is to send Taruni and her late husband’s ashes to
India and then to Australia at the end of this year. I feel strongly that this trip
represents a cycle of completion for Taruni in the life long process of
grieving. And I feel that it needs to be now because she is embarking on these writing projects
I want to help ensure that this book gets written and this trip is the next stage of her story. Her book will help and support thousands of people who struggle with reality of loss. 
Will you please make a donation towards realizing this
important journey and project?  I appreciate your
support so much.
Supporting a Journey of Healing

This December 17 marks five years since the passing of
Taruni’s husband, who she affectionately calls JP.  I only met him once, and briefly, but in that
brief encounter, I saw what a kind and saintly person he was. His three year
battle against brain cancer was both a grueling and spiritual ordeal for Taruni
and JP. Throughout it all and up to the end Taruni, did what I can only describe
as one of the most wonderful, selfless, and important things one person can do
for another. She gave JP a truly spiritual and loving passing from this life to
the next. I am in awe of Taruni. 
Since that time of loss and trauma, I have seen her grow and
heal; sometimes slowly, sometimes painfully, but with firm determination. The trip will begin by taking JP’s ashes to Mayapur, India, to cast them into the River
Ganga. Following that, she will go to Australia. She has not been back since
JP left his body. 
So, I thank you in advance for considering this request and
for helping me to get the Bear (my nickname for her) to India and Australia. 
A Book that Will Make a Difference
I have set the goal for this campaign at US $3650. Even so,
my hope is that we will exceed that goal because I want to contribute any amounts
over the cost of the trip to the development and publishing of Taruni’s new book on
death and grieving. She has already completed a first edition, which she
self-published (excerpts here). 
This trip, and any additional monies will go a long way to
help Taruni create this book. Because of who she is and the strength of her
writing, I think the world will be a better place if we all support Taruni and
her project. 
So please give what you can afford. And, thanks again,
Atma

story:
Welcome 

We're a new small, independent, publishing house based in Nottingham in the UK. We started as a poetry blog in 2012, publishing close to 280 poems since we started, and recently we expanded into a publishing house with the help of some generous contributors through our previous crowdfunding campaign. This year we have published 4 anthologies of poetry, 2 collections of poetry by new writers, and a collection of short fiction. Also, soon, we have our first novels by new writers coming out.

Our ethos from the start of this adventure in publishing has always been that we will help nurture new writing talent by actively seeking it out, and giving a chance to writers who may otherwise find it difficult to get their work off the ground and into the public eye.

In an industry where new writers are feeling increasingly isolated from major publishers, and self-publishing is not for every writer, we feel that there has to be a middle ground wherein new writers who want to choose traditional publishing as an outlet for their artistic vision can do so, without having to expend more time and energy (or money) than they can spare. That's where we, and other independent publishers come in.

Our passion for literature is in everything we do. We think that there are some undiscovered gems out there in the desert of literature, and we're determined to find and nurture it. However, passion isn't enough, we also need to have the funds to do more for our writers. This is where you come in.


What We Need & What You Get

We have worked out our needs to get things off the ground properly - £5,000. This is mostly for a marketing and promotion budget, so that we can get the publications out there into the eyes of the public through advertising, media and reviewers. 

There are also incremental costs we will need to cover as time goes on, but it is hoped that with a decent marketing and promotional budget, we will be able to increase the sales of our titles, and then this should mean we can do much more as time goes on. 

Of course, if we break through the £5,000 target, we can start looking at putting that money to much more use. So, the more we get the more we can do.

Perks

We have a collection of unique perks for you, from a mention on our site as a sponsor, through perks which give you all our current, and future, publications in a format of your choice, to an editorial service for all you aspiring novelists out there, to our exclusive contributors-only T-shirts (with the great design of our sci-fi collection "Tuned To A Dead Channel") there is something for everyone in our perks. So take a look at them, and see what you can get for supporting us.

Our T-Shirt - See the design you'll be getting. Classy.


The Impact

By contributing to this campaign, you will be helping us to discover and help the next generation of new, undiscovered talent in the world of literature. Who knows? Maybe, just maybe, we'll discover the next Stephen King or F Scott Fitzgerald. With your contribution, anything is possible.

Other Ways You Can Help

Remember, if you can't help with a contribution, you can help immensely by sharing this campaign with your social networks, friends, colleagues, family and everyone. Every bit helps us reach our goals.


Be a part of our success story. Help fund our campaign.


- R J Davey, Editor-In-Chief, Dagda Publishing

story:
Hello.  My name is Daniel Padgug and I grew up in a family that believed that love had conditions and life had specific rules.  Through years of life experiences, I am a great believer this is not so, and that life and love is how you choose to perceive it.  My goal is to communicate this via daily messages to those throughout the world that just need a little help toward living a fulfilled and meaningful life.  Mankind is heading toward a path of self destruction and now more than ever we need to work together to let help them discover, believe in and discover another road.  Hopefully you will choose to be part of this potentially world saving process.


I am looking to raise $100,000.00 which will be used mainly for marketing related projects. I need people/systems/vehicles to take advantage of the huge potential of the internet and social media specifically.  I firmly believe that this money will be enough to "get the word out" that "Your Two Sense Worth" exists and how to apply it towards the betterment of society as a whole. If for some reason this monetary goal is not reached, it will be used toward still exposing these thoughts but maybe to a lesser degree. This is our chance to work together for change while being proactive vs. reactive to various crises as they occur. "Events" happen.....how we perceive and react to them is the key. 

The impact your contribution will make might not be totally recognizable, so I am specifically looking for people who donate not because of specific expectations, but because that's "who they are."  They are secure individuals who believe that the greatest rewards for an act of kindness is never external, but internal in a way that can't ever be explained via words.


If for some reason you are not in position to help with even a dollar, you can contribute greatly by not only letting people know this sight exists, but to treat others as you yourself would like to be treated as you go through this wonderful experience called "life."  Thank you very much for considering being part of the solution vs part of the problem, and may you always remember that "Love will be yours, if yours will be love."

story:
UPDATE #3:

I can't offer any additional signed copies as perks, but you can now order copies of Humanly directly from my publisher, Small Doggies, if interested! http://www.smalldoggiespress.com/books/humanly/

UPDATE #2: 

I am completely blown away that I've made it to $2500 in donations. When I set my initial goal at $1000, I thought I was being ambitious. A week ago, I was completely panicked about travel costs and was convinced I'd have to postpone touring. Now, I'm thrilled to be in the position to schedule more readings in more cities. This money is going to help me pay for flights to get to readings in March & April and order merchandise (copies of Humanly & Good Grief) to bring with me on tour and sell at readings.  I am greatly appreciative for any additional donations, which will help me travel for more readings in May & June, and potentially even beyond that. The success of this campaign is making me feel incredibly blessed. In the spirit of giving back, I've decided 10% of any funds raised above $2500 will be donated to the Depression and Bipolar Support Alliance under the John Kendall Adams Memorial Fund. 


UPDATE #1:

I'm pleasantly bewildered that I've reached my initial goal in less than 48 hours. This money will help get me to Portland, OR; Seattle, WA; Chicago, IL; and Minneapolis, MN in late March and early April!  That's pretty amazing. Thank you to all who have generously shared or donated to this campaign. 

Because this campaign has been so successful already (and is open for 28 more days), I'd like to set a new goal to help fund additional touring: $2500. 

Also, if you're an East Coast venue (pretty much anywhere from Atlanta, GA to Portland, ME) and would like to have me as a featured reader May 18-June 8 please don't hesitate to contact me. Also, if you're somewhere else and would like to have me come read, let's try to figure that out, too. I will come read pretty much anywhere so long as doing so doesn't cause me to lose money. The best way to contact me is through my website: 

http://www.stevietheclumsy.com/contact.html

Also, I'd still love to squeeze in a couple more readings at the following dates & locations if anybody has ideas:

  • Pacific Northwest or possibly Northern California - March 28 (Sat), March 30 (Mon), April 3 (Fri)
  • Chicago - April 4-5 (Sat-Sun)
  • Minneapolis AWP - April 10-11 (Fri-Sat)


So, what's the money for?

I'm Stevie Edwards, and I'm a poet originally hailing from Michigan but currently living in Ithaca, NY. I'm trying to raise money to help cover travel expenses to give readings in promotion of my second collection of poetry, Humanly, which will be coming out from Small Doggies Press this March. I will be going to Portland, OR; Seattle, WA; Chicago, IL; and potentially elsewhere. Up to date information on my tour schedule can be found on my website: www.stevietheclumsy.com. 

This book is largely about living with Bipolar II Disorder, living through grief and trauma, and trying to redirect patterns of suicidal ideation. There were several points at which I debated the publication of this collection due to how scary and irreversible it is to publicly acknowledge having a mental illness. However, enough people have told me that reading my words has helped them through hard times that I believe this book is necessary. If this book saves one person's life, then it was more than worth the three years I spent writing it. I want to make sure that it reaches the people who might need it.  That's where I need your help! I need money to help cover travel expenses so that I can give readings from this collection in places beyond my current home base (Ithaca, NY). 

I'm more than happy to sleep on couches and eat crumbs while traveling, but what I really need money for is airfare (specifically: a flight from Ithaca, NY to Portland, OR; a flight from Portland, OR to Chicago, IL; and a flight back to Ithaca, NY). It's true that some of the readings I do will pay small amounts of money, and hopefully I'll sell tons of books and make some additional money—That'd be really awesome! However, poetry is unfortunately not the biggest money-making industry in America, and I am not currently in a financial situation where I can gamble with going into the red for this tour. My checking account balance has stopped showing numbers and now just shakes its head at me in disappointment. 


So, is this book actually any good?

I'm excited that some of the poets I most admire are already saying wonderful things about Humanly:

With an unpredictability that alternately jolts and mesmerizes, Stevie Edwards has crafted an intricate exploration of life as we'd rather not know it. There is much in these stanzas to jolt and unsettle--stark crafting and a relentless respect for the possibilities of word create a tension only felt in the presence of revelation. 
—Patricia Smith, Author of Blood Dazzler and Shoulda Been Jimi Savannah


In Humanly, Stevie Edwards wakes us into our own bodies with her fierce honesty: "The first time I tried to slip my outsides/I failed." This is a courageous book of startling images and original voice that surges beyond the difficult questions: "If I string the night between two fence posts,/one side heaven and one side hell…" Or: "I was/watching myself in the hotel mirror to make sure/my body was still happening…" Edwards blows the doors off the outer body, delivering us to the beating heart and the inner doors of human mercy. Humanly burns need and desire into the sound of survival: "a prayer/in praise of the groaning in the back room:/Let each body be loved until its end. 
—Jan Beatty, Author of Red Sugar and The  Switching/Yard


If I had never before heard anyone say "Art Saves Lives," I swear on the bullseye of my own wrist, I would have run through the streets screaming it the moment I finished this book. I want everyone who has never believed in the possibility of being given back Time, to read these poems. Not a moment of grief denied, and still, each turn of the page, a vaulted ceiling in my heavy heart. What a generous and intensely vulnerable offering to our survival this book is. 
—Andrea Gibson, Author of Pole Dancing to Gospel Hymns and The Madness Vase

Also, I encourage you to read some of my poems yourself and make up your own mind. Here's a few places where you can find poems from the collection published online:

  • Solstice  - "In the Psych Ward"
  • Devil's Lake - "Against Ghosts"
  • Word Riot - "Humanly"
  • Gesture  - 5 Poems
  • Vinyl  - "Fabulousness"
  • NAILED - 5 Poems
  • B O D Y - "Dear John,"

So, is this Stevie Edwards person a total deadbeat or something?
I'm currently a Lecturer in the English Department at Cornell University, an Online Instructor at Writers & Books, Acquisitions Editor at YesYes Books, and Editor-in-Chief at Muzzle Magazine. I also write as much as possible, travel to give readings, and occasionally sleep and socialize. I have an MFA from Cornell University and a BA from Albion College. I have a five-year-plan involving being financially stable enough to own a puggle. 

So, I think this sounds cool but I'm also a brokeass poet (or can't/ don't want to donate for other reasons that are none of your business), what can I do?
Please help spread the word! Share this campaign with friends. Share a line from one of my poems that stuck with you on social media. If you write book reviews, I'd also be happy to send a pre-release electronic copy of the book. All press is good press. If you bought my first book and liked it, give it a good review on Amazon or GoodReads. If you know any poetry organizers, give them my name to help set up a reading. There's lots of ways to help support a writer that aren't monetary (although, money is really helpful). 

So, what happens if you raise over $1000?
Well, after I finish popping a bottle of Andre, I'll work on booking more shows in additional cities across the US!

So, why didn't you make a video?
Because my MacBook Pro broke this week and I'm using a really cruddy old laptop from when I was in undergrad. I'm going to try and add a video when I get my Mac back from the repair shop (hopefully soon).
