story:
Short Summary

I always hear people say bad thing about lawyer, I don't know if it's because of the place I am around or it just is. Anyway, I believe at some point every man has his love kept inside no matter how deep he buried it. And that's why I am planning on writing this novels.

Alice Lang is the name, and I am about to finish my college and I do love to write.

My friend came up with his idea on writing some novels about lawyer and not the John Grisham one but love and romance one. I asked him why would I write love story about one of the most dire profession I've ever known.

He simply replied because they aren't and love is somewhere around us and we need to help everybody find one of his.

And that how this writing project actually began. Weeks later, we spent time planning on plot, characters, backstory and more details to make this novel of us be as kind and as loveable as much as it could be.

And we want you - our patron-to-be - to be part of our journey and walk with us throughout to the end. With your support, it will helps us tremendously on picking and budgeting it with professional editor and also with marketing which will make our novel getting more to the world. This will happen or not, it's now up you our patron-to-be.

Check our first chapter here and see if you like it: Click Here


What We Need & What You Get

We are planning our budget to be at $20,000 which will cover all the hard work from editing, formatting, cover design and some basic PR to the distribution. But most important and urgent thing now is to fill our ink and supply our paper :))


Giveaway copies.

This budget backed up our initial plan to give away our book to school and libraries. An income from each of every copy that being sold will also be used to fund our next giveaway book project.

  • Example list that we will giveaway a book can be found: here,here, here, here, here  and here.


The Perks:

$1 - Heartfelt Thankfulness: We send our regards to you for your kindness.

$5 - E-Mail Thankfulness: We will personally send a thank you email to you.

$10 - Facetime Thankfulness: We will record our personal thank you vdo and post it everywhere :)))))

$25 - Reading & Thank you Time: We will send you an ebook to any e-book device you have plus we will put your name in the book's acknowledgements.

$45 - Touch it & Thank you Time: We will ship a book to you anywhere in the world plus we will put your name in the book's acknowledgements and - even you don't want it - we will sign a book for you also.

$80 - Junior Editor: You will get all the above perk plus you will be one of our junior editor and we will value your voice on our work before the book will launch. We will also put your review in our book.

$120 - The Editor: You will get all the above perk with responsibility to read our manuscript and help us shape it before it's getting print.

$200 - The Editor-in-chief: You got everything we can offer. Plus responsibility to pick a scene, choose a name and plan a plot with us. 

$500 - The Patron: Please tell us what can we do for you. We will name a character after you and we will obey you :))))


The Impact

We want our writing to make a world little better by showing love and care through thing we called novel.


    Other Ways You Can Help

    • Spread this word out and help making some noise, We believe in you :)
    • Send this page to the people you seem fit, we already love you.

    Alice
    www.SayAliceLang.com
story_txt:
Short Summary I always hear people say bad thing about lawyer, I don't know if it's because of the place I am around or it just is. Anyway, I believe at some point every man has his love kept inside no matter how deep he buried it. And that's why I am planning on writing this novels.Alice Lang is the name, and I am about to finish my college and I do love to write.My friend came up with his idea on writing some novels about lawyer and not the John Grisham one but love and romance one. I asked him why would I write love story about one of the most dire profession I've ever known.He simply replied because they aren't and love is somewhere around us and we need to help everybody find one of his.And that how this writing project actually began. Weeks later, we spent time planning on plot, characters, backstory and more details to make this novel of us be as kind and as loveable as much as it could be.And we want you - our patron-to-be - to be part of our journey and walk with us throughout to the end. With your support, it will helps us tremendously on picking and budgeting it with professional editor and also with marketing which will make our novel getting more to the world. This will happen or not, it's now up you our patron-to-be.Check our first chapter here and see if you like it: Click HereWhat We Need & What You GetWe are planning our budget to be at $20,000 which will cover all the hard work from editing, formatting, cover design and some basic PR to the distribution. story:
Who are we?

Illustrator Steve Ferchaud and author Dan O'Brien have teamed up for the first time to bring you a children's book that will be appreciated and loved by all ages. 
  • Steve Ferchaud is a wonderful artist who has illustrated a number of books in Northern California. Author Dan O'Brien has penned nearly twenty novels and is bringing a story he wrote 10 years ago to fruition. 
  • We think that this wonderful tale will inspire and enrich the lives of readers of all ages. It is a fun and quirky story that lets us know that we are never too old to have one more adventure. 
  • Funding this campaign not only nets you some wonderful one-of-a-kind gifts, but it also would mean the world to both of them. This is truly a labor of love. 

What We Need & What You Get

Here's what we plan to use the funds for and what you can get:

  • Why we need it: subsidizing the cost of illustrations; being able to send out enough review copies to make this book a real success. 
  • What you get: e-copies, printed copies, remarked copies (with a unique handrawn illustration), and signed and numbered prints from the book.
  • Every dollar that we raise will go to making this book successful. Even if we don't meet the goal, we will still be able to use the funds to approach our goal. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that you might not be able to contribute, but there are plenty of things you can do:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about the campaign.
  • Share it with friends and family on social media and in person.
  • Let people know that the book is going to be out soon and encourage them to follow us on social media.

Every dollar that we raise will go to making this book successful. Even if we don't meet the goal, we will still be able to use the funds to approach our goal.

Get the word out and make some noise about the campaign.
Share it with friends and family on social media and in person.
Let people know that the book is going to be out soon and encourage them to follow us on social media.

story:
What is Berfrois?

Berfrois is a literary-intellectual online magazine featuring essays and curiosities. It is published daily.

What We Need

We need $15,000 of funding. Read our funding glossary for details.

The Results

Berfrois will be publicly funded and free of advertisements. The next funding drive will happen in 2013.

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your friends, tell your family.

*UPDATE*

Thank you for helping us to reach our funding target. Any further donations will go towards improvements to the website and will allow for more time until the next funding drive. They will be much, much appreciated.

story:
Napism.info: These are the thoughts of the Nap Masters, their continuing mission: to explore strange new dreamworlds; to seek out new nap locations; to boldly nap when and where no one has napped before . . .

(Note: don't forget to check the Updates tab above!)

Napism.info is a little book, and a simple website, for people who get teased about taking naps . . . and for people who like to tease other people about taking naps.  You can have some great fun with this!  I know, because this little book is a compilation of about 5 years worth of jokes among my family and friends.  (Note my Nap Master certificate, gold-seal embossed and signed by the Dalai Napa himself!)

So, that’s the reason for the book.  The reason for the website is so that readers out there can add their jokes to the eventual second edition.  (And yes, content contributions will be credited by name.)

 

Some topics covered are:

  • the wisdom of Napfucious and N’apseop’s Fables;
  • skill levels and responsible use of Nap-Fu;
  • various napping styles (Sport Naps, Practice Naps, Pre-Nap Warm-Up Naps, California “Extreme” Naps, etc.) (Vote now on your favorites on the www.Napism.INFO site);
  • the sham - not shame - of being (mis)diagnosed with napilepsy
  • and – of great practical use in many everyday applications – a list of telltale behaviors that identify a fellow practicing Napist;
  • and so on!

(You can see some SAMPLE text by visiting www.napism.info.)

 

Through this campaign, not only can you learn about fascinating aspects of Napism, you can also become a part of this informative guide!  If you support this project through Indiegogo, which means taking action soon, like in the next 2 minutes while operators are standing by, you can have your name – or your favorite Napper’s name – included in the book under the listing of the current Olympic Napping Team Members, or the National Napping Council . . . (See perks list.  You can specify the name to be used when you order, or leave instructions by posting a private comment right here on this page, using the tab near the top.)

Just think of the harassment you could stifle with your name in the book . . .Well, actually, it might instigate even more teasing, but it is kind of fun, isn’t it?  (Please check out the perks listed to the right - I'm betting you could start gentle mischief . . . uhm, I mean, have fun with at least one of these . . .)

 

Your Participation in this Project

I need your help because I am working on a particular Mystery of Life, and I have no doubt that some of you are working on this very same mystery.  I work hard, and I’m no dummy, but a lot of things just haven’t turned out quite the way I thought they would.  Then, I look around and I see idiots doing stupid, silly stuff and making good money!  And I’m thinking . . . well, hey, I’m an idiot!  And I do stupid stuff!  So what’s the problem?  What am I missing?  That’s the mystery.  Probably a lot of you out there know exactly what I'm talking about, don't you?

Indiegogo has a campaign goal minimum of $500.  Of course I could use more, but $500 will pay for a minimal run of 5x8 trade paperbacks at a self-publishing house.  I already have the domain names for the site, and a basic site is quite cheap, so I've got that covered.  All I want to do with this Indiegogo campaign is (a) get the book in print and (b) gauge public interest before I mount a full-on marketing campaign.

And if I don’t reach the $500 goal, what will I do with the money raised?  I’ll fulfill all of the claimed perks, as promised.  If it ends up costing me money, I’ll lick my wounds and cry myself into a nap (duh.)

In my circle there are plenty of us adults who like to take naps, and we make many jokes about it, and because of bumper stickers such as "Naps happen" and Twits with #nap and #naptime, I am sure there are many more of us out there.  I think this will succeed, at some level.  And when it does, I'll be able to say, "Veni, vidi, dormi" - I came, I saw, I napped.

 

Any time, any where . . .

(The author on a string of floats being towed across the river one fine fall day.) 

Other Ways You Can Help

So, I’m asking for your help.  You can either sign up for the project perks, or – if you’re working on that same success mystery as I am – jeez, just tell everyone you know about Napism.info here on Indiegogo.com.  Please, at least just pass the word in person and on Facebook and Twitter and yes, even strangers on the street – it’ll cost you nothing BUT it will earn you some good karma and sweet dreams.

And please add your comments - I'd love to hear from you all!

P.S. Please use this site's Facebook and other share tools - it moves this project up in the overall listing / display!!

P.S.P.S. If you didn't watch the video, please do - you don't want to miss the end where my friend does a wonderful Napping Blues song!

story:
Hi! We are a small group of Goulburn girls trying to raise funds via sponsorship for us to attend a ride with pride charity horse ride to allow us to promote and raise funds for the Leukaemia Foundation of Australia. The event is being held on the 21st-28th of March 2015. The Australian Trail Horse Rider Association has organised a seven day trek (ouch our butts) through bushland of Gundagai, NSW, Australia to help promote and raise awareness and money for this very awful and tragic disease.  We need to raise enough money just to allow us to participate in the event. Each entry fee is $800. If we raised a lot more money, the six of us would be able to go. Any extra money that is sponsored to us will be used as donations directly to the charity! Once we have reached our target to pay for the entry fees, we will be closing this page. 

On top of the entry fee, we have the cost of fuel, horse feed, vet checks, shoeing, and arranging things back home for those of us who have kids! The cost all adds up just so we can get along to this charity event. For us to be able to actually participate in the fund raising and awareness promotion, we have to be a part of the ride and without the $800 entry fee, we can not be a part of the fund raiser! 

By all means, donate straight to the charity and not to us if you can, the charity needs the money more than we do. But we want to get to the event to achieve something in our lives, to say that we had a go.

Any donations for the actual foundation need to be made through the ride with pride website! You can find the event here at http://www.ridewithpride.com.au/

Happy Trails!! Goulburn Girls Saddle Club

story:
Yes, there is a lot of self-help books... but you are always reading about other people’s win, not yours.

We wanted to change that, we wanted to create a self-help book that is actually about YOU!

This is why we created Dear Monday, the first and only self-help book where you are the protagonist.

Every challenge has been inspired by practical cases of psychology, scientific experiences, particularly around neurosciences and modern philosophy.

We're a product design studio called 1026 and based in Paris. We created this company with the aim to create products that are both simple and useful for you, and for us. We bootstrapped our company from scratch with one objectif: create a place where we can bring our ideas to life. Our culture is based around three values: liberty, responsibility, and transparency.

We're always happy to discuss, drop us an email at hello@1026.studio.

story:
A place in your community since 2013

The Poetry Lab is a community learning space dedicated to nurturing the creativity of poets and writers as they traverse their learning journeys. We believe an education in literary arts should be accessible to everyone. Our goal, now more than ever, is to hold space that is intersectional, feminist, and anti-racist. A place for our community members to write, read, and collaborate. Workshop by workshop, we connect our members to the larger literary landscape creating a home for poets and for poetry.

A spirit of collaboration

Since our founding in 2013, we've held over 193 workshops and events.  We're proud that most of these classes have been free and open to the public.  We've been honored to collaborate with visiting teaching artists from all over the country including: Shira Erlichman, Cathy Linh Che, Geffrey Davis, Natalie J. Graham, Nate Pritts, Chad Sweeney, Stephen S. Mills, Mahogany L. Browne, Chiwan Choi, James Meetze, Lynne Thompson, torrin a. greathouse, Brendan Constantine, Matthew Hittinger, Nicelle Davis, Alyesha Wise, and many others. 

We're also proud that Poetry Lab members have gone on to become published authors,  workshop instructors, and community leaders. In fact, inspired by our sessions, Lab members have formed publishing companies, open mic events, critique groups, and literary magazines.  We seek to continue this trend as we build out our platform,  adding new resources to our website, expanding our leadership team, and increasing our artist payouts.

Introducing our first event fundraiser 

To support our programming budget, we have organized our first ever fundraiser! At The Poetry Lab we are always trying to level up. We want to bring in the most talented, inspiring teaching artists while also keeping our workshop enrollment fees as affordable as possible. With the rise in virtual programming we've also noticed a rise in artist honorarium fees. We always pay our teaching artists for their time (and we encourage them to make that paper), so in order to continue bringing in the highest caliber teaching artists, we have to get creative. 

Enter the merch! 

Our team has designed 9 limited edition merch items that we are offering for sale. They are:

  • The Heartbreak T-shirt
  • Metaphors T-shirt
  • Poet Pride T-shirt
  • Poetry Repeat Coffee Mug
  • Poetry Repeat Tote Bag
  • Creative Collage Coffee Mug
  • Creative Collage Tote Bag 
  • Write More Sweatshirt
  • Read More Sweatshirt

These items are made from the high quality materials and are produced by a local mom and pop shop. Everything here passes through our hands - this is not a "custom ink" slap-dash situation. We've been brainstorming, creating designs, and going over prototypes for months. And these designs are made with the poet in mind. Are these items niche? You bet your sestina they are! We are poets, after all.

Your Purchase Supports

Honorariums

  • Supplemental cash to increase our teaching artist honorariums helping us bring in the talent!

Advertising

  • Spreading the word about The Poetry Lab far and wide: including a recurring Poets & Writers ad, NewPages Sponsored Listing, Google AdsWords and more!

Infrastructure

  • Monthly overhead fees (Zoom, Squarespace, Canva, Notion, Later, Riverside.fm, Mailchimp, bookkeeping, etc.)
  • Occasional programming expenses (purchasing artists books, etc.)
  • Director’s stipend (because she loves us, but her car needs gasoline!)
  • Team support (to give added incentives to our volunteer staff)

Program Expansion

  • More workshops, more courses!
  • A new podcast!
  • Hire of a video and sound editor

Our Goal

We’re not chasing a monetary goal with this campaign, instead we’re hoping to sell 350 items. It doesn’t even matter which items—if you like one of our shirt designs, awesome! If you only want a tote bag, great! Whatever appeals to you is what we want you to buy and use out in the world. Though we are wholeheartedly hoping you like our designs and want to wear them, put books in them, drink from them—this isn’t really about us, it’s about our community.

Our community is made up of writers, artists, mom and dads, grandparents, journalists, painters, actors, high school students, doctors, IT techs, and janitors. We are a diverse group of people who all have one thing in common—we love to write poetry. And this campaign is about enabling us to continue to build high-quality programming for that to happen.

  • Your support means we can level up
  • Live our dream
  • Create more art

To that end, we are so excited to offer the unique opportunity to sponsor a scholarship seat at The Poetry Lab for one year. This will save a free seat at our monthly Sunday Workshop for either a BIPOC or a person in financial need. Scholarship sponsors have the choice to be listed in our new Collaborator Directory. Learn more by check out our scholarship perks. 

All Purchases Will be Honored

No matter how far we get toward reaching our goal you will receive your merchandise. When you give to this campaign, you are purchasing an item of merch. That item will be created and sent to you once our campaign ends on July 1, 2021.

Help Us Spread the Word

The biggest challenge of this campaign is in reaching people far and wide who love poetry! We’ve deliberately left our logo and branding off many of these items so that they’ll have a wider appeal. So please, if you know of a middle school teacher who wants to rock a “Metaphors be with you” shirt during her poetry lesson plan please send this campaign her way! If you have a poetry-minded uncle who would rock the rainbow poet tee during Pride month, send them our way!  Friends that treasure their morning mug time? That love a well worded tote?  That would cozy up in our “read more poetry” sweater after a long day?  Help us get in touch with poets everywhere!

We are actively posting campaign perks and item photos on Instagram, Facebook, and Twitter. Follow us for easy access to images for sharing with friends. 

Instagram: @thepoetrylab
Facebook: /thepoetrylab
Twitter: @the_poetry_lab

 

Thank you!

The Poetry Lab Team

Danielle, Kelsey, Matthew, and Rebecca

Workshop by workshop, we connect our members to the larger literary landscape creating a home for poets and for poetry.A spirit of collaborationSince our founding in 2013, we've held over 193 workshops and events.  We're proud that most of these classes have been free and open to the public.  We've been honored to collaborate with visiting teaching artists from all over the country including: Shira Erlichman, Cathy Linh Che, Geffrey Davis, Natalie J. Graham, Nate Pritts, Chad Sweeney, Stephen S. Mills, Mahogany L. Browne, Chiwan Choi, James Meetze, Lynne Thompson, torrin a. greathouse, Brendan Constantine, Matthew Hittinger, Nicelle Davis, Alyesha Wise, and many others. We're also proud that Poetry Lab members have gone on to become published authors,  workshop instructors, and community leaders. In fact, inspired by our sessions, Lab members have formed publishing companies, open mic events, critique groups, and literary magazines.  We seek to continue this trend as we build out our platform,  adding new resources to our website, expanding our leadership team, and increasing our artist payouts.Introducing our first event fundraiser To support our programming budget, we have organized our first ever fundraiser! At The Poetry Lab we are always trying to level up. We want to bring in the most talented, inspiring teaching artists while also keeping our workshop enrollment fees as affordable as possible. With the rise in virtual programming we've also noticed a rise in artist honorarium fees. We always pay our teaching artists for their time (and we encourage them to make that paper), so in order to continue bringing in the highest caliber teaching artists, we have to get creative. Enter the merch! Our team has designed 9 limited edition merch items that we are offering for sale. They are:
The Heartbreak T-shirt
Metaphors T-shirt
Poet Pride T-shirt
Poetry Repeat Coffee Mug
Poetry Repeat Tote Bag
Creative Collage Coffee Mug
Creative Collage Tote Bag 
Write More Sweatshirt
Read More Sweatshirt
These items are made from the high quality materials and are produced by a local mom and pop shop. Everything here passes through our hands - this is not a "custom ink" slap-dash situation. We've been brainstorming, creating designs, and going over prototypes for months. And these designs are made with the poet in mind. Are these items niche? You bet your sestina they are! We are poets, after all.Your Purchase SupportsHonorariumsSupplemental cash to increase our teaching artist honorariums helping us bring in the talent!AdvertisingSpreading the word about The Poetry Lab far and wide: including a recurring Poets & Writers ad, NewPages Sponsored Listing, Google AdsWords and more!Infrastructure
Monthly overhead fees (Zoom, Squarespace, Canva, Notion, Later, Riverside.fm, Mailchimp, bookkeeping, etc.)
Occasional programming expenses (purchasing artists books, etc.)
Director’s stipend (because she loves us, but her car needs gasoline!)
Team support (to give added incentives to our volunteer staff)
Program Expansion
More workshops, more courses!
A new podcast!
Hire of a video and sound editor
Our GoalWe’re not chasing a monetary goal with this campaign, instead we’re hoping to sell 350 items. It doesn’t even matter which items—if you like one of our shirt designs, awesome! If you only want a tote bag, great! Whatever appeals to you is what we want you to buy and use out in the world. Though we are wholeheartedly hoping you like our designs and want to wear them, put books in them, drink from them—this isn’t really about us, it’s about our community.Our community is made up of writers, artists, mom and dads, grandparents, journalists, painters, actors, high school students, doctors, IT techs, and janitors. We are a diverse group of people who all have one thing in common—we love to write poetry. And this campaign is about enabling us to continue to build high-quality programming for that to happen.
Your support means we can level up

Live our dream
Create more art
To that end, we are so excited to offer the unique opportunity to sponsor a scholarship seat at The Poetry Lab for one year. This will save a free seat at our monthly Sunday Workshop for either a BIPOC or a person in financial need. Scholarship sponsors have the choice to be listed in our new Collaborator Directory. Learn more by check out our scholarship perks. All Purchases Will be HonoredNo matter how far we get toward reaching our goal you will receive your merchandise. When you give to this campaign, you are purchasing an item of merch. That item will be created and sent to you once our campaign ends on July 1, 2021.Help Us Spread the Word The biggest challenge of this campaign is in reaching people far and wide who love poetry! We’ve deliberately left our logo and branding off many of these items so that they’ll have a wider appeal. So please, if you know of a middle school teacher who wants to rock a “Metaphors be with you” shirt during her poetry lesson plan please send this campaign her way! If you have a poetry-minded uncle who would rock the rainbow poet tee during Pride month, send them our way!  Friends that treasure their morning mug time? That love a well worded tote?  That would cozy up in our “read more poetry” sweater after a long day?  Help us get in touch with poets everywhere!We are actively posting campaign perks and item photos on Instagram, Facebook, and Twitter. Follow us for easy access to images for sharing with friends. Instagram: @thepoetrylabFacebook: /thepoetrylabTwitter: @the_poetry_lab Thank you!The Poetry Lab TeamDanielle, Kelsey, Matthew, and Rebecca

story:
So Here is the Story...

I discovered the ultimate recipe for cooking up unforgettable music experiences by interviewing music and community innovators. In Live LIVE! Creating Community in Music Experiences, each chapter tells the stories of innovators and reveals another ingredient to the recipe.

My name is Katie O'Connell and I am the author of Live LIVE! I wrote this book on my journey of self-exploration. Music was a big part of my identity that got pushed to the side. This is me writing music back into my personal story.

In this book, you will discover how you can live to the fullest in events and experiences you create or participate in. In this book, I instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for creating experiences in you. Ultimately, this book is a tool to help you design, participate in, and facilitate human-centric experiences in live music experiences and beyond.

You'll learn how to set physical and mental space for community events:

  • How redefining and rebranding an experience creates new expectations. Anthony Diaz, CEO of Sixthman, discusses how their product started as a concert on a boat and evolved into a vacation. He explains how fans’ expectations changed and how Sixthman pivoted to enhance the customer experience.
  • How space for live music is defined beyond concert venues and corner bars. Sofar Sounds, Airbnb Music, and SideDoor are among the leaders that have created stages in living room, antique shops, on top of of ski slopes, and just about anywhere you could imagine. Stories from each platform offer tricks to create a sacred space to share and discover music.
  • How to create an exciting environment that inspires genuine human connection. There are lessons to be learned from beyond concerts, festivals, and house shows. I looked at retreats, camps, sports championship parades, cults and networking events to understand what elements create community and how these elements can be replicated in the live music experience space.
Live LIVE! speaks to experience creators and event attendees who are looking for a deep sense of purpose and belonging in new ways in live music events and beyond.
 

The Book - Live LIVE! Creating Community in Music Experiences

The book is written in three parts. Part one walks you through unique, innovative experiences happening in live music. From festival cruises to house shows to dance parties breaking out at 6am around the world, each offers an ingredient to create engagement and excitement around music.

Part two explores community events outside of the music space. If you are looking to disrupt an industry, you don't turn to your peers to see what they are doing, you look beyond. In seemingly unrelated settings, these adventures offer keys to cultivating community and creating an environment for engaging experience.

Then we put it all together. The book concludes with the ultimate recipe for creating community in live music experiences offering tips to maximize on the elements that are naturally in place and practices that can be brought in to create an engaging environment.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July, 2019
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy and Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication (because lord knows I need it)
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this summer
When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

About the Author

Katie O'Connell is a young professional about to make a dent in the universe. As she graduates from John Carroll University in May 2019, her mission is to connect passionate people to create human-centric experiences.


She grew curious about building community in her Junior year of college when she founded JesNET, a social travel network. As she explored the idea of community, she longed to reconnect with the music community which had been a big part of her identity as a high school choir nerd and concert junkie.

In college, Katie was fixated on what she should be doing - internships, service, and the typical college mischief. While she collected amazing experiences and built one heck of a resume, she pushed music to the side. Junior year she attended her first Sofar Sounds show and also was asked to make a guest appearance in her friend’s college band. The series of events provided her with a much needed release and clarity to again prioritize music in her life.

For more information, you can visit www.ventureko.com or connect with Katie at katie@ventureko.com and @oconnell_ko on social.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't join in the adventure:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #LiveLIVE and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. The most powerful way to spread a message is through person to person recommendation.
  • Follow my adventure (and hopefully get some inspiration) on social media @oconnell_ko

Thank you for all of your love and support!


To a purposeful adventure,
Katie O'Connell

story:
United Methodist Clergy & Churches Stand for Love

#stoptheharm

We are ... about HALFWAY TO OUR GOAL!  Thank you!  Our first campaign raised $2,095!  

And now ... with this campaign, we hope to raise the remaining $2500 needed.

  • Clergy have been officiating same gender weddings for years in our California-Pacific annual conference.  We will continue to do so because we understand the heart of God as infinitely wide, and the rite of marriage to be open to all people.
  • However, many people only see and know the media headlines of UMC clergy trials, defrockings and the denunciation(s) of the LGBTQ community by the United Methodist Church.  #stoptheharm
  • We need to change the headlines and lift our open and inclusive voice of love for all -- boldly, strongly and pervasively.  We need to #stoptheharm and stand up publicly for LOVE in God's church.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are raising a total of $4500 to purchase eye-catching, well-designed printed advertisements in major and regional publications throughout the reaches of our California-Pacific Conference.  We are working directly with Reconciling Ministries Network to design and place the ads.
  • These ads will do two things -- 1) list the names of UMC clergy in our conference that officiate same gender weddings and the churches who will host them; and 2) serve as an invitation to our upcoming October 10 "Come for Love ... Stay for Art" Renewal of Vows Ceremonies for the LGBTQ community (with multiplies hosting churches).  For more information about that special day, visit:  http://calpacloveforall.eventbrite.com
  • We are seeking to purchase full page ads in the LA Weekly, OC Weekly, Advocate and New Times; and ...
  • Smaller but equally impactful ads in the Los Angeles Times, the Honolulu Star Advertiser, and the San Diego Tribune.
  • San Luis Obispo United Methodist Church (SLOUMC) will act as the financial agent for the event and all funds collected will be handled by SLOUMC. 

Risks & Challenges

  • Printed advertising is costly -- wow, is it ever!  We do have a large goal, but it is a realistic goal to get these ads to press. 
  • Progressive, non-incendiary news doesn't grab headlines. 
  • Both of these challenges have silenced our voice in the past, but no longer ... because we believe Jesus' message of love is mightier than any rhetoric or religious law.  In fact, we not only believe it -- we KNOW it.  Help us step up to this challenge and let our voice be heard.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please share this campaign!  
  • Help plan the Oct. 10 "Come for Love ... Stay for Art" Renewal of Vows gathering.  Visit:  http://calpacloveforall.eventbrite.com  to learn how.
  • Attend the Oct. 10 "Come for Love ... Stay for Art" Renewal of Vows gathering.
  • Every single donation, every single share of this campaign helps us change the message from one of hate and exile to one of love and inclusion.

story:
UPDATE:

our campaign was incredibly successful!  Thank you to everyone.

To purchase single issues or subscriptions, please go here.



Help Us Launch the Gods&Radicals Journal!


On November 1st, 2015, we'll be manifesting a new, beautiful resistance into the world. And we'd like your help!


A Journal of Beautiful Resistance

The Gods&Radicals Journal is a twice-yearly print collection of smart, dream-soaked words collected against the horror of Capitalism and towards the beauty of the world thereafter.

Featuring the works of poets, essayists, photographers, and illustrators from North America, Europe, and the South Pacific, our first issue will be released 1 November, 2015, printed and bound in full-color.

Here's your chance to help support the launch by purchasing pre-sale copies and subscriptions, as well as getting some cool stuff for your early support!

About Gods&Radicals

Gods&Radicals is a non-profit Pagan publisher, and we've committed to operating everything as close to a workers'/writers' collective as possible.  In fact, the writers decided how they would be paid for their work, not the board or the managing editor.

Your support of the Journal will fund the writers&artists and the non-profit in equal measure, and the greater support we receive before the launch, the more resources we'll have to expand the initial publication. 

Purchasing a pre-sale copy or a subscription will allow us to print more copies at a lower cost, as well as upgrade our printing decisions, lengthen the journal (currently slated at 100 pages), and fund the cost of distributing outside the United States.

And, we'll give you extra stuff for your help!

Single-Issue and Subscriptions

  • Pre-sale copies of the journal will be $9 + shipping.
  • One-year (2 issue) subscriptions will cost $15 ($7.50 issue+ shipping)

Also, we're offering combined packages along with single-issue and subscriptions, including

  • special-edition, expanded print-copies of A Pagan Anti-Capitalist Primer, by Alley Valkyrie and Rhyd Wildermuth.
  • 'Many Gods, No Masters' patches
  • And an exclusive Gods&Radicals T-Shirt

And really, really want to help support us?  Consider becoming a Supporter!

Why Your Help Really Matters


Gods&Radicals is the only non-profit Pagan Anti-Capitalist publisher we know of, and  we've decided not to rely on the usual methods the Capitalist Market foists on us, we're doing something really radical.

We won't be taking advertising or be relying on large corporate distributors for our publications. 

By supporting us early, you'll be helping to ensure our success and funding our beautiful resistance.


Help us get the word out!

Whether or not you can support us with money now, we'd be honored to have your support in other ways!  Telling others about what we're doing is an immense help, both on the internet and in person. 

Also!  Know a bookstore or shop that might be interested in carrying the Gods&Radicals Journal?  Please let them know about us, and have them contact us.

Thanks, be well, and Resist Beautifully!

story:
Πρόκειται για ένα βιβλίο 180 σελίδων που περιέχει όλες τις απαραίτητες πληροφορίες για την παρασκευή χειροποίητων σαπουνιών με φυσικά υλικά, ενώ ταυτόχρονα παρουσιάζει τις 80 πιο επιτυχημένες συνταγές του εργαστηρίου Νatural Collection και των σεμιναρίων παρασκευής σαπουνιού της Νέας Γουινέας. Το βιβλίο αυτό θα εκδοθεί και θα κυκλοφορήσει σε επιλεγμένα βιβλιοπωλεία και άλλα σημεία διάθεσης στα τέλη της άνοιξης. Μπορείτε να αποκτήσετε το βιβλίο, προπληρώνοντάς το μέσω της πλατφόρμας του indiegogo στην ειδική τιμή των 21 ευρώ ( 26 δολλάρια). To βιβλίο θα σας αποσταλεί αμέσως μόλις εκδοθεί.

 

 

Περισσότερες πληροφορίες για το βιβλίο:

Αυτό το βιβλίο αποτελεί έναν πρακτικό οδηγό για ένα δημιουργικό ταξίδι πειραματισμού στον κόσμο του χειροποίητου φυσικού σαπουνιού με ένα οικολογικό και βιώσιμο τρόπο. Παρουσιάζει τις 80 πιο επιτυχημένες συνταγές του εργαστηρίου Νatural Collection και των σεμιναρίων παρασκευής σαπουνιού της Νέας Γουινέας, ενώ ταυτόχρονα παρέχει όλες τις απαραίτητες πληροφορίες για να μπορέσετε να δημιουργήσετε καινούριες συνταγές που να ανταποκρίνονται στις προσωπικές σας ανάγκες.

Μέσα από τις σελίδες του, θα ανακαλύψουμε την ιστορία του σαπουνιού στην Ευρώπη και τη Μέση Ανατολή και θα προσεγγίσουμε τους διαφορετικούς τρόπους παρασκευής και χρήσης του. Θα εξηγήσουμε τη χημεία της σαπωνοποίησης και τις διαφορές του φυσικού σαπουνιού από τα συνθετικά καθαριστικά. Θα περιγράψουμε λεπτομερώς την ψυχρή μέθοδο σαπωνοποίησης για την παρασκευή στερεού σαπουνιού και θα εξηγήσουμε τον τρόπο αντιμετώπισης τυχόν προβλημάτων που μπορεί να προκύψουν. Ακόμη, θα μελετήσουμε τις ιδιότητες των φυσικών πρώτων υλών που χρησιμοποιούνται στη σαπωνοποίηση (έλαια, βούτυρα, βότανα, αιθέρια έλαια, άργιλοι κ.α.) και τις ιδιότητες που προσδίδουν στο σαπούνι που προκύπτει. Τέλος θα διερευνήσουμε φυσικά υλικά που δίνουν χρώμα, υφή και μυρωδιά στο σαπούνι και θα περιγράψουμε διαφορετικές τεχνικές που κάνουν ακόμα πιο ενδιαφέρον το αισθητικό αποτέλεσμα.

Στον παρακάτω συνδεσμο μπορείτε να βρείτε μια προεπισκόπηση των πρώτων σελίδων του βιβλίου https://www.flipsnack.com/fotiniprofile/-.html?0=fotiniprofile

 

 

Περιεχόμενα

1.Πρόλογος

2.Εισαγωγή

3. Το δέρμα: Οι δομές, οι λειτουργίες και οι πραγματικές του αναγκες

4. Η ιστορία του σαπουνιού και της καθαριότητας

5. Τα συνθετικά χημικά καθαριστικά και οι επιπτωσεις τους

6. Επικίνδυνα ή αμφιλεγόμενα συστατικά που πρέπει να αποφευγονται

7. Η χημεία της σαπωνοποιησης

8. Μέθοδοι παρασκευής σαπουνιού

9.Τα υλικά της σαπωνοποίησης

10.Η ψυχρή μεθοδος σαπωνοποίησης στην πράξη

10. Tεχνικές

11.Συνταγές

12. Bιβλιογραφία

 

 

Σημείωση από τη συγγραφέα

“Αυτό το βιβλίο περιέχει όλα όσα ξέρω για το σαπούνι, αυτά που έμαθα από τους δασκάλους μου, αυτά που ανακάλυψα μέσα από τα λάθη μου, αυτά που κατάλαβα μέσα από τις απορίες και τις προσπάθειες των μαθητών μου και την αλληλεπίδραση με τους πελάτες μου. Συμπυκνώνει μια δεκαετή εμπειρία σπουδών, πειραματισμού, πρακτικών εφαρμογών, αυτομόρφωσης και διδασκαλίας και παρουσιάζει το απόσταγμα αυτής της πορείας μέσα από τις πιο επιτυχημένες και αποτελεσματικές μου συνταγές.”

story:
(Note: If you would like to contribute but have to pay by e-transfer or a cheque in the mail, email me at sam@samanthafraser.com to sort it out. I can't accept PayPal payments as Indiegogo requires that I have a US PayPal account, which I don't have. Thanks!)

Welcome!!!

Remember the swinging 60’s and 70’s? Key parties and free love? While those innocent times are long gone there are still plenty of people in today’s society looking for advice on opening up their relationship, in different ways than Mum and Dad.

Not Your Mother’s Playground: A realistic guide to honest, happy and healthy open relationships (NYMP) is a book on modern open relationships aimed at a new generation, discussing everything from swinging to polyamory (multiple loves). It includes personal triumphs and challenges mixed in to give it a relatable, intimate feel. When my husband Steph and I looked to the stores to find material on the topic, the majority of the books we found were directed to an older, more “free-love” focused crowd.

Polyamory and other open relationship structures have often been written about from this perspective, making everything appear quite simple and easy - or as I say "Flowers and Bunnies". My plan with NYMP is to talk about open relationships from a realistic and experienced viewpoint, giving people honest advice and examples from not only my own life but others' as well.

The idea behind Not Your Mother’s Playground is to walk the reader through everything they will encounter should they choose to open up their relationship. It will show all sides from the good to the bad, not ignoring the reality that these relationships come with complications that can put even the strongest couples to the test.

NYMP is written from a first person point of view as I offer advice and guidance in a light-hearted, relatable and easy to understand tone. It’s important to me that readers feel as if they are engaged in a conversation while reading instead of having to understand self-help jargon. In addition to my advice and personal anecdotes, I will also include stories from other non-monogamous people and experts.

NYMP presents the steps readers need to take to succeed in their own open relationship in a way that’s not overwhelming for even relationship traditionalists to read.

Using inspiration from other well-known polyamory / swinging works such as “The Ethical Slut”, "Opening Up: A Guide to Creating and Sustaining Open Relationships" and “Polyamory – the New Love Without Limits”, NYMP hopes to reach a new generation of people looking for guidance.

Thank you so much from the ENTIRE cavern of my heart for your contributions to funding this project. Words cannot express how much your support means to me!!! ~ Samantha (@nympsam)

Where does the funding go?

A successful campaign would help me by;

  • Covering the cost of printing the book
  • Helping me with funds to pay editors/designers of the book
  • Assistance with shipping the book (hopefully worldwide!)
  • Assistance with a launch party of the book

How else can you help?

Without your help making sure the word is spread about this project, it's just going to be another stale page on the internet. I need your help to tell your friends, your lovers, your cats, your mum and dad, your co-workers, your postman and your hairdresser - and/or anyone else you think might be interested! Social media this shiz out the wazoo! Please and thank you. :)

More Information is Fun (Here is some!)

www.NotYourMothersPlayground.com is the accompanying website to the book and
has a strong group of followers that is constantly growing since its creation in March of 2008. I use the blog to share experiences from my own relationship. I receive emails from people constantly, either through the website or Twitter where I have close to 3000 followers, all expressing their thanks to me for writing about nonâ€monogamy in a way that presents it as normal, nonâ€fringe way of life.

In addition to writing about open relationships on my website, I have also been in a
successful open marriage since 2006 and firmly believe in that old adage of “writing what you know”.

Here is some feedback that I have received regarding the book from blog readers:

“This book is important now more than ever. Polyamory and other nonâ€traditional
relationships are gaining momentum. As our culture changes and evolves, some of the social barriers that restricted us are breaking down. People are freer to explore love for the sake of love, and the face of what that love looks like is similarly evolving. I look forward to reading Samantha’s book!”

‘Finally, a CANADIAN book that deals with the reality of open marriages and polyamory. Perhaps the time is finally coming when having an “open marriage” can be discussed early and openly as an option to monogamy. This is healthy, this is overdue, and this will be on my bookshelf and into my teenager’s hands.”

“Although I’ve been following you for only a few months, your willingness to share the minute details of your life through both your blog and tweet stream have led me to see you and @stephgoulet as something of a polyamorous role model couple. Your example has been immensely helpful in easing hesitations through my personal transition to open marriage. I look forward to seeing your book on the shelves, and the opportunity to learn more from your experiences.”

“I can’t wait to read your book. I find it very interesting that people involved in open
marriages are able to make it work. I would love to know what types if issues there are and how different people deal with them. I believe your book will be enlightening to me.”

Format

Not Your Mother’s Playground is divided into three main sections: The Beginning – an
introduction to nonâ€monogamy, The Nitty Gritty – tackling issues and details and The Big Picture – looking to the future. It will be approximately 250 – 300 pages (6” x 9”) long. In addition to advice and my own stories, it will include the following:

  • Glossary of terms at the back of the book
  • “Their Story”: snippets of interviews conducted with other people involved in nonâ€monogamous relationships
  • Warnings / Highlights: Extra tidbits of information, perhaps with a graphic, highlighting items that readers should pay particularly close attention to.
  • Resources: A list of other books, websites, or events with more information.
  • A small chapter or letter from my husband. (if I can get him to write it!!)

Chapters (Subject to change)

Introduction
Using This Book
About Me

Part 1: The Beginning

What are Open Relationships?
This chapter will explain the various types of nonâ€monogamy. Where they came from
and how they look today.

  • A brief history
  • Swinging
  • Polyamory
  • Polyfidelity
  • Social Conditioning
  • A new era of non monogamy

What’s Your Motivation?

  • This chapter will address the reasons that people may want to consider choosing an open relationship, addressing some personal curiosities.
  • Heard about it from friends
  • Spicing up your sex life
  • Exploring fantasies and fetishes
  • Monogamy feels unnatural
  • Following your partner’s wishes
  • Preventing an affair or breakup
  • Escaping issues

Me, Me, Me!

  • This chapter focuses on each individual reading the book, helping them discover more about themselves so they can enter into nonâ€monogamy more selfâ€aware.
  • You in a nutshell
  • Confidence and Insecurities
  • What do you need?
  • Past history and baggage
  • What turns you on?

Part 2: The Nitty Gritty

Building Your Framework
Answering the “How do we DO this?” questions.

  • How to begin
  • Establishing guidelines
  • Where to meet people
  • The invisible sandwich board
  • Dealing with social situations

Types of Relationships
Outlining the various ways to be nonâ€monogamous.

  • The soul mate myth
  • Singles vs. couples
  • Casual vs. serious & everything “In Between”
  • Single vs. singleâ€ish
  • BDSM relationships
  • Falling in love … again

Communication
The most important part of any successful relationship is strong communication. This
chapter deals with all the aspects of it, including how to handle the bad times.

  • Speak up for yourself
  • Learning to hear
  • Fighting fair
  • Honesty for the win
  • Articulation and realizations

Issues & Stumbling Blocks
Highlighting potential problems that people can encounter with plenty of examples.

  • The little details
  • Different strokes & double standards
  • It’s ok to be human
  • Scheduling & time commitments
  • Spending cash on someone else
  • New relationship energy

Jealousy & Other Uhâ€Oh’s
Dealing with jealousy is probably the thing people ask me about the most!

  • What’s behind the curtain?
  • Different types of jealousy
  • Ye shall overcome
  • Accepting Your Limits

Sex & Sexuality
All about the many ways that nonâ€monogamy can open up sexual boundaries.

  • First things first
  • Stuck in a rut?
  • Exploring together
  • Exploring apart
  • Taking responsibility
  • BDSM & fetishes
  • Swinging & group sex
  • Sexual constipation
  • Table for one, please
  • Safe sex & STD’s

Part 3: The Big Picture

Brain Power
Learning how to mentally deal with the often very intense emotions that come up.

  • Compartmentalizing
  • Emotional planning
  • Training your mind
  • Compersion

Coming Out
How do you tell your family? Your friends? This chapter helps with this touchy subject.

  • Is it worth it?
  • Embracing your new selves
  • Mom, Pops & Aunt Judy
  • Friends and party people
  • Everyone else

All In The Family
What about having kids while being in an open relationship? Using examples from real
families, this chapter navigates these stormy waters.

  • Balancing kids & nonâ€monogamy
  • To tell or not to tell

Growing With It
This chapter talks about some bigger picture ideas including looking to the readers’
future with nonâ€monogamy.

  • Breakups and heartaches
  • As far as it can go
  • Redefining roles
  • Is this still for you?

Cherries On Top
Discussing the awesome side effects of open relationships that aren’t generally discussed in other books on the subject.

  • Strengthening your relationship
  • A new sense of self
  • Giving and receiving
  • Accelerated problem solving
  • Having and eating your cake

Glossary

Growing With ItThis chapter talks about some bigger picture ideas including looking to the readers’future with nonâ€monogamy.

Breakups and heartaches
As far as it can go
Redefining roles
Is this still for you?
Cherries On TopDiscussing the awesome side effects of open relationships that aren’t generally discussed in other books on the subject.

Strengthening your relationship
A new sense of self
Giving and receiving
Accelerated problem solving
Having and eating your cake

story:
INTRODUCTION

My name is Victor Villaseñor.  I believe my next book can change our world.  

It’s called Revenge of a Catholic Schoolboy and it’s a story that bridges cultures and religions.  

My previous books have also done much of the same.  

Read on and join forces with me and be part of this global quest!


WHO AM I?

My name is Victor Villaseñor and I am a writer from Oceanside, California.  I had 265 rejections before I sold my first book.  Now my books are being used in high schools, libraries and universities across much of the U.S.

In fact, my best selling book - Rain of Gold is on the recommended reading list for the California State Board of Education.  The New York Public Library has placed my book Burro Genius, on their list of Top Books for the Teen Age, 2005.

But it was not always like this.  Let me explain...


1960, Wyoming

I was 20 years old.  I was lost and angry and ashamed that I didn’t know how to read. Unbeknownst to me, I’m dyslexic.  And yet, up in the wilds of Wyoming, I decided to do the bravest thing I have ever done - become a writer. 

Afire, I came home from Wyoming to Southern California and went to see my old high school English teacher, telling him my big decision.  At first, he gave me a strange look.  I’d never done anything higher than D and F work in his class. 

But he didn’t laugh at me.  

Instead, he walked me across his classroom, and pointed to a poster on the wall that said:

“Whatever you can do or dream you can do, begin it. Boldness has genius, power, and magic.”

Then he turned to me. 

“You’ll do it.  I can see it in your eyes.”

With my teacher’s words engraved in my heart, I started learning how to read with 4th grade books.  I wrote for ten years and received 265 rejections before I sold my first book, Macho!, which was immediately compared to the best of John Steinbeck by the L.A. Times. 

Since then I have had 5 bestsellers and been nominated for the Pulitzer Prize 3 times.


“(Rain of Gold)…is one of the best…books of this year or any year.” - USA Today

“…by looking back, a gifted storyteller finds words to remind us of something lost on the journey forward.”  - The Washington Post

“Villasenor is a born storyteller…” - Publisher’s Weekly

And now, Revenge of a Catholic Schoolboy is a must book.

 

ABOUT MY BOOK


I want to bring a message of hope, meaning and personal transformation through my next book, Revenge of A Catholic Schoolboy to as many people as possible.

It is a wild, pertinent story that bridges cultural and religious differences.

Here’s the back story:

Religiously the whole world is in a transformation. Stories of hate and violence are spread virally across the internet, on mobile phones, email.  Worldwide, over 100 million people have left the Roman Catholic Church (or others) missing in the rituals and ceremonies of a church.  People are losing faith, not just in God, but in themselves and each other.

My next book - which hopefully, you will help fund - sees this.  

Revenge of A Catholic Schoolboy starts with the story of how I was invited to meet at a group home of retired nuns and priests. At first, I didn’t want to go because of the terrible abuses I’d suffered as a boy at the hands of nuns and priests.  But I asked for guidance, slept on it, and in the morning I awoke and went with an open heart...

By the end of my talk - and to my shock - some of the nuns had tears in their eyes and one curly-haired old nun leaped out of her chair and shouted, “I feel free for the first time in my life to love God without fear.”

A young priest, who’d had a nervous breakdown and was staying at this retirement home, said that they had to go and tell the Pope, because the Indigenous Spiritual Information I’d brought to them could revolutionize the whole Catholic Church and help resolve conflicts between the different religions of the world. 

I was astonished. 

Never in my wildest dreams had I ever thought that coming forward with the Native American Knowledge I’d been raised with could open a door for these nuns and priests long enough for them to see infinite possibilities beyond their cultural and religious beliefs. 

This is what your pledge to this campaign can do - open the door for mutual understanding through the written word.




WHY PEERFUNDING?

I now find myself hard-pressed to finish the book I am currently working on, titled Revenge of a Catholic Schoolboy.

Publishers no longer give advances to writers like me, who aren’t huge national bestsellers, so we can write our next book. 

85% of all books used to be sold by small local bookstores. I’d do book signings at these places and this was my bread and butter, getting to know people first hand, but now that’s all gone. 

I want to publish my next book and - using the power of the internet - connect with my many, many fans and readers (that’s you!).

So, I need your help big time!

I am asking for funds in the amount of $70,000 to help write, edit, publish and market my next book.


I’m prepared to do all I can possibly do so Revenge of a Catholic Schoolboy reaches as many people as possible and as soon as possible. 

Here’s what your money will go towards...

  1. Writing: writing, writing and more writing.  This is what I do!  Did I mention writing?
  2. Research & Legal: all of my books are meticulously researched through interviews and meetings and then lawyers need to review to see that I’m not infringing on individual privacy.  Remember, these are TRUE stories about REAL people.
  3. Editing: not just me, but teams of editors that work to sand down the rough edges of my words to the smooth stones of truth and story you read.
  4. Audio books: recording and producing audio books with a professional actor and/or actress.
  5. Marketing: this is exciting!  For this book, we are going to be doing much of the marketing ourselves - newspapers, magazines, PDFs, friends’ emails, enewsletters, my website, Facebook and this ‘social media’ stuff.  This stuff is all new to me, but I am incredibly lucky in that I have my family and friends helping with this.
  6. Mailing review copies: Contacting, shipping, handling, packaging.  
  7. Online fundraising manager: we’re very lucky to have Morgan Sully as our Web Manager leading the team and doing everything from mercilessly copy-editing my words and voice for the web (sometimes with me yelling at him!), to trouble shooting our tech needs during the campaign.  Do yourself a BIG favor and go hire him for your next project - when we are done with him of course!
  8. A book tour: Yes, you read that right.  A BOOK TOUR.  As I said, I am prepared to do ALL I can to ensure Revenge gets to as many people as possible as quickly as possible.  While this is the bread and butter for my soul, from my years of experience doing this, these things cost MONEY.  Researching the best cities to visit, contacting local media, schools, bookstores, and then finding food, accommodations, venues, flights, PR and a personal assistant (most likely my friend Gary Gernandt or my sister Linda).  Mind you, I just don’t come in for the day and speak to one group of people and leave, but I actually stay in town for several days so that it can become a local event.   This is good stuff, people!  Contact us and invite us to your place.


So please pledge generously!  Email the campaign to your friends, share this campaign on Facebook and Tweet it on Twitter.  You can also help by clicking share.



YOUR PLEDGE HELPS PUBLISH A STORY WITH A POSITIVE MESSAGE!

 

GRACIAS,

V.E.V.

story:
What I do

I write stories for kids and love telling absurd stories that make people smile. I picked up this hobby about a year ago and have been learning and growing ever since. You can check out some of my latest works at www.robtowner.com ALL FREE! This is my website, here you will find:

  • Audio Books
  • Flash Flip-Books
  • Hand-written and illustrated PDF's
  • And just plain silly stories

I have recently written a full feature length novel for children and adults to enjoy and am hoping to raise a marketing budget to generate awareness of the book.

The book is titled 'Animal Friends', and tracks a Christmas Beetle and a Cicada travelling the globe, discovering superpowers they didn't know they had (such as teleportation, mid control etc.) and making friends along the way to defeat the oncoming threat of evil orange cubes.

What I Need

In short, I am hoping to raise $5,000 to market this book online:

All funds raised here will go towards a 5 month long Google Adwords campaign targeting specific keywords needed to reach my desired audience... Kids aged 12 and up.

After extensive research into online book purchasing habits, I believe this will be the best and most cost effective avenue for me to explore.

The Impact

Every single penny that I earn from the sale of this book will be donated to the Westmead Children's Hospital in Sydney Australia. http://www.chw.edu.au/

This means that $5000 in donations here could potentially mean a lot more than that to the hospital.

Why Am I Doing This?

I started writing children's stories because I loved seeing kids smile after they read one of my adventures.

My aim here is to not only make kids smile, but help out the ones that are going through a rough time dealing with burns, cancer and other life threatening diseases.

Accountability: You will be able to track all my progress at facebook.com/FREEstory. Here, I will make available all my Google Adwords expenditure/recepits to ensure I do what I actually say I'm going to do.

If you would like to know more, all my contact details are at www.robtowner.com/contact.htm

Thank you

story:
Our Story

My name is Derek Webster.  As a strategic consultant and speaker, I've had the opportunity to meet with thousands of people trying to make a difference in the world.  The biggest hurdle many have is intrinsic:  bridging the gap between "want to" and "am doing". 


This book is written in the same approach as Malcom Gladwell and provides a framework for both bridging that divide, as well as, for connecting with others.  


The Impact

Over the years, as people have implemented some of the principles suggested and outlined in the book, they've gained traction.  Longing finally caught up with living!  We've seen hip-hop companies and churches started, social ministries, churches, and executives who have all found a meaningful filter by which to impact their divisions.  Most books provide a methodology which may not be applied to every setting.  Others provide great theology, leaving the reader wondering what to do next.  This book bridges that divide.

Recently, a literary agent stated that the writing was very strong, but the platform wasn't broad enough.  In today's market, the author essentially markets themselves.  The author has to have an audience in order to provide something to that audience.  Right now, my base audience is about 500 people.  I am hoping to provide something of real value and help to them in order that they can feel confident to reach out to friends. 


What We Need & What You Get

If you pre-pay the amount of the book, then you'll also receive some free music and small group resources.  After you donate, simply send me an email at derek_webster@mac.com stating you donated.  When the book is published, I'll make sure you get the bonus material.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this on Facebook, Twitter, Digg or any other platform you may have.
