story:
What if all your favorite horror writers, artists and creators could come together around the campfire to share their spookiest, creepiest yarns? At @Midnight_Pals, you get an inside look at just such a hypothetical gathering: From Stephen King's dad jokes to H.P. Lovecraft's unfortunately named cat, no aspect of the horror business remains unskewered when these horror maestros -- and some not-so-maestros -- get together!

Last year, we indiegogo-ed our first Midnight Pals book, Submitted for the Approval of the Midnight Pals, a beautiful tome of ungodly lore with so much EXTRA bonus material! People's responses completely blew away our expectations -- our original crowdfunding campaign made 208% of goal!  But we've continued to expand the Midnight Pals universe with more hilarious Twitter microfiction to the point that people are asking: When is there going to be a follow-up book? So in the best horror traditions, we're bringing you a brand new sequel -- Submitted for the Approval of the Midnight Pals II!!

What do the experts think about the first Midnight Pals? 

“Oh my God, this is pretty funny!” - Brian Keene, Earthworm Gods, Dark Hollow

"I was one of the authors included in the Midnight Society tweets.  Those tweets were unfair, oversimplified my interests, and stung my pride.  I'm pretty sure that means this is genius." - Richard Roberts, Wild Children, Quite Contrary

"HUGE NEVER-ENDING ENDORSEMENT.  Best entertainment thread in Twitter history!"  - Gail Simone, Birds of Prey, Secret Six, Deadpool, Wonder Woman

“Midnight Pals is one of the greatest things to grace the hell that is social media! A loving tribute to the all-stars and obscure weirdos alike of horror literature."
- Slimyswampghost, creator of Sirenhead and Longhorse

“The Midnight Pals make me laugh like nothing else online these days. It’s good!"
- Victor LaValle, The Ballad of Black Tom, The Changeling

"Keep your friends close but keep your Midnight Pals closer!"
- Betty Rocksteady, Dreams We Rot, Arachnophile

The @midnight_pals Twitter account has lampooned everyone from Thomas Ligotti to Junji Ito and now we want to collect MORE of the best, funniest tweets into an all new big, solid, physical grimoire that you can put in your own personal library and possibly rig up so that pulling it from the shelf opens a passage to an underground laboratory or forgotten crypt. That's up to you.  But we want to provide you with the perfect book to use as the linchpin of that scenario. Something you can enjoy at home with your own cult or coven!

 

But why back the sequel, you ask? If you've watched enough horror films, you already know that the sequel is always a lesser effort compared to the original, right? Not this time! We've worked hard to make Submitted for the Approval of the Midnight Pals II into the MUST HAVE companion piece to our original book.

  • More of the hilarious microfiction that you've come to expect from @midnight_pals!
  • Wacky, funny listicles like Neil Gaiman's Top 5 Mythical Hero Reimaginings and Bogleech's Top 5 Creepy Crawlies!
  • Fake ads spoofing the classic inserts from 1990s pulp horror magazines!
  • Cover and illustrations by Michael Ramstead!
  • An introduction by Nebula and Hugo Award winner Ursula Vernon (Author of The Twisted Ones, The Hollow Places)!
  • Single page "horror" spoofs written in the style of some of your favorite horror writers, like Edgar Allan Poe, Shirley Jackson, RL Stine and more! 
  • A BONUS section with a handy introduction to diabolical witchcraft as practiced by Midnight Pals author Bitter Karella, sure to be beloved by any horror buff!

 

And, of course, long time Midnight Pals devotees will be pleased to see know this follow-up collection includes some of the Midnight Pals' most popular bits:

  • Sonia Greene dumps HP Lovecraft
  • Stephen King's visit to Unicorn Fuck Club
  • Ed Lee being HP Lovecraft's wingman
  • Roommates David Fincher, David Cronenberg and David Lynch
  • JK Rowling going off the deep end
  • Patricia Highsmith being Patricia Highsmith

Go ahead and back our book... if you dare! 

It only takes a sponsorship of a mere $5 to get your hands on a deliciously decadent e-book PDF version of 'Submitted for the Approval of the Midnight Pals II' and a mere $10 to ensure that your name will live on in infamy as a sponsor of highest caliber. But surely what you most desire is the tome itself, the truest, purest physical book version! And, to get that, tis a mere $25 sponsorship.  Or $30 if you want it signed by the scribe herself.  Is that all?  Of course not!  At higher levels, you can even get extra goodies...

For $55, you will receive not only a physical copy of Submitted for the Approval of the Midnight Pals II, but also a physical copy of our FIRST book. If you've already purchased a copy of our first book, you will have an option to swap out for a copy of one of my other previous books, either Misunderstanding Comics (A hilarious parody of Scott McCloud's Understanding Comics) or Firebrat (A hilarious horror-comedy parody of the Polar Express and 80s TV Christmas specials about kids fighting Santa Claus on Christmas Eve)!

Have ideas about a particular horror author/artist/director/creator that you'd like to see receive the Midnight Pals treatment? You can designate a victim of your choice to be skewered in up to a full page of new tweets for a mere $100 sponsorship. You can request a page of tweets about an author who has appeared before or someone totally new! It's up to you! (If you have any questions about whether a particular creator would be appropriate, please contact me before you pledge!)

And if you'd like to see a full short story written in the style of your favorite (or least favorite) creator? We've got an option for that too, at the $200 sponsorship level! (NOTE: Authors who were already skewered in this fashion in the first Midnight Pals book are exempt, so I will NOT accept requests to spoof Stephen King, Clive Barker, Dean Koontz, Junji Ito, Thomas Ligotti, Anne Rice, Octavia Butler, HP Lovecraft, or Edward Lee! If you have any questions about whether a particular creator would be appropriate, please contact me before you pledge!)

Bitter Karella (@bitterkarella) is the writer and horror aficionado behind @Midnight_pals. She's been involved with three successful book crowd-funding campaigns: Misunderstanding Comics, Firebrat: The True Meaning of Christmas, and Submitted for the Approval of the Midnight Pals. She lives in a hut on fowl’s legs in the dark of the deep woods and can be summoned by the sacrifice of a white cockerel on the eve of a new moon.
story_txt:
What if all your favorite horror writers, artists and creators could come together around the campfire to share their spookiest, creepiest yarns? At @Midnight_Pals, you get an inside look at just such a hypothetical gathering: From Stephen King's dad jokes to H.P. Lovecraft's unfortunately named cat, no aspect of the horror business remains unskewered when these horror maestros -- and some not-so-maestros -- get together!
Last year, we indiegogo-ed our first Midnight Pals book, Submitted for the Approval of the Midnight Pals, a beautiful tome of ungodly lore with so much EXTRA bonus material! People's responses completely blew away our expectations -- our original crowdfunding campaign made 208% of goal!  But we've continued to expand the Midnight Pals universe with more hilarious Twitter microfiction to the point that people are asking: When is there going to be a follow-up book? So in the best horror traditions, we're bringing you a brand new sequel -- Submitted for the Approval of the Midnight Pals II!!

What do the experts think about the first Midnight Pals? 
“Oh my God, this is pretty funny!” - Brian Keene, Earthworm Gods, Dark Hollow
"I was one of the authors included in the Midnight Society tweets.  Those tweets were unfair, oversimplified my interests, and stung my pride.  I'm pretty sure that means this is genius." - Richard Roberts, Wild Children, Quite Contrary
"HUGE NEVER-ENDING ENDORSEMENT.  Best entertainment thread in Twitter history!"  - Gail Simone, Birds of Prey, Secret Six, Deadpool, Wonder Woman
“Midnight Pals is one of the greatest things to grace the hell that is social media! A loving tribute to the all-stars and obscure weirdos alike of horror literature."- Slimyswampghost, creator of Sirenhead and Longhorse
“The Midnight Pals make me laugh like nothing else online these days. It’s good!"- Victor LaValle, The Ballad of Black Tom, The Changeling
"Keep your friends close but keep your Midnight Pals closer!"- Betty Rocksteady, Dreams We Rot, Arachnophile
The @midnight_pals Twitter account has lampooned everyone from Thomas Ligotti to Junji Ito and now we want to collect MORE of the best, funniest tweets into an all new big, solid, physical grimoire that you can put in your own personal library and possibly rig up so that pulling it from the shelf opens a passage to an underground laboratory or forgotten crypt. That's up to you.  But we want to provide you with the perfect book to use as the linchpin of that scenario. Something you can enjoy at home with your own cult or coven!

 
But why back the sequel, you ask? If you've watched enough horror films, you already know that the sequel is always a lesser effort compared to the original, right? Not this time! We've worked hard to make Submitted for the Approval of the Midnight Pals II into the MUST HAVE companion piece to our original book.

More of the hilarious microfiction that you've come to expect from @midnight_pals!
Wacky, funny listicles like Neil Gaiman's Top 5 Mythical Hero Reimaginings and Bogleech's Top 5 Creepy Crawlies!
Fake ads spoofing the classic inserts from 1990s pulp horror magazines!
Cover and illustrations by Michael Ramstead!
An introduction by Nebula and Hugo Award winner Ursula Vernon (Author of The Twisted Ones, The Hollow Places)!
Single page "horror" spoofs written in the style of some of your favorite horror writers, like Edgar Allan Poe, Shirley Jackson, RL Stine and more! 
A BONUS section with a handy introduction to diabolical witchcraft as practiced by Midnight Pals author Bitter Karella, sure to be beloved by any horror buff!

 
And, of course, long time Midnight Pals devotees will be pleased to see know this follow-up collection includes some of the Midnight Pals' most popular bits:

Sonia Greene dumps HP Lovecraft
Stephen King's visit to Unicorn Fuck Club
Ed Lee being HP Lovecraft's wingman
Roommates David Fincher, David Cronenberg and David Lynch
JK Rowling going off the deep end
Patricia Highsmith being Patricia Highsmith

Go ahead and back our book... if you dare! 
It only takes a sponsorship of a mere $5 to get your hands on a deliciously decadent e-book PDF version of 'Submitted for the Approval of the Midnight Pals II' and a mere $10 to ensure that your name will live on in infamy as a sponsor of highest caliber. But surely what you most desire is the tome itself, the truest, purest physical book version! And, to get that, tis a mere $25 sponsorship.  Or $30 if you want it signed by the scribe herself.  Is that all?  Of course not!  At higher levels, you can even get extra goodies...
For $55, you will receive not only a physical copy of Submitted for the Approval of the Midnight Pals II, but also a physical copy of our FIRST book. If you've already purchased a copy of our first book, you will have an option to swap out for a copy of one of my other previous books, either Misunderstanding Comics (A hilarious parody of Scott McCloud's Understanding Comics) or Firebrat (A hilarious horror-comedy parody of the Polar Express and 80s TV Christmas specials about kids fighting Santa Claus on Christmas Eve)!

Have ideas about a particular horror author/artist/director/creator that you'd like to see receive the Midnight Pals treatment? You can designate a victim of your choice to be skewered in up to a full page of new tweets for a mere $100 sponsorship. You can request a page of tweets about an author who has appeared before or someone totally new! It's up to you! (If you have any questions about whether a particular creator would be appropriate, please contact me before you pledge!)
And if you'd like to see a full short story written in the style of your favorite (or least favorite) creator? We've got an option for that too, at the $200 sponsorship level! (NOTE: Authors who were already skewered in this fashion in the first Midnight Pals book are exempt, so I will NOT accept requests to spoof Stephen King, Clive Barker, Dean Koontz, Junji Ito, Thomas Ligotti, Anne Rice, Octavia Butler, HP Lovecraft, or Edward Lee! If you have any questions about whether a particular creator would be appropriate, please contact me before you pledge!)

Bitter Karella (@bitterkarella) is the writer and horror aficionado behind @Midnight_pals. She's been involved with three successful book crowd-funding campaigns: Misunderstanding Comics, Firebrat: The True Meaning of Christmas, and Submitted for the Approval of the Midnight Pals. She lives in a hut on fowl’s legs in the dark of the deep woods and can be summoned by the sacrifice of a white cockerel on the eve of a new moon.

story:
"EmpowHered"

Empowered: Reforming a Dismissive Health Care System. A book about how negative interactions with healthcare providers and the healthcare system can have a potentially dangerous impact on Black women and their health. And, what they can do to fight back.

My name is S. Mayumi “Umi” Grigsby and I am the author of Empowered: Leading the Fight to Reform a Dismissive Health Care System. I wrote this book because after doctors dismissed my pain for years, I diagnosed myself with what should have been an easily identifiable and treated illness. Although my story had a happy ending, I wondered if other women who looked like me had been treated the same way. They had. Now I am sharing my story and theirs and hope that this will lead to better outcomes for others.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that you are not alone, that you have power and agency, and that you can fight back when you feel dismissed. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for empowering women, and other marginalized communities including members of the LGBTQIA community to fight back against a sometimes dismissive healthcare system, in you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to have in your toolbox in the event that you feel dismissed.

In this book, you'll learn about personal stories of people - mostly Black women - who have had their pain dismissed and ignored.

‘Reese’, who’s story shows us the inadequacies in our sexual health education in public schools.

‘Lyle’, who’s story shows that some doctors are not trained to contextualize.

‘Sheila’, who did everything she could. She researched, tried to find a doctor she could trust, named it, framed it, advocated; tried to establish a rapport; and checked in with her community. Her story shows that you can do everything right and still not receive the care you deserve.

You will love this book if you want to know how a significant portion of the population experiences healthcare in the United States. For example healthcare professionals are less likely to take Black women’s health concerns seriously. Black women are up to four times more likely to die in child-birth than their White counterparts.

And, it is not only Black women. Although women are more likely to suffer from chronic pain than their male counterparts, doctors are more likely to dismiss women when they complain of pain. Doctors are more likely to tell younger women to lose weight, and at the same time will prescribe preventive therapy for their male counterparts. Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Trans- and Queer individuals are hesitant to access healthcare due to inappropriate questions and ill-informed doctors.

For Black women, living at the intersection of multiple forms of oppression, dismissal by doctors can be deadly. And this dismissal cannot be solely attributed to socio-economic status, class, or lack of health insurance.

Empowered: Leading the Fight to Reform a Dismissive Health Care System is a non-fiction book that speaks to women and specifically Black women and other marginalized individuals who are looking at navigating an often dismissive healthcare system and want to fight back and feel empowered.

 

Empowered: Leading the Fight to Reform a Dismissive Health Care System is written in 3 Parts....

Part [1] contains the introduction + additional chapters. Part 1 will detail the historical nature of the problem, leading to the status quo

Part [2] contains Chapters that will delve deeper into the problem and challenges currently facing Black women when navigating our healthcare system.

Part [3] contains Chapters that will propose solutions moving forward.

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Winter 2020

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish.

When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition.

When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • A personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and some additional sections of my manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

The Author - Me!

S. Mayumi “Umi” Grigsby is an attorney with a long history of advocating for policies that empower marginalized communities, particularly women and girls of color, to be the engineers of their own change. She currently works in policy in Chicago - she is a native Liberian, naturalized American and adopted Chicagoan. She previously held a variety of roles locally, nationally, and internationally in grant-making, policy development and logistics, and in criminal justice and litigation.

She wrote this book in the hopes that telling her story and that of others, she can empower others to fight back against an increasingly dismissive healthcare system

She does not present herself as an expert, after years of spearheading community-led, data-informed change - this book is a realization of a life long dream to share her story in order to have a positive impact.

For more information you can connect with Mayumi at umigee2020@gmail.com and @empowheredhealth on instagram.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on

Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/umi.gee.125?ref=bookmarks ,

Twitter - https://twitter.com/GrigsbyUmi , 

Instagram - https://www.instagram.com/empowheredhealth/?hl=en and

LinkedIn - https://www.linkedin.com/in/smayumigrigsby/

with your friends, family and network.

Please use #empowheredhealth and tag me as well as my publisher New Degree Press

Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/NewDegreePress/,

Instagram - https://www.instagram.com/thenewpress/?hl=en ,

LinkedIn - https://www.linkedin.com/company/new-degree-pre... so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,

Mayumi

story:
Short Summary

The ancient and powerful Arcana have fallen. The knowledge they recorded was lost. The artifacts they gathered from civilizations throughout the universe have been destroyed. Their ability to harness the powers of dark matter couldn’t save them. Many are dead. The rest are scattered. And the vengeful defector who brought them down has begun his hunt for the remaining survivors.

When sixteen-year-old Alexander learns he’s an Arcana, the hunt is already underway. All his gadgets, books, and plans to run away have to be put aside. And when James, the young alien instructed to take him to safety lapses him into the heart of enemy territory to settle a personal score, Alexander has no choice but to accept the responsibilities placed on him. That includes learning to wield his new-found dark matter abilities, even though he’d rather not. But nothing is as simple as it seems. Secrets have been kept. A truth has been hidden for thousands of years. If Alexander doesn’t learn who and what he actually is in time, it’s not just his life he’ll lose. Entire worlds will die with him.

Dark Rising is the first book of The Dark Matter Chronicles. It is a young-adult sci-fi/fantasy novel and is meant for anyone who loves:

  • Young Adult books
  • Science Fiction
  • Fantasy
  • Adventure
  • Superheroes and superpowers (really, who doesn't love them?!)
  • Futuristic technology (nanotech, augmented reality, my own version of a super suit!!!)
  • Outer space and all its craziness
  • Physics
  • Science in general
  • Life, the universe, and everything ;)

I intend to publish the book once this campaign is done. In the meantime, check out the Prologue here: http://mxkremzen.com/about/

What I Need & What You Get

With your support, I'm hoping to get a professional cover made for the first book so it doesn't look like the work of a three-year-old, a proper website, and some marketing for the series once this campaign is complete.

What's in it for you?

$5- Lots of gratitude and an ecopy of the book

$10- The digital package: an ecopy of the book + a thank you on my site + more undying gratitude

$15- The super digital package: an ecopy of the book + an exclusive short story related to the book that will not be published elsewhere + a thank you on my site + more undying gratitude

$29- The paperback package: a signed and numbered limited edition, paperback copy of the book that will not be available anywhere else (makes a great Xmas gift...not too early to mention Xmas right?) + an ecopy of the book + an exclusive short story related to the book that will not be published elsewhere + a thank you on my site + even more undying gratitude (Shipping Included)

$50- The super paperback package*: 2 signed and numbered limited edition, paperback copies of the book that will not be available anywhere else, (1 for you and another as a great Xmas gift for someone awesome) + an ecopy of the book + an exclusive short story related to the book that will not be published elsewhere + a thank you on my site + a ridiculous amount of undying gratitude (Shipping Included)

$100- The ultra super unbelievable...Okay, it's the same as the previous level, but I might actually pass out from the dangerous levels of gratitude this will incur. Not enough, you say? What if I write you a personalized thank you letter as well? (Shipping Included)

*Please note: Paperback copies will be ordered after this campaign is completed, so it will take a few weeks for them to be produced and sent to you. 

The Impact

I think my book is worth a read but my opinion is a little biased, (just a little). What I can say, objectively, is that The Dark Matter Chronicles mixes physics, superheroes, aliens, space, and lots of new gadgets. Given the recent discoveries/growing interest in the field of science, (we love you, Higgs Boson, Curiousity Rover, and the all the weirdo Earth-like planets we keep finding out there), I think this is a great time to introduce the young adult audience to new worlds. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I appreciate any form of support anyone is willing to offer. If you can pass along the word about my book, that would be great. Feel free to check out my site for more info: http://mxkremzen.com/

story:
The Passion of la Niña Milagros

I knew Milagros was exceptional the minute I heard her speak.  We met 10 years ago in the English class I taught to mothers at a San Francisco public school. Immigration raids were going on and my students' families were being broken up. I wanted Americans to understand: These families are refugees from violence. Milagros is their voice--and she needs your help!

Milagros is passionate and articulate, and has suffered trauma upon trauma.  How, I wondered, can a human being survive such terrible hardships and remain emotionally and spiritually intact? 

Milagros explains why desperate families flee--read about it on our website: http://www.milagrosvela.com/single-post/2016/09/24/The-Butterflies-Have-Abandoned-Soyapango

 

What Milagros Needs & What You Get

Today Milagros supports her family by working as a nanny, and their economic life is precarious.  All of your contributions will go to support Milagros, so she can spare the time and energy to finish this important memoir.

All contributors will receive the complete e-book when the project is finished.  And for each contribution beyond $25, you will also receive all of the perks from the preceding levels!

Our featured perk, for a contribution of $100, is a fascinating short film by co-author Rita E. Moran about Guatemalan Maya women in contemporary indigenous art.

 

Our Team

To learn more about the team of dedicated supporters who believe in our project, please click "About" up at the top of the page!

 

The Impact

​Milagros' story will help Americans see the human being in the immigrant workers who are part of the fabric of our society:  the nannies, the home health aides; the prep cooks and servers; the housekeepers, gardeners, construction workers, and more. These are my students, whom I have taught--and learned to love--for the past 15 years at City College of San Francisco and San Francisco Unified School District.

As for me, I am a professional writer and editor who fled Silicon Valley after 20 years, to do something that I found more rewarding. I am also a lifelong community activist, having lost my older brother to police violence two weeks before the killings at Kent State. I graduated cum laude from the University of California at Berkeley, and am a member of Phi Beta Kappa national honor society.  I earned a Master of Arts in creative writing at San Francisco State University.  Like Milagros, I am one of 10 children.

You can read more about me at http://www.RitaEMoran.com.

 

Our Challenges

Milagros and I have been developing this book for 9 years. We work together in Spanish, and I translate and edit in English.

We have drafts of many chapters: about her elementary school (in a former chicken coop); and about the guerrillas who trained her to be a child soldier for three years in middle school--and how she defied the school principal and refused to be recruited. And about the first gang riots by the freshman class at the technical institute she attended.  

Read more on our website:  "Guerrillas Come to Middle School" http://www.milagrosvela.com/guerrillas-come-to-middle-school

 

We have the story of Milagros' beloved mother, one of a long line of Nahua midwives and healers; and the story of her brutal grandfather, a Creole landowner who refused to acknowledge his daughter. We have the story of her father, the "Spiderman", an amazing Pipil weaver who was abusive and alcoholic--forever enraged by the loss of his father's property and the descent of his mother into prostitution and witchcraft.  

We have stories about the children foraging for flowers when there was no food, and their eagerness to earn a few centavos making powerful fireworks and rockets at home.

We see Milagros' childhood hopes fluttering through the weedy fields with the migratory butterflies.

And we have the terrible story of the Salvadoran civil war, when Milagros and her family hid in the ruins of their house while the army shelled them for 10 days. 

 

As a child, Milagros asked God, Why do You allow people to hurt other people?  An answer did not come easily.  The book will reveal how Milagros developed emotionally and spiritually through powerful dreamlike experiences, and the dawning of a profound, pentecostal Christian faith.  

Now that I can work full-time on this project, we plan to finish up a chapter a month during 2017, and post them on our website as we go.  See our progress at http://www.MilagrosVela.com!

Your contribution will provide Milagros time and relief from economic pressure, so that she can continue to work with me articulating her hard-won insights.

Note: The photo of Milagros as a toddler is one of the only images we have from her childhood. The other photos you see here are from news reports.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

With this campaign we are also launching our effort to build an audience platform for Milagros' memoir.  When we approach agents and publishers, with your help we can point to a significant following.  Whether or not you can contribute financially, please give us a hand in the following ways:

  • Get the word out about this book.  Refer your friends and family to our website: http://www.MilagrosVela.com.  Please keep reading as we post a new chapter every month!
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word through social media.  Starting right now, we want people to hear our message about the struggles of Central American and other Latino refugees. We want caring people to support them in communities throughout the United States!

story:
Campaign Summary

I am a life-long supporter of Scotland regaining its independence.  I am so committed to that belief that, finally, I realised I had to stop simply talking about it and get up off my backside and actually try and do something to bring that dream a little bit closer. That is what this campaign, Peep the Beeb, is all about. I should say here also that I am not a member of any political party. I simply believe Scotland can and should stand on its own two feet like any other small, self-respecting country.

What the campaign needs to succeed.

An inital quantity of 35,000 sticky labels with the message 'BBC MISREPORTING SCOTLAND' will be printed for distribution throughout Scotland. This will cost £925.00 (+vat = £1110.00).

Packing and distribution will cost around £100.00.

Project Total = £1210.00

Plus Indigogo costs = £1270.00.

Any funds raised in excess of the campaign requirement will be donated to foodbanks across Scotland.

The Campaign Impact

It’s not yet been announced but everyone and their granny knows IndyRe#2 is on the table and will be announced in the not too distant. The SG is already preparing legislation for it.

That means we need to use the time we have NOW proactively. I say that because I very much suspect two things will happen:

1) IndyRef#2 will be called suddenly.
2) It will be a very short campaign, 3-6 months max.

So we need to use the time we have to start campaigning NOW.

The first port of call must be to tackle the BBC's pro-UK broadcasts. IMO, they were the biggest contributer by far to YES losing last time with their relentless anti-indy broadcasts.

We obviously cannot stop their BritNat propaganda from being broadcast (it has never actually stopped) but we DO have the means to significantly dull its impact. The BBC may well control the airwaves but the PEOPLE control the streets.

We need to get stickers made with the simple message that the BBC cannot be trusted; a simple message that will make unaware Scots (soft NOs) sit up and take notice of what the BBC is doing. In short, if we are to win IndyRef#2, we must expose the BBC in Scotland for the propaganda unit of the London Government that it is. We must plant doubt in peoples’ minds about the BBC. We must damage its ‘undeserved credibility.

To do that we get up off our bums and get onto the streets and make our protest there. We get thousands of anti-BBC stickies printed (‘BBC Misreporting Scotland’) andwe give them to everyone and their granny to stick on their jackets, coats, bags etc. We get as many as we can to wear them and get the message out there that the BBC is not to be trusted and is effectively subverting Scotland's democracy. We get it so that the State Propaganda Unit can broadcast all day long but it is to no avail – the people will no longer be listening to them.

The campaign already has street distributors all over the country ready to go. But it now needs YOUR financial support to make it happen, to bring the Beeb's propaganda down to a small peep.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you come across one of the campaign's street distributors then you can help by taking some labels and distributing them to family and friends. Many hands make light work.  Get the message out.

story:
Pourquoi ce livre ?

  • Patrice Dubreuil, petit-fils d’un des fondateurs de Dubreuilville, porte en lui depuis longtemps cette idée de livre. Depuis longtemps, il se pose les questions suivantes : Comment transmettre à toute la communauté et aux générations futures l'histoire de notre famille et de ce village qu'ils ont créé, loin dans le bois ? et Comment la faire découvrir ailleurs au pays ? C’est ainsi qu’il a approché notre maison d’édition, Prise de parole, de Sudbury, pour l’aider à réaliser ce rêve. Nous avons plongé sans hésiter dans ce projet de mise en valeur du patrimoine francophone du Nord de l’Ontario, Dubreuilville occupant déjà un espace mythique dans l'imaginaire de cette région.
  • Nous avons confié la recherche et la rédaction de cette histoire à deux jeunes chercheurs, Sophie Blais et Serge Dupuis. Appuyés par la famille Dubreuil, ils ont effectué un travail de terrain, dépouillant notamment les archives de la famille et de Dubreuil Brothers; ils ont effectué des recherches dans les journaux d’époque et interviewé des dizaines de personnes qui leur ont confié souvenirs et anecdotes; ils se sont aussi inspirés des témoignages écrits laissés par Pâquerette Dubreuil Desgagné et Napoléon Dubreuil. Il en résulte un livre vivant et amplement documenté, écrit dans un langue accessible à tous, comprenant de nombreuses photographies et des extraits de journaux personnels, qui saura intéresser :
    • les personnes qui ont séjourné ou vécu à Dubreuilville, celles qui y vivent toujours, ainsi que tous les francophones du Nord de l’Ontario et du Canada;
    • toute personne qui s’intéresse à l’industrie du bois, à la foresterie et à l’entrepreneuriat, l'essentiel de l'ouvrage portant sur une période – les années 50 à 80 – de grands bouleversement au sein de cette industrie charnière de l’économie canadienne.

École de Mountain Ash Lake, vers 1950

Le Spoutnik, une invention des frères Dubreuil

  • Le livre paraîtra au printemps 2018 et sera lancé à Dubreuilville en juin (date exacte à venir), à l’occasion d’une grande fête. Nous vous invitons à réserver votre exemplaire sans plus tarder ! Vous économisez ainsi 15% sur le prix régulier, vous vous assurerez de le recevoir dès sa parution et nous aidez à faire de cette publication un grand succès.

Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez

  • Les profits de cette campagne serviront à payer une partie du travail de recherche et de rédaction réalisé, sur plus d’un an, par les cochercheurs. Sans ce travail de fond, il leur aurait été impossible de raconter avec autant de richesse et de précision l'histoire d'une communauté pleine de vitalité : la vôtre !
  • En contrepartie de votre contribution, vous aurez droit à des récompenses exclusives :
    • Un livre, qui vous sera acheminé dès sa parution;
    • Une bouteille-souvenir de Coca-Cola qui a servi à insonoriser le centre communautaire de Dubreuilville. Témoin du temps, chaque bouteille contient un fragment de mémoire du lieu... On trouvera à l’intérieur une liste imprimée de toutes les personnes qui ont contribué au succès de la Dubreuil Brothers;
    • Un des quatre modèles de t-shirt qui exprime votre attachement pour Dubreuilville.
  • Un trio composé des éléments ci-dessus;
  • Un forfait VIP d’une nuit pour 2 personnes au Relais Magpie lors du lancement du livre (10 forfaits maximum), qui comprend :
    • une bouteille de champagne;
    • le petit-déjeuner;
    • un livre, une bouteille-souvenir et 2 t-shirts.
  • Un forfait VIP de 2 nuits pour 2 personnes au Relais Magpie (4 forfaits maximum), qui comprend :
    • une randonnée guidée vers le site de Magpie (village original de Dubreuilville) en VTT;
    • les petits-déjeuners;
    • un livre, une bouteille-souvenir et 2 t-shirts.
  • Vous pouvez aussi nous encourager en faisant un don de 20$. Nous émettrons un reçu d’impôt.

* Les contreparties seront expédiées à la fin de la campagne Indiegogo. Le livre sera posté dès sa parution, au printemps. *

** Les personnes qui commandent des contreparties d’ici le 22 décembre pourront recevoir par courriel, si elles le désirent, un certificat à imprimer pour le temps des Fêtes. **

UN GRAND MERCI POUR VOTRE APPUI !

L’équipe derrière le livre

La confection d’un livre est un travail d’équipe. Voici les personnes impliquées dans le projet.

Patrice Dubreuil (entrepreneur, idéateur du projet et conseiller)

Serge Dupuis et Sophie Blais (historiens, cochercheurs et rédacteurs du livre)

Les Éditions Prise de parole ont été fondées en 1973 et publient de la littérature et des essais depuis son ancrage en Ontario français. L’équipe : denise truax (édition), Camille Contré (révision linguistique), Alain Mayotte (infographie, comptabilité) et Stéphane Cormier (révision, promotion)

Collaborateurs : Olivier Lasser (couverture, infographie), Priscilla Pilon (vidéo) et Léo Larivière (cartes)

 D’autres façons d’aider

  • Vous ne désirez pas acheter de contrepartie mais le projet vous intéresse ? Merci de passer le mot à vos connaissances et amis au sujet du livre.
  • N’oubliez pas d'utiliser les outils de partage Indiegogo !

story:
Writing a novel is something so many people have dreamed of. And finally, I am closing in on pursuing this dream, however, I have stumbled across one small problem: money. The past while has saw me move closer and closer to the completion of my goal, and I just need a little help.

I have a series of books I am working on that I would like your aid in completing. I could never complete such a thing alone, and with the help of others, I shall be able to do this.

The £2500 I have requested would go towards multiple things.

- Purchasing the correct software

- Setting up a professional website

- Finance Marketing

- Editing, etc

The first book of the series 'A Dance With Oblivion' would be 'Feast for Fear', followed by 'Song of the Slave'. Hopefully they could be published a mere year apart.

Perhaps though, you may be more willing to help me, if I was to give you a sample of the first novel.

'The abandoned lot made her stomach twist. It felt wrong, being there, but she had been summoned. Not that she had any indication as to who had summoned her - rare, as she always knew. Pale blue eyes scanned the lot, back and forth. Waiting. Anxious. She was normally rather patient, but as every second went by, she got more tense; too close to breaking point.

"I'm surprised you showed." A far too familiar voice hit her ears.

If she had a soul, it would have split in that moment. "What do you want?" She snarled, taking a step towards the two shadows walking towards her. "And how did you manage to summon me?"

A giggle came from the smaller of the shadows. "Oh Gava, don't you ever change? Always so serious!"

"Your problem was you could never be serious enough!" She snapped back.'



I would really appreciate help in getting my work out into the world, especially since it involves a lot of major issues held in today's world. I think it's something that people may find incredibly interesting. It's an idea that's plagued me for years, and I'm finally pushing forward with my dream.

Even if you can't donate anything (even just a pound would be amazing), I still appreciate you looking at this!

Please help me! And thank you!
story_txt: Writing a novel is something so many people have dreamed of. And finally, I am closing in on pursuing this dream, however, I have stumbled across one small problem: money. The past while has saw me move closer and closer to the completion of my goal, and I just need a little help.I have a series of books I am working on that I would like your aid in completing. I could never complete such a thing alone, and with the help of others, I shall be able to do this.The £2500 I have requested would go towards multiple things.- Purchasing the correct software- Setting up a professional website- Finance Marketing- Editing, etcThe first book of the series 'A Dance With Oblivion' would be 'Feast for Fear', followed by 'Song of the Slave'. Hopefully they could be published a mere year apart.Perhaps though, you may be more willing to help me, if I was to give you a sample of the first novel.'The abandoned lot made her stomach twist. It felt wrong, being there, but she had been summoned. Not that she had any indication as to who had summoned her - rare, as she always knew. Pale blue eyes scanned the lot, back and forth. Waiting. Anxious. She was normally rather patient, but as every second went by, she got more tense; too close to breaking point."I'm surprised you showed." A far too familiar voice hit her ears. If she had a soul, it would have split in that moment. "What do you want?" She snarled, taking a step towards the two shadows walking towards her. "And how did you manage to summon me?"A giggle came from the smaller of the shadows. "Oh Gava, don't you ever change? Always so serious!""Your problem was you could never be serious enough!" She snapped back.'I would really appreciate help in getting my work out into the world, especially since it involves a lot of major issues held in today's world. I think it's something that people may find incredibly interesting. It's an idea that's plagued me for years, and I'm finally pushing forward with my dream.Even if you can't donate anything (even just a pound would be amazing), I still appreciate you looking at this!Please help me! And thank you!

story:
About the book:

The first line in “C”, “My mother has cancer,” foreshadows there are no happy endings in this book. In this poignant debut, “you can’t take it with you when you die: memoirs” we are taken on a journey of loss.
Through eighteen essays, we are given a razor-sharp view of how losing someone to a friendship or relationship failure, or death, can forever change the person we thought we were.
In “Emergency”, commencing the second part of the book, Marsh tells the story of the tested love he has for his sister, Marie, and the ultimate sacrifice he made by cutting ties with her.
The most arresting essay, “Sex”, Marsh details five early sexual relationships he says, “Made me an adult.” “Absent”, will surely be the most shocking and discussed of the lot; a foray into the relationship with his estranged father. “Taken”, a stark account of rape, is told without a sliver of self-pity. “Quiet”, the most disturbing, a friend reveals his dark side. In “Snow”, Marsh and his girlfriend are faced with a decision that will forever affect their lives. Three beautiful essays, “Christmas”, “Peace”, and the finale, “Ephemera”, have endings you won’t want to spoil, keeping his secrets as if your own.
Often told in the present tense and with an exemplary command of dialogue, Marsh uses quotation marks only once. Accessible, “you can’t take it with you when you die”, a grand debut on what it means to live, love, and lose, will surely find itself a mainstay in classic memoir.

-Written by Chris Mullins

The Why:

Funding will be used for:

*Printed promotional advertising in major, and literary, magazines.  

*Webpage makeover, design, and maintenance. 

*Recording studio sessions for the audiobook.

*Videography services for promotional videos via author's website and electronic press kits.

*Promotional services via social media outlets.

*Tour support covering transportation, lodging etc. to promote book.

*Licensing fee ($500) to use the gorgeous cover photograph on printed books, advertisements, audiobook casing etc.

What You Get:

Visit my homepage donniemarsh.com to read the full preview essay, "Christmas"!

Personally, I'm a big fan of bonus features and behind-the-scenes goodies so I packed the Special Edition Hardcover Package full of them!

Detailed description of the Special Edition Hardcover Package, exclusively to contributors and will NEVER be sold outside this campaign:

*Shipped 6 weeks before the publication date of 08.08.13!

*Personalized note and autograph to contributor.

*All 18 essays, many with author notes at the beginning or end.

*"Let It Snow" and "Afterlove" outtake essays which became the published, "Heart".

*All outtake essays and alternates will have notes to why they weren't included.

*"Doubt" (outtake)

*"Fear" (outtake)

*"Birthday"(outtake)

*"Peace" (early draft)

*"Diesel" (outtake)

*"Maddy" (outtake)

*"First" (outtake)

*"Snow" (alternate ending)

*"Christmas" (outtake years 1995, 2005)

*"Christmas" (2012, outtake alternate beginning)

*"Ephemera" (alternate ending)

*"Quiet" (alternate beginning)

*"Goodbye" (omitted "Nancy" section)

*"Absent" (early uncorrected draft written 2001)

*Poetry section, "Bloom Where You Are Planted", with 25 poems

*The first short story from my next project: a short story collection.  The story is called "Lucky". A man trapped under a car, makes one last call.

***

In addtion to that packed hardcover, you also get:

*Facsimiles of essay-sketches and outlines for "C", "Christmas", "Goodbye", "Gone", and "Texas Summer" (an essay I never started), in my handwriting with a legend on abbreviations I use while sketching.

*Facsimile of my handwritten essay listing in their original positions before I reordered them for publication.

*2 bonus audio CDs! Disc 1: My reading of a few of the outtake essays. Disc 2: My reading of the entire poetry section and the short story "Lucky".

*5x7 copy of the beautiful cover photograph!

*4x6 copy of the last index card my mother wrote me before passing: instructions on dinner

*5-5x7 candid photographs of me recording the audiobook

*8x10 photo of my computer workstation where the book was written

*5x7 copy of the original book cover before I landed the actual cover image!

*Express-shipping included to anywhere!

Low on dough?

No matter what amount you donate, it's appreciated.  And if you are low on cash, you can always help me out by spreading the word through your social-media outlets and asking others for help as well!

 

In advance, thank you for your contribution and I hope you enjoy the book.  I look forward to reading your comments and meeting many of you on the road!

story:
Micah the Mouse was a Bethlehem mouse,

He lived in a stable instead of a house.

He told everyone of a bright starry night.

When he secretly witnessed an amazing sight!

    The slide show above is a preview of 6 of the beautiful illustrations Ashley Otis, a gifted young artist, has created to bring to life the Christmas story as told in rhyme by Micah the mouse.


    The book will be a high quality soft cover, 36 pages with 14 full color illustrations.  You can order autographed copies of Mouse In The Manger now at our special pre-sale price!  


     Share the Christmas story from a new perspective with all the special children in your life.   Micah’s narration in perfect rhyme, and observations by the animals add to the appeal for both children and adults 


     A Study Guide provides questions to test comprehension and connect to Bible references for parents or teachers to add Bible study if desired.  

    

 You’ll be a part in sending the Christmas story around the world to help introduce children to the birth of Christ and who He is.   Your donation will be used to pay the artist, format and print the book, and launch a marketing campaign. We’ll need an estimated $7500 for this initial phase.  If extra funds come in, an edition in Spanish will be published.

    

 For a donation of $10.00 for each book, you can receive any number of autographed copies of Mouse in the Manger, AND, another of my rhyming stories, “The Mouse Who Saved Christmas,” a secular story from my unpublished book, Once I Was a Kid, Memories of Growing Up On Grampa’s Farm.  For example, for $50, you'll receive 5 books.

    

 Donate $20 for a Perk of my first book, Tommie Turtle’s Secret, which won Best Children’s Book, and Book of the Year in the 2008 Florida Writer’s Association Royal Palm competition. Donate $30 or more for both books.


      You can follow our progress on the book on

 http://www.facebook.com/MouseInTheManger          

Refer your friends to “Like” Micah's Facebook page - Mouse In The Manger.

story:
The Story So Far...

Based in Ypsilanti, Toronto, and Brooklyn, The Cultural Gutter was founded in May, 2003 with the intention of providing thoughtful and provocative writing on disreputable art. Since then, we've had ten editors in two countries and five cities write on comics, romance, genre movies, tv, science fiction, fantasy, video games, and porn films. And in all that time we paid our writers, both regulars and guest stars. Then we lost our operations funding. In 2013, a small, rag-tag band of donors joined forces to keep the Gutter online and helped us keep our commitment to paying writers for their work. Our survival for the next year depends on Gutterthon. We hope you'll consider donating.

What We Need & What You Get

Our $3100 goal breaks down to: $400/year/writer (or about $33/article); $400/year for the Evil Overlord for publishing, promoting, finding new writers, day-to-day content management and making sure all the perks are shipped out;  $382/year for our fine Webhost at No Media Kings; and about $600 for printing and shipping perks, promotional materials, paying any guest writers and paying Indiegogo and Paypal fees. These fees take up a significant chunk. For example, if we hit our goal of $3100, Indiegogo will take $277 in fees, leaving us $2883 before Paypal's fees. If we don't hit our goal, Indiegogo will receive 9% of whatever we make.

In return, along with thoughtful and provocative articles on subjects like Duran Duran & William S. Burroughs; Jackass & masculinity; Frozen & Jane Austen; Godzilla & Realism; The Mummy (1999) as love story; Planet of the Apes & relatability, you will have your choice of some fine perks.

The British Fantasy Society Award-nominated Fox Spirit Books have donated digital copies of their anthologies, Noir Carnival and Guardians. Noir Carnival is a genre-bending collection, "The carnies bring you stories, a heady mix of shadows and candy floss, dreams gone sour and nights that go on too long. Let them lure you into the tent." It  includes, "The Mermaid Illusion," a story by the Gutter's own Carol. Guardians is an anthology based on the question, "What if the thing you were afraid of was what stood between you and a bloody death?" Copies are available in both Mobi and ePub formats.

Our sister site Pornokitsch donated books from their Jurassic London imprint, including a signed copy of limited edition printing of Kim Curran's Glaze, "a combination of astute technological insight, uneasy social commentary and brilliant adventure." They've also donated digital copies of The Book of the Dead. "The Book of the Dead addresses the most fascinating of all the undead: the mummy. The mummy can be a figure of imperial dignity or one of shambling terror, at home in pulp adventure, contemporary drama, or apocalyptic horror," featuring stories by Gail Carriger and Paul Cornell; British Fantasy Award Finalist A Town Called Pandemonium, "the wildest, weirdest West you'll ever visit: a shared world anthology created by some of the best new writers in horror and fantasy"; Unearthed, "eleven classic tales of the mummy, selected by John J. Johnston (Egypt Exploration Society) and Jared Shurin"; The Brick Moon (1869), "a lost classic of Victorian SF--the first tale to imagine the launch of an artificial satellite"; and  Lost Souls, "Two dozen carefully restored tales of damnation and redemption."  They've also kindly donated digital copies of Speculative Fiction 2013, "which collects over fifty pieces from all corners of speculative fiction fandom--from book criticism to incisive commentary on important issues like sexual harassment at conventions; from feminist themes in summer blockbusters to life-changing video games; from the merits of grittiness to the downfalls of grimdark." The essays selected by The Book Smugglers' Ann Grilo and Thea James include Monster Island Resort Podcast's Miguel Rodriguez'"The Good Outnumber You: A Look At Heroism In Storytelling," first published on the Gutter.

The Gutterthon Library, including digital editions of Noir Carnival; Guardians; The Book of the Dead; A Town Called Pandemonium; Unearthed; The Brick Moon; Lost Souls; and Speculative Fiction, 2013.

ETC Press has donated print copies of The Cultural Gutter (2011), a collection of pieces published on the Gutter from Jim Munroe, James Schellenberg, Carol Borden, Chris Szego and Ian Driscoll. This print version also has fantastic infographic illustrations by artist EJ Lee.

A new set of five Sexy Supervillain Postcards by artist and YA authorEvan Munday: This time featuring The Joker, Thanos, General Zod, Juggernaut and Solomon Grundy.

An Abominable Dr. Phibes assemblage created by artist and jewelry-maker Edie of EJPCreations

A Gutterthon-themed necklace made by EJPCreations. 3 pendants featuring Jane Austen, Godzilla and one of the taglines of the Gutter itself: "Beyond Good And Bad There Is Awesome." The whole necklace is antiqued brass with a gunmetal chain and extension/counterbalance.

A digital email subscription to the next 10 mini-comics publisher by Silber Media. Silber publishes mini-comics about a robot fighting his programming; a saxophone-playing walrus in a post-apocalyptic wasteland and a speculative biography of Conan-creator, Robert E. Howard.

The Gutter's own Carol Borden will be donating handmade homunculi as well as more papier mache skulls with facial hair painted on them and a variety of hand embellished notebooks:

An orange, 8 x 6" Fabriano Ecoqua Notebook with hot lava monsters and volcanic eruption on the cover drawn by the Gutter's own Carol.

Light Blue Cthulhu handprinted on a dark blue pocket Moleskine.

Gray pocket Moleskine with the Snake Venom mask from Five Deadly Venoms handprinted on it

NEW PERK: The Gutter's own Carol will bake you cookies and ship them to you (Sorry, International friends shipping cookies is US ONLY, but if you do select this perk, Carol will send you a chocolate chip or Earl Grey cookie recipe).

A poster of the glorious Gutterthon banner designed by Brian Kirby of Shelf Life Clothing Company, designer of the Cleveland Caucasians t-shirt, and Capo di Capos at Drive-In Mob

A Cultural Gutter Membership package including a numbered and dated CG Membership Card and a decryption key for decoding the CG Secret Messages posted at the top of the Sponsor's Page.

And a CG Super Pack, with a signed copy of The Cultural Gutter; a papier mache skull with facial hair painted on it by the Gutter's own Carol Borden; a surprise Moleskine decorated by Carol; a Gutterthon poster and a CG Membership package.

But even $1 gets our Undying Thanks.

If we don't reach our goal, we'll use the funds to print and ship your perks, pay our webhost and see how much we can pay each editor. Exceeding our goal would give us breathing room with regards to being able to hire guest writers and create promotional materials to leave at comic and bookstores, cafes and theaters.

The Impact

We like to think that the Gutter offers something that is unusual online: Clear-eyed, thoughtful and thought-provoking writing on disreputable art and media. If you donate or support the campaign by sharing, you will help keep the Gutter online and running; support our particular take on disreputable art; and help support paying writers for their work.

We ran a successful fundraiser last summer, we sent out all our perks, and, thanks to everyone's help, we kept going.  With your help, we can do it again. The Cultural Gutter's survival does depend on Gutterthon.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that times are hard for a lot of people and any little bit helps, even a retweet or sharing our campaign on Facebook. Indiegogo has tools that make it easy.

Thanks!

story:
Hi, my name is Ren and I’m writing a novel.  “The Lost Boys” follows a traveling, evolving family of queers  through the rural South, the San Francisco Bay Area and points in between as they search for their missing family matriarch/patriarch T.  The story is told through a mixture of narrative, fragments of journal entries, letters and codes in the landscape. Part epistolary, part queer southern gothic and part landscape choreography, the novel investigates queer communities, alternative family structures,  gender and sexual identity and the connections between bodies and spaces. I'm grateful for my community and I feel like this work is kind of a love letter to those spaces and groups that I've been fortunate to be a part of. 

I plan to take one month off of work in August/September and create a writing residency which will allow me to devote all of my time to writing so that I can complete a draft of the novel and print a chapbook of selected chapters.  I need some financial support to live and write for one month and print chapbooks. I’m reaching out to you, my friends, community, and readers, to help support the writing of this work and the publication of a chapbook! 

 

Read an excerpt here.

 

Thanks for your support!
story_txt:
Hi, my name is Ren and I’m writing a novel.  “The Lost Boys” follows a traveling, evolving family of queers  through the rural South, the San Francisco Bay Area and points in between as they search for their missing family matriarch/patriarch T.  The story is told through a mixture of narrative, fragments of journal entries, letters and codes in the landscape. Part epistolary, part queer southern gothic and part landscape choreography, the novel investigates queer communities, alternative family structures,  gender and sexual identity and the connections between bodies and spaces. I'm grateful for my community and I feel like this work is kind of a love letter to those spaces and groups that I've been fortunate to be a part of. 
I plan to take one month off of work in August/September and create a writing residency which will allow me to devote all of my time to writing so that I can complete a draft of the novel and print a chapbook of selected chapters.  I need some financial support to live and write for one month and print chapbooks. I’m reaching out to you, my friends, community, and readers, to help support the writing of this work and the publication of a chapbook! 
 
Read an excerpt here.
 
Thanks for your support!

story:
My Story

 

My name is Calethia Horton, and I am the CEO and founder of On One Accord Foundation. On One Accord Foundation was created to help adult incest rape survivors and children born from incest find their reason to survive through advocacy at the federal, state and local levels, resource assistance to survivors, and creating a community of survivors to promote healing together. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

These stories can only come to life with your help. With your support, this inspiring work will be able to go from being a manuscript to an edited and published book, straight to your hands for a unique reading experience.

 

In order to show our sincerest appreciation for your support, we are offering a variety of special "perks" for the first few donors who claim them. Among them are "Reason to Survive" T-shirts, autographed copies of the book, and an opportunity to actually appear in the book as a contributor!

 

In addition to the offered perks, all donors of $100 or more will be entered into a drawing to win a luxury trip for two to Hawaii or the Bahamas, valued at $2,500. All donors of $250 or more will be entered into a drawing to win a couture piece of art valued at $5,000.

 

Disclaimer: Proceeds from this fundraiser will not go to the organization, but to the publication and distribution of my book, A Reason to Survive.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Like us on Facebook, join our group on LinkedIn, follow us on Twitter @OnOneAccordFdtn, and check out our website www.ononeaccordfoundation.org. We need your help to support these survivors and share their stories, so spread the word about our campaign: friends, family, coworkers, everyone! Together we can all find a reason to survive.

 

Thank you and God bless,

 

Calethia

story:
Salva Quinto Real


Probablemente seas  alguna de las antiguas socias, padres o madres que conoce el Club Juvenil Quinto Real.
Así  que conocerás la ilusión con la que las niñas vienen todas las semanas.

Hace dos semanas tuvimos una mala noticia.

Debido a una avería, el agua de la lluvia  ha ido desplazando silenciosamente la tierra debajo de las zapatas de hormigón de la casa, y el terreno ha cedido.

Inmediatamente hemos tenido que suspender las actividades del club, y los profesionales nos han recomendado actuar cuanto antes para que el problema no sea mayor.

Ahora mismo no hay riesgo de accidente ni derrumbe, pero si se deja unos meses, puede haber problemas serios.

Acaban de entrar las excavadoras para levantar el terreno, tienen que excavar en la fachada de entrada unos 4 metros de profundidad y rellenar con grava por debajo de la casa.

NECESITAMOS TU AYUDA

Van a estar trabajando durante 20 días para solucionar el problema, y necesitamos recaudar 25.000 dólares, para poder hacer frente a los gastos que va a suponer.

La única opción que tenemos es actuar y tenemos que hacerlo ya, si queremos salvar el club.
Sabemos que contamos con tu ayuda. Dona lo que puedas y consigue todos los donantes que puedas.
Muchas gracias de todo corazón, las niñas del club y por supuesto los padres, madres y monitoras te estaremos siempre agradecidos.

SAVE Quinto Real

You probably used to come to Quinto Real as a kid or you are a mother or a father who knows the club, which means that you know how excited the girls get everytime they come to the club. 

Two week ago we received bad news.

Due to a leakage, rainwater has slowly moved the soil under the concrete shallow foundations of the house and the land has given in. We’ve immediately suspended all activities at the club, and professionals have suggested that we fix the matter as soon as possible, before it gets any worse. 

At the moment there is not risk of accident or collapse, but if we don’t act now, in a few months there could be serious problems that would be harder to fix. An excavator just entered to dig the field; they'll have to dig 4 meters in the front of the building and fill with gravel all that's under the house.

 WE NEED YOUR HELP They will be working for 20 days to solve the problem, and we need to raise $25.000 to face the expenses. The only option that we have is to act and act now if we want to save our club. We know we can count on you. Please donate what you can and help us find more donors. Receive our most sincere appreciation. The girls from the club, the parents, and of course the house residents will always be grateful to you.

story:
Welcome to my page, I'm so honored that you're here! 

My name is Karla Mosley. I am stage and screen actress from Westchester, NY, currently residing between coasts (meaning that I'm bicoastal, not that I live in Chicago...get it?). I also have a knack for telling awful jokes.

But I digress. I can currently be seen daily on The Bold and the Beautiful and Friday nights on Hart of Dixie. You can learn more about all that here: www.KarlaMosley.com and here: www.twitter.com/karlamosley. (The clip above is with Drew Carey on The Price is Right. Skip to 2:25 to hear a song that was based on one of my haikus!)

But the reason I hope you're visiting this page today is to support Haiku Project 2014!!

Two years ago I read about a man in Japan who was well over 100 years old and had written a haiku every day for over 50 years. So, I decided to make the same commitment for 1 year.

As I posted these poems, I began to get daily requests for a compilation of my haikus. You know, subtle things like, "So what about that book, Mosley?!" 

After much prodding I finally listened and I've spent the last year writing, re-writing and editing these short poems, which I've now come to adore.

Through this journey I've learned how much can be said in just 17 syllables, how powerful words are, and how it may be true that everyone has at least one book lurking inside them.

Beyond the absolute personal joy that I'll get from having an actual published book to share with all of you. I'm even more excited to share these poems with people who haven't yet encountered them. I've worked very hard to provide a daily dose of love, nostalgia, sage wisdom (...from a 32 year old :-)), a chuckle, and possibly a little relief from some of life's tough moments.

I thank you so much for being on this journey with me. Truly. And I will continue to keep you posted on all that's happening along the way!

What We Need & What You Get

Why $3000?

I want to be clear that none of the funds you donate will go into my own pocket. Because this book has come from community, all funds will go back into the community.

Specifically: $2500 will cover the cost of publishing (including page layout, cover creation & printing of 50 books); the other $500 will cover the printing of any books over the included 50 and shipping costs to send you your signed copy!

Any money that goes unused or that is collected above the $3000 goal will be donated to www.writegirl.org.

In addition to your book, I'll be throwing in some really fun perks including: signed scripts from my shows, studio tours, personalized haikus and, my personal favorite, a veggie dinner party in LA and/or NY hosted by me!!!!

Plus, there will be more surprises along the way, so stay tuned....

Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to donating you can help me spread the word! Everything works better with a team, so please join mine!! (Don't worry, we always win.) 

*Let your friends and family know about the campaign, those I might not be able to reach on my own or haven't reached yet.

*Post, Post & Re-Post the link to your social media sites and tell your folks why you are excited to be a part of creating this book.

*Brainstorm! I'd LOVE to hear your ideas about how I can spread the word, perks you'd like to see listed and places you'd like to see the book.


And most of all THANK YOU!!!!!!!!!

story:
Smoking Glue Gun + Chapbooks = Love

Hi, we're Blake Lee Pate and Taylor Jacob Pate, the editors of Smoking Glue Gun. Smoking Glue Gun is an independent online magazine run out of our home in Austin, Texas. We're passionate about finding innovative, striking art and writing—in the last two years we’ve published over 100 writers and artists on smokinggluegun.com. 

We’re excited to tell you we'll soon become a magazine & chapbook press. 

This spring we plan to release Sunburn / Freezer Burn, an art and poetry chapbook by Colleen Barry, and Pattern Exhaustion, a new chapbook by poet and editor Nate Pritts. We’re young poets ourselves, and we’re dedicated to putting new voices into the community. But we need to raise $2,000 to cover the cost of printing these chapbooks. So we're turning to you, our oldest and newest readers, to ask for help. 

Your contribution will aid in funding the printing of Pattern Exhaustion and Sunburn / Freezer Burn, and if we meet our goal, allow us to continue printing chapbooks in the future. In exchange for your support, we’re offering you the first copies of the chapbooks, as well as sneak-release PDFs, signed copies, broadsides, art prints, and even one of Colleen Barry’s original drawings. The chapbooks are printed on a limited run, so this is our chance to make sure they reach the hands of our strongest supporters. Your contribution not only supports our small press and these shining poets, it also aids our effort to showcase more poetry & art in the future.  Thanks!

The Chapbooks

Pattern Exhaustion is arresting in its contention between stillness and life. The I of this broken long poem is at once human and ghost—startlingly close, and disconnected. The poem begins with the lines, “I forget myself / but I remember the morning,” and page after page we are humored, held close, ruined, and renewed. If a reader recoils from Pattern Exhaustion, it is because the poem presents the truth, just to uncover it and reveal the heart beneath, mechanical and raw and beating.
Nate Pritts is the author of six books of poetry, and the the founder of H_NGM_N, an online journal and small press. The undisguised sincerity of Nate's poems immediately struck our hearts when we first published his poems in Volume 2, and we've been in touch with him since—he is a strong supporter of new poets and small press publishing, as well as an extremely generous and kind person.

Colleen Barry’s debut chapbook Sunburn / Freezer Burn is a small, shining treasure box. These poems and—as Barry considers them—poem-drawings, create a land of apocalyptic whispers, bleak confessions, wild colors, and weird love. Barry’s left-handed drawings are at once delightful and haunting. Together with her poems, they put the reader through a brutal kind of nostalgia. When Dean Young read the manuscript, he wrote, “It is as if Colleen Louise Barry has made an atom bomb out of a pencil, a rubber band and a band-aid.”
Colleen Barry is a poet, artist, and teacher living in Western Massachusetts, and a graduate student in the MFA Program for Poets and Writers at UMass Amherst. Colleen first published a series of erasure-poems in Volume 6, and we've been following her poetry since. Working with Colleen on this chapbook has been an experience comparable to that of reading Sunburn / Freezer Burn—delightful, surprising, refreshingly honest. Her enthusiasm and imagination for this project has been essential to the process.

The Small Press Impact

Your support of Smoking Glue Gun, Colleen Barry, and Nate Pritts goes much further than the simple printing of two chapbooks. By supporting a new independent small press, you are helping us create a venue for emerging & established writers like Colleen and Nate, whose work is proof that writing communities and small press publishing are alive and happening all around us. Your commitment to this campaign is also a commitment to the life blood of poetry and art. It's a notion that you believe, like we do, that holding a book written by a person and designed, printed, and sent to you by a group of hard working hands is a valuable experience—one that should live on.

The Funds, The Perks!

As we mentioned above, Smoking Glue Gun is independently run, so we're funded out-of-pocket. We’re asking for your help in raising the funds to print our first run of chapbooks. Your contribution to this campaign will be directly applied to the cost of printing and binding Smoking Glue Gun chapbooks, and the chapbook campaign materials (broadsides & prints). Your contribution will also cover the cost of shipping your perks. 

So let’s talk about the perks: first off, we’re offering every supporter a pre-order of one or both chapbooks—it's a limited run, so get your hands on them quickly! And don’t worry if you can’t wait to get them in the mail—The Insider’s Club includes an immediate sneak-release PDF of both chapbooks, and a signed copy of each chap. 

We at Smoking Glue Gun love to combine art and writing: The Left-Handed Draw includes a print of Colleen's drawing, "Pez Prez," from Sunburn / Freezer Burn, as well as both chaps. The Brooding Broad includes the chaps and a broadside from Pattern Exhaustion, designed by editor Taylor Jacob Pate.

For those of you who, like us, just can't get enough of these poets, we're offering The SGG Lover. Complete with both signed chapbooks, a broadside from Pattern Exhaustion, an art print from Sunburn / Freezer Burn, and a handwritten note from the SGG editors. It's really the complete package. But that's not all:  The Collector: Barry makes you the owner of the original drawing, "Pez Prez," as well as both signed chapbooks, and a note from the editors. Or, choose The Collector: Pritts, and receive the original Pattern Exhaustion broadside design, painted by editor Taylor Jacob Pate.

                                 

     Colleen Barry's "Pez Prez." Original and prints available!

Other Ways You Can Help

We realize that some of you just won't be able to contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t still support us! We have a great appreciation for building a community through word-of-mouth. So if you're excited about these poets, these chapbooks, and this small press, make some noise! Use the Indiegogo share buttons to tell others about our fundraising campaign, and keep updated with all things Smoking Glue Gun on our Facebook or @smokinggluegun on Twitter. If you're not all that in to social media, write a note, send an email, or simply tell a friend. The support of our readers is one of the most valuable things we can have as a small press, and for that, you have our deepest thanks!

story:
Angels Fight Demons and "Feds" In Chicago!       

    Based on true events that actually took place in Chicago, Illinois, Demons of Federal Misconduct:  A Chicago Memoir! is an enthralling book, and "controversial" legal drama one could easily liken to novels written by John Grisham.  It also bears an uncanny resemblance to This Present Darkness and Piercing the Darkness, two bestselling fiction works by Christian author Frank E. Peretti, and includes angels, demons, a federal investigation, and the FBI.  But there is one significant difference between those books and this one: this book is not-fiction!  It is a true story!

   Author Christopher Myron Claxton, Ph.D., MBA, and ordained Christian minister meticulously enumerates his belief that Satan used three demon spirits to influence certain feds to destroy his Christian business (and popular radio program), and the Christian law practice of his business associate - just because they brought glory to God. The author deftly guides his readers into the "unseen" world of spiritual warfare, including an epic, supernatural battle between angels and demons inside the Dirksen Federal Building in Chicago! 

   This 450-page modern day nonfiction "case study" in spiritual warfare in the 21st century U. S. Justice System and Corporate Chicago is brought to a resounding crescendo as God intervenes on behalf of the author and his business associate through the U. S. Supreme Court, former President George W. Bush, and other honest federal officials, including President Barack Obama!

   Christopher Myron Claxton is a native of Detroit, Michigan, where he attended high school with world-renowned (retired) pediatric neurosurgeon, 2016 Presidential Candidate, and bestselling Christian author, Dr. Ben Carson.   Mr. Claxton holds a Ph.D. in Social Science; an MBA in Accounting and Behavioral Sciences from the University of Chicago; a Master’s degree in History; and a Bachelor’s degree in Finance from Michigan State University.   Dr. Claxton is a former Lecturer in Finance at DePaul University in Chicago and presently teaches business and social sciences in Chicagoland.  He also studied at the Moody Bible Institute, and is presently a Bible college teacher of Prophecy and Biblical Eschatology.  Dr. Claxton has over 40 years experience as a businessman and as an educator; and has served over 37 years in Christian ministry.  Dr. Claxton and his wife, Bonita, have been married for 43 years.  They have four adult children and six  grandchildren.

   Although it reads like a science fiction thriller or like a story from the Bible,  "Demons of Federal Misconduct:  A Chicago Memoir!" is a true story, that is a “must-read” for everybody!  

(In fact, should you choose to preview any of the selected Chapter Links that I have provided below--either in print or audio, I believe that you will find them quite enjoyable and edifying.  The audio versions of Chapters 6 & 13 feature "demonspeak,"  which is an integral part of the legal chapters!) 


                                    ANGEL INVESTMENT CIRCULAR

                                            


Christopher Myron Claxton      About The Author

                                                      Document Links

T.O.C.  Book Reviews     Preamble     Introduction     Preface     Chapter One 

Chapter Two   Chapter Three  Chapter Four  Chapter Six  Chapter Thirteen  

Declaration Of Sovereign   Angel Circular                                      

                                                   Audio Links
Preface  Chapter Two  Chapter Three   Chapter Six  Chapter Thirteen

                                       Radio Program Sample
