story:
NEWFOUND PATH By: Stephen R. Stanford

Originally a screenplay by yours truly, Newfound Path has altered into a novel. I'am hoping to self publish in the Summer of 2012. With your help, this dream can happen. My name is Steve Stanford, an aspiring screenwriter, and Producer from St. John's, Newfoundland. Over the years, through many of my stories, Newfound Path has continued to amaze me, time and time again. Never did I expect this story would one day blossom into a novel. It was a difficult time transforming script to novel, however this journey has allowed myself to dig deeper into the characters lives, and understand them in a way, I never knew possible.

When Lauren Ashton was 18, she wasn't certain where her path might lead.
But she was sure it would lead away from Newfoundland, away from her family....
away from her alcoholic father. Focused on changing her life, Lauren sets off to pursue her dreams, down glamorous roads as far away from home as she can find. Ten years and a new life later, Lauren receives news of her father's death, and must finally return to confront a past and a family that are all but a distant memory.

Shunned by her mother and widowed younger sister, Lauren soon finds both her home and family as much changed as she has herself. From encounters with her ex-boyfriend, to reconnecting with her sister, can Lauren's views on Newfoundland change or can a divided family find again that which makes them whole? When childhood secrets are revealed, can Lauren escape again so easily, or will it set her off on a new path of self-discovery? A path much closer to home than she ever thought possible.


 I respectfully ask for your support and generosity, in the self publication of this novel. 

GOAL: $3,000.00 

This covers all expenses of the self publication including the production of promotional  material. Newfound Path will be available as an E Book and will be available Barnes & Noble, Chapters, Indigo, and Coles. A book buyers preview will be available and will also accompany a booksellers return program for retailers. Newfound Path will be available for distribution with your support. When the duration of this drive ends, any remaining funds that are raised once the goal is met, will be used directly for a book tour. 

While perks are listed, any contribution is greatly appreciated. Even a dollar makes a difference. 

*Stay posted for weekly updates! 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
Spread the word!! Let your friends and family know, share on Facebook, and Twitter.

story:
THIS CAMPAIGN HAS ENDED. Please connect with us here:

 

SUPPORT ANGELA FADDIS

 

Only a few hours left! 

This campaign is almost up. Unfortunately we have a ways to go towards our goal, however - we will still write the book. 

We are $1500 from our "plan b" goal which will still allow us the funds needed to write/edit/publish the book. We'll print less copies and make a few cuts, but can make it happen if we raise another $1500 in the next 15 hours!  

Thanks to all of you who have already given! 

Sincerely,

Chris Faddis

---

Chris & Angela on "The Bishop's Hour" Radio Program in Phoenix: 

Monday, May 21 at 11am on 1310 AM in Phoenix and will re-air on Thursday, May 24 at 9pm. If you can't catch it on the air - you can listen to it at www.thebishopshour.org

UPDATE 5/17/12:

Watch Chris & Angela's Interview on Catholics Matter

We were interviewed for a local TV segment that airs after the televised Mass each Sunday in the Phoenix area. You can see that interview about this project and our journey by clicking here.

----- 

What Storms May Come

A year ago, my wife Angela was diagnosed with Stage IV Colon Cancer which had spread to the liver and was given very little hope of cure or survival. He diagnosis was a shock - both because of her age and preceding excellent health, and because she had no warning signs previous to developing a complete blockage in her colon.

 

It was Easter Sunday and as many were heading to Church, we would learn the most difficult news of our lives. Angela's words to me in those moments following the initial news were, "Jesus still rose, and so we are going to trust."

Resurrection day took on a whole new meaning for our family that day. In the hours following, I asked Angela if it was okay for me to post the news and request prayers. She agreed and we posted the news to Facebook asking for urgent prayers. The amazing response that came in over those few days and the months since have been incredible. Promises of prayers said, Masses offered, candles lit and more have continued to come in from people all over the country and even a few from around the world. 

 

The past year has been one of tremendous struggle, but also one in which God has proved his love over and over again. It is often hard for us to see that love through the difficult and challenging battles along the way. We have been so grateful for the continued prayers and support of so many friends and loved ones and complete strangers who continue to pray for us and encourage us on this road.  

 

Early on in this journey, I remember sharing that we felt that God was going to use our trial for his glory. Indeed the many emails and comments we've received from so many are about the ways in which our story has inspired or encouraged their faith or their marriage. I'm not sure we are deserving of this credit - indeed it is only God's working that has kept us faithful during this year. But, God uses us in ways we never could have imagined sometimes. 

It is Well - Life in the Storm

The song, "It is Well" has long been a favorite of ours and the story behind the song is an incredible example of the kind of faith it takes to get through such a difficult trial. The song was not written in the organ loft of a Church, or on a mountain top retreat.

Horatio Spafford wrote the words as he traveled on a ship from the U.S. to England to meet his wife who had gone ahead to England with their four daughters. During their trip, the ship capsized and Spafford's four daughters died. His wife was all he had left. Having already lost much of his property to the Great Chicago fires and his only son, Spafford was most definitely in the darkest part of his life. Yet, as he passed over the spot where his daughters had died, he wrote the words "Whatever my lot, thou has taught me to say, it is well, it is well, it is well with my soul." The song was later put to music by Philip Bliss and the rest is history. 

This image of Spafford passing over the greatest storm of his life and penning these words is one that gives us a great deal of hope. If a man can lose it all and lose it all again and again and still say these words, then truly his grace is sufficient for us no matter the storm. This past year has certainly been a year of learning to say, "It is Well" while passing through this storm.

With this inspiration in mind, Angela and I have set out to tell our story in a book that we're calling, It is Well - Life in the Storm. The book will be a memoir detailing the accounts of our last year and how God has continued to strengthen us throughout this storm and given us hope. We certainly do not have the corner on suffering, however we hope and pray that this book will be an encouragement to many who are dealing with similar trials in life. 

While we are Catholic, we believe our story can be of help to any Christian and even non-Christians. So our book will be written with that in mind. We will not hide our faith, but we also hope to make this story accesible.

I (Chris) will be the primary writer, but Angela will chime in with her own thoughts and reflections throughout.

What We Need & What You Get

In order for us to write and publish this book we need your help.There are a lot of costs involved in publishing a book. We've decided to self-publish as it's the best thing for us. The book can be published sooner and more of the income from the sales will help our family directly as opposed to helping a publishing company. However, we still want this book to be done well. So we have hired an editor to work with me through the process, will hire a designer to professionally design the cover and layout. Also, some of the funds will help offset my income during the writing process so we can be sure the book is done in a timely fashion. Plus there are marketing costs as well in order to be sure the book get's out. 

All of these things take money. So we are asking you to come alongside us in making this book a reality. We are launching this crowdfunding campaign to fund the writing, editing, design and publishing of this book. Our goal is $15,000 and will provide for three months time for writing and editing along with hiring an editor and paying for the graphic design/layout as well as the printing of the book. 

The goal is to have the book written by the end of June and then revisions/editing during the month of July with a publish date of sometime in August. After perks are rewarded, we'll then release the book to the public in September.

Perks

You can give any amount. However, we have set up some perks on the right that you can take advantage of. But any amount is a great blessing. The perks include anything from a digital download of the book to multiple copies of the book, or dinner w/our family and Grammy Nominated Christian Artist, Matt Maher. There is also a perk for parishes who would want to share the book with their Church. 

What It Will Take

What will it take to get there?
-If 600 people give $25 - we would reach our goal.
-If 200 people give $75 - we would reach our goal.
-If 60 people give $250 - we would reach our goal.
-If 10 people gave $1500 - we would reach our goal.

What if you raise more?

If we raise more than the $15,000 we will buy more copies of the book to cover perks and there are a few additional projects that go along with the book that we may use the funds for - also any excess amounts will go back to our family for support and medical costs. Our hope is to begin an emergency fund for our family that will offset things during the times when it is hard for me to work, etc.

If we raise less than the $15,000 - we have a backup plan for getting the book published and printing enough copies to cover the perks.

Other Ways You Can Help

SHARE + SHARE + SHARE - please.

In addition to making a contribution - we also need your help in spreading the word. Back in the summer when we raised funds for Angela's advanced treatments - our fundraising page had been shared over 2,800 times! Those shares directly led ot over $7k in contrbutions.

Please use the links in this campaign to share with others through Facebook, Twitter, Email - etc. 

We also need your prayers - for Angela, for our family, and for the success of this project. Your prayers are what have kept us going!

 

 

HOW TO CONTRIBUTE:

A few people have mentioned having issues making a contribution. I wanted to provide a few instructions on how to make a payment using Paypal – regardless of if you have a Paypal account.

1. Click “Contribute Now”
2. Fill out the information requested on the next page. This includes your perk selection, your contribution amount and providing your contact and mailing info for delivering your perks.
3. Click “contribute” and the very bottom of the page.
4. Then follow the instructions for completing your payment via Paypal. Note – you DO NOThave to have or use a Paypal Account to make a contribution. The image attached shows how to make a payment with or without a Paypal account.


How to Make a Contribution

story:
What is Cuffed?

Cuffed is the Vancouver International Crime Fiction Festival to be held on March 11-13, 2016 on Granville Island, Vancouver, Canada.

The plan is to bring some of the best crime fiction writers from around the world to captivate you with their stories and mayhem. There will be seven events spread over three days with an opening reception on Friday night.

To lead up to the inaugural festival the plan is to produce two stand-alone events to take place in 2015.

Why do we need funding?

Putting on a world class writing festival is expensive. You must start with seed money to take advantage of government grants and to pursue sponsors. The goal is to keep tickets sales affordable.

Venues, hotels, transportation, even food are only a few of the expenses to put on a world class festival. It is expensive and that’s why we need your help.

If we reach the goal of $28,000 this will help towards creating a festival that will become a must-attend event for years to come.

What’s in it for you?

At any level of contribution you will become a founding member. You will be an integral part of initiating this great event. Your name will appear in our inaugural program and on the www.cuffedfestival.com website. All founding members will have advance ticket sale privileges.

The books offered as incentive gifts can be picked up at the festival (no mail-outs.)

All members will be updated on the full slate of events and get the inside news on some festival surprises.

For any other information contact us at    info@cuffedfestival.com

What can you do to help make this happen?

Make a contribution to the category that appeals to you. For some this might mean your love of crime fiction became a little more concrete with your attachment to Cuffed. And for others the chance to attend the opening reception and meet your favourite writer will be too tempting not to take part.

Share this site with your crime fiction loving friends and help us reach other people to make sure Cuffed will happen. And for this we will be eternally grateful.

Bail Alma out.

Who’s on the team?

Our leader and producer is Alma Lee. Alma is the founder of the Vancouver International Writers & Readers Festival. She knows how to run a writers festival. An extensive career in the literary world has given her a broad base to draw on. Alma’s other accolades are too many to list and range from the Woman of Distinction Award to the Order of Canada. Alma loves reading crime fiction.

Tricia Barker is our Associate Producer. Her background of marketing and events is extensive and includes creating the Robbie Burns Reading Marathon. Tricia's with us because she ran into Ian Rankin in Scotland and he said, “Contact Alma Lee when you get back home.” She took Ian's advice. Tricia loves reading crime fiction.

Lonnie Propas is our Artistic Director. Lonnie is well known throughout the literary community as a great interviewer. His knowledge of the writers and their craft allows him to dig deep into the minds that make up the stories. Lonnie has been involved with the Vancouver International Writers and Readers Festival as well as the Vancouver Fringe Festival. Lonnie loves reading crime fiction.
story_txt:
What is Cuffed?

Cuffed
is the Vancouver International Crime Fiction Festival to be
held on March 11-13, 2016 on Granville Island, Vancouver, Canada. 
The plan is to bring some of the best crime fiction writers from around the
world to captivate you with their stories and mayhem. There will be seven events spread over three days with an opening reception on Friday
night. 
To
lead up to the inaugural festival the plan is to produce two stand-alone
events to take place in 2015.
Why do we need
funding?
Putting
on a world class writing festival is expensive. You must start with seed money
to take advantage of government grants and to pursue sponsors. The goal is to keep tickets sales affordable.
Venues,
hotels, transportation, even food are only a few of the expenses to put on a
world class festival. It is expensive and that’s why we need your help.
If we reach the goal of $28,000 this will help towards creating a festival that will become a must-attend event for years to come.
What’s in it for you?

At any level of contribution you will become a founding member. You will be an integral part of initiating this great event. Your name will appear in our inaugural
program and on the www.cuffedfestival.com
website. All founding members will have advance ticket sale privileges. 
The
books offered as incentive gifts can be picked up at the festival (no
mail-outs.)


All
members will be updated on the full slate of events and get the inside news on some
festival surprises. 
For any other information contact us at    info@cuffedfestival.com
What can you do to
help make this happen?
Make a contribution to the category that appeals to you. For
some this might mean your love of crime fiction became a little more
concrete with your attachment to Cuffed. And for others the chance to attend the
opening reception and meet your favourite writer will be too tempting not to
take part.
Share
this site with your crime fiction loving friends and help us reach other people to make sure
Cuffed will happen. And for this we will be eternally grateful.
Bail Alma out.
Who’s on the team?

Our
leader and producer is Alma Lee. Alma is the founder of the Vancouver
International Writers & Readers Festival. She knows how to run a writers
festival. An extensive career in the literary world has given her a broad base
to draw on. Alma’s other accolades are too many to list and range from the
Woman of Distinction Award to the Order of Canada. Alma loves reading crime
fiction.
Tricia
Barker is our Associate Producer. Her background of marketing and events is
extensive and includes creating the Robbie Burns Reading Marathon. Tricia's with
us because she ran into Ian Rankin in Scotland and he said, “Contact Alma Lee
when you get back home.” She took Ian's advice. Tricia loves reading crime fiction.
Lonnie
Propas is our Artistic Director. Lonnie is well known throughout the literary community
as a great interviewer. His knowledge of the writers and their craft allows him
to dig deep into the minds that make up the stories. Lonnie has been involved with
the Vancouver International Writers and Readers Festival as well as the
Vancouver Fringe Festival. Lonnie loves reading crime fiction.

story:
Introduction 

Ethiopia From Within is a book project about the people of Ethiopia - a portrait of the Ethiopians. The purpose is to contribute with understanding and knowledge about the lives, traditions and customs of the Ethiopians and thereby contribute to improve the image of the country. 

Through personal encounters and conversations and in collaboration with the local population, I will seek to make this an authentic and beautiful portrait - a portrait of the people, as it is given by the people. 

For more detailed information, please visit www.VenturePress.dk 

What is needed 

I need help to cover three basic costs: day-pays for the Ethiopians who take time to engage in the conversations, salaries for the translators and a beautiful layout of the book.

Other expenses, like flight tickets, guest house, food, motorcycle maintenance, benzene, camera and recording equipement, will be covered by me. 

Giving the people a voice

The book will be based on personal encounters and conversations with people from around the country. And by giving the people a voice, the goal is to have the people tell about themselves, their lives and their ways. 

Why this book matters

The image of Ethiopia is often distorted and bad. Reminiscences from the humanitarian disaster in 1983-85 still linger in the minds of many Westerners. 

But as many economists agree, there is a positive correlation between the image of a country and its financial state. And the situation has changed a lot in Ethiopia since that 1985; in so many ways Ethiopia is evolving into a modern African country. And the kind and hospitable people and the ethnic and cultural diversity that is nothing but captivating, make this a country unique.

I feel obliged to show this - because it is fair, because it is needed, and because I have the opportunity to do so.

Who am I

My name is Joakim Larsen. I am a photographer and writer from Copenhagen Denmark and owner of VenturePress.dk.

I know Ethiopia well and have a profound affection and respect for this unique country and its people. I speak the language and have a good network of people, who can be hired in at different stages of the book. 

When will the project start

The work with the project began in October 2014 and is now in its initial fase. Preparations are made for the first trip, which is scheduled to begin on November 5, 2014. And throughout the winter of 2014-15 the people of the 9 different regions of the country will be visited. I anticipate that the book is ready in October 2015.

Progress of the project will be posted regularly on VenturePress.dk

This project matters. 
Please support it.
* * *

Testimonials by

Ethiopia From Within is a project that you can enjoy supporting. Historically most articles about Ethiopia portray its citizens as being hapless victims of poverty.

Nothing could be further from the truth and Joakim who has spent the last 3 years meeting and listening to them talking about their lives, dreams, culture and history is the person to bring their voices to the wider world.

Through pictures and their words they will show a country of fabulous ethnic diversity, sheer beauty and the history of the development of a nation and its communities from ancient times to the modern day. A place that is as rich and successful as any nation in the world.

Reading it will be a truly uplifting experience.

Stephen Whaley, England, Enterprising Ethiopia (www.enterprisingethiopia.com)

* * *

In his own pace, Joakim Larsen, author and photographer, succeeds to create the ultimate connection through the conversation with the individual Ethiopian men and women. The beautiful rousing photos, each of which accompanies the conversation and advocating vitality despite often difficult circumstances, insist on a willpower we Westerners often deselect through ways of abundant donations.

Joakim Larsen captures the love of this beautiful country and its people by passing the naked skin in the meeting with another person to be portrayed. He is as such not only an excellent photographer, but also a pioneer who adds his pictures a life-spark through the portrayal of their lives for the good and, unfortunately, also much bad. As he aptly expects this meeting will 'Whatever happens' be a 'part of the experience' (Joakim Larsen).

I highly recommend Joakim Larsen is supported in this project's coming to life.

Conny Bendixen Danielsson, Denmark, Psychologist, Candidate in Psychology

* * *

It is an honour to endorse Joakim Larsen's ambitious project, ETHIOPIA FROM WITHIN. 

Not only is Joakim a brilliant photographer but he has a passion for the people of Ethiopia as well as their many and varied stories.

This project is about the people who make up this land as told by them....the stories of the people who live here and shape this country. Joakim beautifully captures their spirit in photos that move beyond the usual travel observations.

I have watched Joakim's love for this country grow and have seen how he is able to show the beauty and soul of people living within an ancient culture rapidly moving into the modern world.

It is a project worthy of all the support it can receive. This is a story from the heart of the people who make Ethiopia what is and what it will become.

Richard Trout Johnson, Canada

* * *

story:
Short Summary

"Swing State" is my second novel, to be released by NYC's Three Rooms Press in October. It concerns itself with, among other things, bullying, veterans returning home from war, baking bread, fireworks, gameshows, and football.

I'm selling copies of the book -- and my previous two books, "Hidden Wheel," a novel, and "Double Nickels On The Dime," an installment of Bloomsbury's acclaimed "33 1/3" series on the Minutemen's 1984 album of the same name. I also have copies of my band Dead Trend's debut CD for sale, and, finally, copies of my record review zine "Kayfabe," and issues of my broadsheet literary journal "Cabildo Quarterly." Any and all moneys raised will be put towards a 2015 promotional tour.


What I Need & What You Get

Here's the breakdown of how things work:

  • In 2012, I was able to tour the West Coast and most of the East Coast of the U.S.A. with the money I raised through a similar campaign. This money pays for travel expenses. Unlike being a band on tour, say, there's no door fee for most readings, so pre-sale of books allows me to hit as many cities as possible.
  • I'm offering books, CDs, and zines direct to you.
  • If I don't raise all $2500 in the next 30 days, any/all contributions will be refunded.

The Difference

My previous fundraising campaign was more successful than I could have hoped. With that said, I made some mistakes. Here's how I'll do things differently this time:

  • All books, CD's, and zines are on hand. My last campaign lagged because I was a little too ambitious: I had an amazingly difficult time completing an audio version of my previous novel, which delayed getting contributors their rewards. this time, I'm prepared.
  • I have a good relationship with the post office, ensuring you get your rewards quick.

Risks & Challenges

The risk here is that I won't be able to raise enough money to fund this project. I plan to be proactive in soliciting donations, as I was the first time around.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, you can help in other ways:

  • Hype the project on Facebook and Twitter.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Hi, my name is Flavio Nienow and I need your help to stay in Canada!

I arrived here two years ago from Brazil, and have fallen in love with this beautiful, diverse and fair country!

My dream has always been to become a journalist in North America, and it brings me immense joy to say that I did that!

I recently got a full-time reporter job in British Columbia. The problem is that I can only be in the country for 3 more months because my work permit is about to expire and there is no extension. The federal government has made the lives of foreign workers in Canada extremely difficult, leading to a fall of 75% in applications in August 2014.

I need $5,000 to hire the services of a lawyer in British Columbia that will help me stay in the country and continue working as a journalist. 

Please help me continue to achieve my dreams.

If I reach my goal of $1,500 in 21 days, I will be able to meet the first payment.

If for some reason you cant make a donation today, please share this with your friends!

Thank you from the bottom of my heart.

Yours sincerely,

Flavio Nienow

story:
To claim your downloadable PDF please message me your email so that I may send it to you with a personal thank you email! -N

 

Carousel Boys...

After years of trying to get my already completed horror novels and novella manuscripts through the massive slush piles of the publishing world I decided to go rouge.


Carousel Boys is not your little sister's vampire story. It's the tale of two college aged gentleman on a vampire road trip to New Orleans through crass experiences with dangerous women and creatures that go bump in the night. It also has the f-word in it. A lot.

If this sounds your sort of reading material please help support it's manifestation from my computer to reality.

By donating you'll be free to not only receive a downloadable copy but also original art, music, and even a physical copy so you can love and smell the ink for yourself just as I plan too.

 

About the Author...

Raised in the foster care system I was exposed to a lot of darkness. As I grew older I would create darker worlds to fight the darkness by creating characters within them that could go through such frighting and f***ed ordeals to learn something at the other side, or die trying.

 

As I got older I began finding my own happiness but there is still a lot of darkness in the world so I continue to write horror for all the fellow freaks like me who love a good book to curl up with and go bump in the night.

 
Why Should You Help?
 

Making books is a costly dying art form, as such it is harder and harder for creative talent to get published. As an entertainer I don't need to get rich, I just want to share my stories with the people who want to find them. As such I am only asking for what I need to repay the costs of self-publishing and giving a chance for all of you who have supported me since the beginning to be a part of this.

 

And more importantly so I can give you all cool things you deserve for supporting me when others wouldn't.

 

Please spread the word and pick whichever perk you want. So glad to share this with you all. -N

story:
I want the whole world to Free Their Creative Spirit and to get to their Radiant Lives! My Your Radiant Life' Book will inspire you and teach you the Radiant life techniques. This is a workbook to take you from just beginning to 'Wake Up' to what we want and don't want in our lives in this busy, crazy, tech world! Learn how to be a Free Creative Spirit that is Radiating their inner power, using their intuitive abilities and creative expression. We need to turn ourselves inside out! get rid of labels, fears, old tapes running rampant in our minds. We need to live our Radiant Lives and now! Oh yes we can! with the meditations and the Your Radiant Life Book. I Believe in you and in all of us. We can do this! We can create a better world. 

It began for me...
Waking Up for me started at birth. I had three intense experiences in my first year and then at eight a deep, awakening that I wouldn't understand until I hit almost 50.

For the past 30 years I have been searching, researching, creating and expressing as an artist, a broken, hurt struggling artist. I have always searched for truth and knowledge in my art and creations, allowing them to take me on my journey, to my inner spirit, to connect. I was rewarded, had successes, was recognized. Still I was unhappy, unfulfilled, over weight, angry, lonely, hurt and fearful. 

For the last 8 years I have begun looking at my creative spirit, my consciousness,and my unconscious.  I craved knowledge about unknown topics, magic, intuition, spirits, sound therapy, frequency, energy, planetary alignments, corruption, lies, truth, aliens, ancient history, our beginning, our bodies, identity, expression, metaphysics, everything. I needed to understand life, my life, the big whys. I needed to be happy and expressive and powerful. I needed to be free. There had to be more than what we are being shown as a model for a happy life. I knew as an artist, as a creator, that we were all taught to be uncreative by society, to not respect or learn about our 'out there' senses. Our creativity was to be used to make us consume.  This kind of success didn't seem to be making anyone happy to me. It all made me more than a little sick. We are discouraged from asking these kinds of questions, but I had to. As I did this my world and consciousness expanded even more, calling it into my awareness, expanding my intuitive abilities, my UNDERSTANDING of my intuitive abilities and then I began to think about sharing this with the world. That was Lesson One in how to steer my life, how to call and manipulate energy for the life I wanted. I had to learn more and then I had to share this.

For the past three years I have been creating mental exercises that I decided to call meditations, but they are more than that, they are affirmations, but they are more than that, they are metaphysical calling tools, ways for us to learn about ALL of our senses, abilities  In Metaphysics we hear to FEEL our loves and desires, well my Radiant Meditations help us practice this feeling, this powerful calling. We learn to Drive the Body Vehicle probably for the first time. We learn about our fears and internal blockages and how they are connected to our outer world. The Your Radiant Life Book teaches us the theory and shares with us my journey.  Radiant Life Principals and Tools teach us to be better internal listeners.

Just in Time For the New Time of Aquarius.  

a bit about me

  • I am Metaphysical Teacher and Student Shae Vere, Mystic and Award Winning Artist.
  •  I am currently working on my Metaphysical Doctoral Degree with my thesis topic being, you guessed it, Radiant Life and Meditation. (Help me get it down!)
  • I am passionate about consciousness, creativity and our inner power.
  • I am a proud mother of two Radiant wonderful daughters, one amazing son in law and a couple of loving doggies
  • I am planning my next steps which is traveling for my Radiant Life and oh yes I will be sharing that here as an IndieGoGO fundraiser too! 
  • I am a happy, single almost 50 year old Radiant Meditating Vegan
  • I love horses, travel and crows

Please see my Radiant Life and Meditation Online Classroom www.doyouregg.ca

Please see my current professional website www.shaevere.ca

Please see my past art website http://starseedmedia.wix.com/shae-vere-art

If you have ANY questions, I am happy to answer them! info@shaevere.ca 

A Few Testimonials from some of the students I have worked with over the last three years

  • by Keith M. Layton, Complete Do Your Egg
    I have been working with the Do Your Egg material for about a month now and I am finding this series of guided meditations to be effective in processing the energetic mental emotional and physical issues that are coming up for me as I continue to work on healing early childhood trauma.
    I started meditating 35 years ago and have been doing a buddhist meditation practice consistently for the past 5 year...Shae does a good job of explaining the basic 7 chakra system and the intentions of each meditation as well, making this material suitable for beginners as well as experienced energy healers. This is a good course for people interested in coming into conscious awareness of and Involvement with good energetic health and hygiene.
  • by Ashlee MacEwen, Amazing Guidance Shae is so knowledgeable, non-judgemental, truly a spirit that wants to help others find their right path with her supportive guidance
  • by Trisha Clarkin, 6 months ago
    Empowering Having worked with Shae one on one, and doing her do your egg meditation, has helped me to feel better:) I am thankful!

BRILLIANT, ACTIVE AND POWERFUL!!

  • by Lorie Roerden,Shae Vere's meditations are Brilliant, Active and Powerful! I have been meditating for most of my life and have never found such clearing, empowering and actively moving energetic meditations in my experience. These meditations have assisted me in removing and releasing energy blocks, removing fear patterns, energetically freeing myself from old worn out programming, helping me open my heart, connect to The Earth Mother, Feel who I truly am and release my pain. 

    Shae is a brilliantly connected and an inspirational teacher who guides with love and opens me up to my own true power to transform and become my highest and best self. 

    I highly recommend working with Shae, doing her meditations and opening up to all the possibilities that unfold from within. 
    With Love and Joy, Lorie Roerden~

  • Reviews Average Rating: 5 Star Rating for ALL of my ONLINE COURSES 


Why I need Money 

SO here I am. The workbook needs completion,
This is why I need your support and I will be so happy to support you right back!
I need the time and money to finish this important and now I know, life's work.  I feel in this crazy time in our collective history, we need tools and new ideas to get us out of this crazy world we have created. We need coaches, books, new world meditations and all the help we can get! I truly believe in us and in my Your Radiant Life Book to help inspire and teach others to get to their inner power and happiness in their outer lives.

Details

  • Finishing writing and Final Edits by Shae
  • Cover Art by Shae
  • Printing of Book, more money more books will be printed and sent out!
  • Preparation of final drafts for print and digital
  • editor -professional fees
  • video and web banner promotion
  • If donations are high, I will hire a marketer 
  • Reaching my goals means a finished printed hard Cover and Soft Cover copy of YOUR RADIANT LIFE Workbook
  • Reaching my goals means a digital copy of YOUR RADIANT LIFE Workbook too!

 What You Get

  • Okay what do you get? dependant on the donation amounts
  • Everyone gets the digital book and/or hard cover book
  • Everyone gets an online course, Get Started or The Complete Do Your Egg Radiant Life and Meditation Online Course
  • How about a private Radiant Life intuitive coaching session with me live on skype?
  • How about a private Spirit Reading creating just for you by Shae herself?
  • You get to help me help the shift of consciousness in humanity
  • Some will get my YOUR RADIANT LIFE tshirt too

Help Change The World

                            One Person At A Time

 I see the earth going through so much change and harm. I see our disconnection, our disbelief. As an Empath and Intuitive I feel our pain for both sides of this reality. I see that we can learn how to use metaphysical principals and the magic of our own bodies and abilities to bring ourselves out of this muck we are now stuck in collectively  This is the Radiant Life Way, through creative spirit and expression in our lives.

I believe in us. In Our Hearts. In our Spirit. In Our Journey. I believe In our creative potential. I believe in our abilities to change everything. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Help me pass this around! I need help with places to speak too!

  • Get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • suggest me to your favorite radio hosts
  • buy the book and give it to a stranger
story_txt:
I want the whole world to Free Their Creative Spirit and to get to their Radiant Lives! My Your Radiant Life' Book will inspire you and teach you the Radiant life techniques. This is a workbook to take you from just beginning to 'Wake Up' to what we want and don't want in our lives in this busy, crazy, tech world! Learn how to be a Free Creative Spirit that is Radiating their inner power, using their intuitive abilities and creative expression. We need to turn ourselves inside out! get rid of labels, fears, old tapes running rampant in our minds. We need to live our Radiant Lives and now! Oh yes we can! with the meditations and the Your Radiant Life Book. I Believe in you and in all of us. We can do this! We can create a better world. 

It began for me...
Waking Up for me started at birth. I had three intense experiences in my first year and then at eight a deep, awakening that I wouldn't understand until I hit almost 50.For the past 30 years I have been searching, researching, creating and expressing as an artist, a broken, hurt struggling artist. I have always searched for truth and knowledge in my art and creations, allowing them to take me on my journey, to my inner spirit, to connect. I was rewarded, had successes, was recognized. Still I was unhappy, unfulfilled, over weight, angry, lonely, hurt and fearful. For the last 8 years I have begun looking at my creative spirit, my consciousness,and my unconscious.  I craved knowledge about unknown topics, magic, intuition, spirits, sound therapy, frequency, energy, planetary alignments, corruption, lies, truth, aliens, ancient history, our beginning, our bodies, identity, expression, metaphysics, everything. I needed to understand life, my life, the big whys. I needed to be happy and expressive and powerful. I needed to be free. There had to be more than what we are being shown as a model for a happy life. I knew as an artist, as a creator, that we were all taught to be uncreative by society, to not respect or learn about our 'out there' senses. Our creativity was to be used to make us consume.  This kind of success didn't seem to be making anyone happy to me. It all made me more than a little sick. We are discouraged from asking these kinds of questions, but I had to. As I did this my world and consciousness expanded even more, calling it into my awareness, expanding my intuitive abilities, my UNDERSTANDING of my intuitive abilities and then I began to think about sharing this with the world. That was Lesson One in how to steer my life, how to call and manipulate energy for the life I wanted. I had to learn more and then I had to share this.For the past three years I have been creating mental exercises that I decided to call meditations, but they are more than that, they are affirmations, but they are more than that, they are metaphysical calling tools, ways for us to learn about ALL of our senses, abilities  In Metaphysics we hear to FEEL our loves and desires, well my Radiant Meditations help us practice this feeling, this powerful calling. We learn to Drive the Body Vehicle probably for the first time. We learn about our fears and internal blockages and how they are connected to our outer world. The Your Radiant Life Book teaches us the theory and shares with us my journey.  Radiant Life Principals and Tools teach us to be better internal listeners.Just in Time For the New Time of Aquarius.  a bit about me
I am Metaphysical Teacher and Student Shae Vere, Mystic and Award Winning Artist.
 I am currently working on my Metaphysical Doctoral Degree with my thesis topic being, you guessed it, Radiant Life and Meditation. (Help me get it down!)
I am passionate about consciousness, creativity and our inner power.
I am a proud mother of two Radiant wonderful daughters, one amazing son in law and a couple of loving doggies
I am planning my next steps which is traveling for my Radiant Life and oh yes I will be sharing that here as an IndieGoGO fundraiser too! 
I am a happy, single almost 50 year old Radiant Meditating Vegan
I love horses, travel and crows
Please see my Radiant Life and Meditation Online Classroom www.doyouregg.caPlease see my current professional website www.shaevere.caPlease see my past art website http://starseedmedia.wix.com/shae-vere-artIf you have ANY questions, I am happy to answer them! info@shaevere.ca A Few Testimonials from some of the students I have worked with over the last three years
by Keith M. Layton, Complete Do Your EggI have been working with the Do Your Egg material for about a month now and I am finding this series of guided meditations to be effective in processing the energetic mental emotional and physical issues that are coming up for me as I continue to work on healing early childhood trauma.I started meditating 35 years ago and have been doing a buddhist meditation practice consistently for the past 5 year...Shae does a good job of explaining the basic 7 chakra system and the intentions of each meditation as well, making this material suitable for beginners as well as experienced energy healers. This is a good course for people interested in coming into conscious awareness of and Involvement with good energetic health and hygiene.
by Ashlee MacEwen, Amazing Guidance Shae is so knowledgeable, non-judgemental, truly a spirit that wants to help others find their right path with her supportive guidance

by Trisha Clarkin, 6 months agoEmpowering Having worked with Shae one on one, and doing her do your egg meditation, has helped me to feel better:) I am thankful!



BRILLIANT, ACTIVE AND POWERFUL!!

by Lorie Roerden,Shae Vere's meditations are Brilliant, Active and Powerful! I have been meditating for most of my life and have never found such clearing, empowering and actively moving energetic meditations in my experience. These meditations have assisted me in removing and releasing energy blocks, removing fear patterns, energetically freeing myself from old worn out programming, helping me open my heart, connect to The Earth Mother, Feel who I truly am and release my pain. Shae is a brilliantly connected and an inspirational teacher who guides with love and opens me up to my own true power to transform and become my highest and best self. I highly recommend working with Shae, doing her meditations and opening up to all the possibilities that unfold from within. With Love and Joy, Lorie Roerden~


Reviews Average Rating: 5 Star Rating for ALL of my ONLINE COURSES 

Why I need Money SO here I am. The workbook needs completion,This is why I need your support and I will be so happy to support you right back! I need the time and money to finish this important and now I know, life's work.  I feel in this crazy time in our collective history, we need tools and new ideas to get us out of this crazy world we have created. We need coaches, books, new world meditations and all the help we can get! I truly believe in us and in my Your Radiant Life Book to help inspire and teach others to get to their inner power and happiness in their outer lives.Details

Finishing writing and Final Edits by Shae

story:
My publishing team originally published Shades of Gay in September 2010 in direct response to the six teenagers who took their lives that month because of anti-gay bullying. The book is a coming-of-age story set in a rural small town and featuring a gay high school senior who has a bright future ahead of him--but who struggles with coming out and starting his first relationship on top of trying to figure out where he is going after high school.

We still believe strongly in the book and really appreciate the continuing support of those who purchased the first edition and spread the word about the story. Everyone's support, in addition to a few positive reviews and our placement as a semi-finalist in the 2011 Amazon Breakthrough Novel Competition, tells us how valuable and important a story Shades of Gay is all of you.

Now we're ready to release a brand-new edition with all new cover art. We believe Shades of Gay is as important a story as ever as LGBT equality movements heat up all over the world. We need your help to bring this story to the millions of young people who feel isolated, alone and despondent just because of their sexual orientations.

You can help produce Shades of Gay and spread hope to our young people. 

Your donation will help us:

* Pay our photographer and some models for participation in creating the cover photograph

* Allow us to produce sample copies of Shades of Gay to get some buzz going.

In addition to our undying thanks, you'll receive a special gift depending on your level of donation:

Copper Level ($1-$5) - Your name is mentioned on our acknowledgements page and in our hall of fame on our website and Facebook page.

Aluminum Level ($5-$10) - In addition to the Copper Level gifts, you'll get a personalized autograph you can put inside your book or frame and hang.

Iron Level ($10-$20) - You'll get a promotional poster in addition to the above gifts.

Bronze Level ($20-$50) - You'll get all of the above, plus an autographed copy of the novel.

Platinum Level ($50-$100) - You'll get a reproduction of original artwork by cover designer Alessia Cesana in addition to the other gifts.

Silver Level ($100-$500) - You get a personal invitation to our launch party for the new edition of Shades of Gay (date and location to be announced.) 

Gold Level ($500+) - You get the opportunity to have dinner with author and advocate Jack Ori in addition to ALL of the above.

***

In addition to all these gifts, you'll have the satisfaction of knowing that you've contributed to a campaign to help stem the tide of youth suicide in the LGBT community. LGBT youth are four times more likely than their peers to attempt suicide, and a staggering 41 percent of transgender youth attempt suicide every year. We believe that a lot of youth suicide comes from feeling isolated, alien and alone. Shades of Gay was written in response to teen suicide and can help young people realize that they are not as alone as they thought. So by contributing to this campaign, you can help make a difference for these children.

If you can't help financially, you can still help us spread hope to LGBT youth by posting this campaign on your social networking sites.

story:
Short Summary

I have a goal of raising $4,000 to cover the costs of self publishing a 300 to 350 page novel that I have written titled,Masoth the Journey Beyond.

This is a cross cultural sc-fi novel which uses the science fiction to analyze the personal struggle of a someone who comes from an international and multilingual background. To date, I have seen very few sci-fi novels that delve in culture in the way I am doing it and from the perspective I have as a person.

What We Need & What You Get

$4,000 for the cost of self-publishing.

The Impact

This book presents a side of sci-fi very seldom touched on or even heard from in the mainstream publishing world. It also has the possibility of breaking down international and cultural barriers by exposing the reader to a train of thought new to their own perspective.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word about my project to friends and family.

story:
Hey everybody!

My interdisciplinary work has been accepted to a conference in Glasgow and I need your help to get there!!  Last year I conducted research connecting two topics not typically discussed in conjunction with one another, Tattoos and Constellations.  My work opens up a dialogue promoting understanding of these two often ignored and marginalized expressive forms.   Sharing my writings would mean entering my work into a global dialogue being shared with academics, educators, and artists.  On a personal level, I would meet people from all walks of life and gain a better understanding of opportunities out there for interdisciplinary minded people, as well as share work I care deeply about.  If tattoos, constellations, or "sharing ideas" don't interest you then let me appeal to your nationalistic side-- I will probably be one of only a couple Americans in attendance and very seriously wanna "represent".

This project was the result of many all-nighters and countless existential crises, so sharing my work is very important to me and your support to make that happen would mean the world!

 

The Conference (May 23-24, 2013)

"Assembling Identities" is an international and cross-disciplinary postgraduate conference put on by doctoral students of the University of Glasgow's College of Arts, which focuses on how we understand identity and the process of identity formation.  The conference will investigate ways in which identities, both established and marginal, are and have been assembled and disassembled throughout the world.

Keynote Speakers: Professor Regenia Gagnier (University of Exeter); Professor Pierre Joris (SUNY at Albany); Ruth Washbrook (Scottish Screen Archive/NLS)

My Art Practice and Anthropological Research

Having studied both fine art and anthropology, my works are inherently interdisciplinary, oscillating between these fields to work out intellectual inquiries.  The central themes I examine revolve around abstract portraiture and means of constructing "self" through both cultural and physical means.  

At "Assembling Identities" I will be presenting my paper entitled "Bodily and Celestial Cosmologies: Tattooing and Asterisms amongst the Japanese and Maori".  Last year I conducted research exploring the ethnoastronomical beliefs and tattooing practices of the Japanese and Maori.  My research explores how groups and individuals have dealt with placing ideologically imbued patterns onto the body and night sky.  The body and sky are two universal forms which every society has negotiated with as a space to entrust worldviews (communal and individual).  My writings juxtapose culturally constructed means of creating locality by imposing an invented order on these fields, to make sense of each other and the cosmos.  Also, included in my paper is a series of photographs I worked on concurrently while writing, which delved into my own ideas about how images on the body translate to images of and in the night sky.   So, yeah, I read a lot of Joseph Campbell and got friends (you know who you are) to take their clothes off so I could draw on them and experiment with literally pulling drawings off their body to make celestial looking images.

Costs

Funding this project would allow me to attend the conference, as well as print my writings. My project goal of $2300 covers the flight (which is about $1800), two nights in a hostel, the cost of producing the pledge rewards (printing and shipping), and fees claimed by indiegogo. 

Rewards

Here are images of the limited edition prints you'd get for pledging.  They each come from separate photo series I worked on while writing "Bodily and Celestial Cosmologies".

 

Thank you for taking the time to read through my project, and if you know anyone who may be intrigued by my research, please send it their way.

Best,

M

story:
Levée De Fonds 2014, Lukas Vaillancourt ! 

Le 22 juin 2014, semblait être une journée comme une autre pour Lukas, il se leva comme à tous les autres jours, se prépara pour aller travaillé à moto, il embrassa sa conjointe ,quitta pour le travail et prit l'autoroute.

Ce que personne ne savait c'est que cette journée là, il ne se rendrait pas au travail, une crevaison sur une moto et une bretelle d'autoroute ( 610 ) ne font pas bon ménage, Lukas se retrouva dans le fossé , combien de temps c'est écoulé entre l'accident et l'arrivée des secours car un dimanche matin , vers 7h30, il n'y a pas beaucoup de gens.

À l'arrivée des paramédics, il luttait déjà énormément pour sa vie, dans le coma, il s'est retrouvé pratiquement 2 mois !

Aujourd'hui, il est réveillé, il se souvient de sa vie, de sa conjointe, de sa famille de TOUS sauf la fameuse journée de l'accident ! 

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Depuis, le 22 Juin 2014, sa conjointe est à son chevet jour et nuit, et lorsqu'elle n'est pas à l'hôpital avec lui,  elle est avec son fils de 2 ans ! Elle n'est pas retournée au travail depuis l'accident, mais le train - train quotidien lui, suit son cours , les comptes continue de rentrée, les prestations de couvrent pas tous les frais, l'hospitalisation apporte son lot de dépense , stationnement, épicerie, lunch et +++  

Comme elle a fait le choix d'épauler son conjoint, de se battre avec lui à ses côtés, de se réjouir de chacun de ses progrès et de pleurer chacune de ses peines.

Donnez généreusement, la réadaptation de Lukas commencera sous peu, on parle de réapprendre à parler, à manger, à marcher, à tous faire : à 21 ans !  

  • Que se soit un don de 1 $ ou un don de 100$, tous les dons seront une parcelle de joie, une parcelle de bonheur qui aidera à subvenir au besoin de Lukas, Sa Conjointe et du petit loup de  2 ans. 

  • Tous les dons seront remis à Lukas, Alexandra & Jacob !!!

    ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

    On 22 June 2014, seemed to be a day like any other for Lukas, he woke up like every other day, prepared to go to work on a motorcycle, he kissed his wife left for work and took the highway. 

    What nobody knew was that day that he would not go to work, a flat tire on a motorcycle and highway junction (610) do not mix, Lukas ended up in the ditch, how time that elapsed between the accident and help arrived as a Sunday morning, around 7:30, there are not many people. 

    Upon arrival of paramedics, he was already struggling a lot for her life in a coma, he found himself almost two months! 

    Today he woke up, he remembers his life, his wife, his family, except for ALL the famous day of the accident! 

    ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 

    Since June 22, 2014, his wife was at his bedside day and night, and when not in the hospital with her, she's with her 2 year old son! She has not returned to work since the accident, but the train - it daily train runs its course, the accounts continue to return, benefits not cover all expenses, hospitalization brings its own expense, parking , grocery, lunch and +++ 

    As she made ​​the choice to support her husband, to fight with him at his side, to rejoice in each of its progress and mourn each of his sentences. 

    Give generously, rehabilitation Lukas begin shortly, we talk about learning to speak, to eat, to walk, to all: 21 years! 

    Whether a donation of $ 1 or a $ 100 donation, all donations will be a lot of joy, a lot of happiness that will help meet the need of Lukas, The Joint and little wolf 2 years. 

    All donations will go to Lukas, Alexandra & Jacob !!!

Today he woke up, he remembers his life, his wife, his family, except for ALL the famous day of the accident! 
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
Since June 22, 2014, his wife was at his bedside day and night, and when not in the hospital with her, she's with her 2 year old son! She has not returned to work since the accident, but the train - it daily train runs its course, the accounts continue to return, benefits not cover all expenses, hospitalization brings its own expense, parking , grocery, lunch and +++ 
As she made ​​the choice to support her husband, to fight with him at his side, to rejoice in each of its progress and mourn each of his sentences. 
Give generously, rehabilitation Lukas begin shortly, we talk about learning to speak, to eat, to walk, to all: 21 years! 
Whether a donation of $ 1 or a $ 100 donation, all donations will be a lot of joy, a lot of happiness that will help meet the need of Lukas, The Joint and little wolf 2 years. 
All donations will go to Lukas, Alexandra & Jacob !!!

story:
Short Summary

Buzzsaw magazine is an independent magazine founded in 1999 at Ithaca College. It was born out of frustration from a small group of students on campus. The frustration stemmed from the attitude of the student body, the lack of challenges in the classroom and the policies of other student media. Originally called Buzzsaw Haircut, the magazine’s goals were to critique the media, address important issues and question what was happening on campus. Today, Buzzsaw is still an important independent voice on Ithaca College’s campus and in the community,  which addresses significant local, national and international issues.

Due to a series of unfortunate events this semester, the magazine didn’t receive  funding for two of its three issues published each semester. Our goal is to raise $1,800 so we can continue with our normal production schedule and fund two issues of the magazine. We believe that Buzzsaw is an important voice on campus, and it would be unfortunate if we were unable to continue Buzzsaw’s 15-year tradition.

Any contributions and support are greatly appreciated, and with that support we will be able to continue the publication of Buzzsaw.

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $1,800 to fund future issues and repay a generous loan that was given to the publication to fund our final two issues of the semester. The loan was given to us by the Park School of Communications on campus after our complete budget was not met by the Student Government Association. In the past SGA has fully funded all three issues each semester. Because the magazine was originally founded independent of the school, we would like to keep our independent status and fully repay the loan.

If you are able to donate to our campaign, we have some fun perks that we are offering to all funders. A detailed list can be seen to your right, but a rundown of what is being offered is: a thank you online and in our next publication, a handwritten note from our editors, a copy of our next issue, a t-shirt and a year’s subscription to the magazine.

If our goal is not met, all of the funds raised will still be put toward future issues and repaying the loan.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are unable to donate, please spread the word about our magazine and our fundraiser! The magazine is a unique and important voice, not only in the Ithaca community, but for all of our readers, and we want to be able to continue to share our stories with as many people as possible.

story:
While visiting schools in my junior year of high school, I was surprised to see that Barnard didn't have a feminist literary magazine. I figured that feminism is such an important cause at Barnard that a collective or publication might be overkill. However, when I got to campus in the wake of the campus-wide anti-sexual assault activism and Emma Sulkowicz's senior thesis project, I felt inspired. I realized that there are some messages that are too powerful for words, and can only be expressed through art.

So I gathered up a group of my peers at Columbia and Barnard and started an on-campus feminist literary project called Dollhouse Magazine. The interest in this project keeps growing and growing. However, in order to meet our goals, we need some support. 

We want to bring this project to life in the form of a print magazine featuring creative work by feminists on campus and even across the nation. To see what kind of material we publish, please visit our website: http://dollhousemag.org/

We feel that there was a lack of female representation in the literary community and we need your help.

Thank you,

Sariel Friedman & The Dollhouse Magazine Staff

story:
This is a FLEXIBLE FUNDING campaign. All contributions count. There is NO NEED to meet the "goal" set. You get your ebooks regardless of what the campaign makes. Moreover, there are no perks listed, because all you need to do is pay one price: $5. Just click CONTRIBUTE NOW and overwrite the default amount with $5. Thanks!

Before you do that though, feel free to read "Jizzemboweler" online, just one of the short stories you will find in the bundle, gratis.

Read a recent guest blog post I wrote about "sexpunk" at The Back Seat Writer!

OMNI Reboot published an article of mine about "sexpunk" and transhumanism entitled "OMNI Orgasm: A Tale of Love, Sex and Transhumanism".


Short Summary

Five ebooks for five dollars. As soon as I receive payment, I send the ebooks. Please do allow 24 hours for delivery. (Yes, this means all the ebooks are ready to go and you will NOT have to wait the full 60 days to get them.)

Who I am
My pen name is Made in DNA. I'm an indie author publishing my own work.

I specialize in what I like to call "sexpunk" or "sex-fi" adult work wherein transhuman or posthuman characters take center stage. Settings include gritty, furious, far-flung extrasolar planets, where racy, hardcore sex with aliens, cyborgs, robots and similar agents is as central to the storytelling as technology to cyberpunk. It is an unadulterated, unapologetic and self-indulgent fare reminiscent of work by Masamune Shirow, or featured in Heavy Metal magazine, Penthouse Comix and 2000AD.

This campaign is to promote my both old and new work with a bundle of ebooks I have either written or worked on as editor/publisher.

Each of the ebooks is listed on Amazon and/or Smashwords where detailed descriptions of each can be found.

Just $5 Gets you 5 eBooks

With your contribution, you will get the following ebooks in epub, mobi and PDF formats (in alphabetical order):

  • Bukkake Brawl >> Mei is an indentured slave in the brawl pits of Yue Fong, a floating city on the lawless seas between major Asian countries. When her little sister Nin is brutally murdered by a midget man-god with a firehose-length extremity, she must rage through savages intent on owning her body to try and exact a revenge. Contains four total works in one volume for a total of 43,000 words. 
  • Full-Metal Orgasm #69001 (plus digital wallpaper of cover) >> An adult eZine of sexploitation fiction. Sexy gynoids, alien lifeforms, sex-starved twins, a sniper in love with his weapon, a demon invasion from another dimension... all this and more. Hardcore sexual themes and situations. Adults only.
  • Full-Metal Orgasm #69002 (plus digital wallpaper of cover) >> An adult eZine of sexploitation fiction. Terrorist fairy tales, near-immortal aliens, pleasure bot product development, and more. Hardcore sexual themes and situations. Adults only.
  • Full-Metal Orgasm #69003 (plus digital wallpaper of cover) >> An adult eZine of sexploitation fiction. Jilted computer lovers, assassins, male sexbots, rock stars with bizarre tastes in women, and more. Hardcore sexual themes and situations. Adults only.

  • Parallactic Orgasm (anthology of 7 stories) >> Set in the far future, this anthology is a collection of technological tales of greed, murder, lust, adventure and sex by sexpunk author Made in DNA. Six original sexpunk short stories with cyberpunk, science fiction, transhuman and post-human elements. Hardcore adult adventures.
Risks & Challenges

There are no risks involved for anyone. This campaign is a win-win situation.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't help with money, please use the Indiegogo sharing tools to let your friends know about the campaign. Easy as clickity-click-click.

story:
Siddartha Beth Pierce

Is looking for airfare assistance to Ireland from Washington, D.C. for a Featured Poetry Reading at the International Poetry Festival in Fermoy, Cork County, Ireland for the first week of August 2014.  She was short listed for this phenomenal event the last two years and was accepted this year as a Feature.  


Ms. Pierce has been disabled since 2001 yet she has published three full length poetry and art books in the last two years.  Her poetry and art have been published and awarded both nationally and internationally. 

For further information about the Author/Artist please see her bio at:


www.fermoypoetryfestival.com


Also, please feel free to Google and/or Bing her name for further information on her work activities.


Cheers, any and all assistance is much appreciated.


With the Greatest of Love and Admiration.

story:
Hi, I am Sue Holloway.  I am a homeschooling mother of two, an entrepreneur, an artist, and an educator.  I have worked with children for over twenty years, the last ten as the founder and teacher of The Forest School - An Alternative Learning Centre in South Gillies, Ontario.  In all that I do, I love to share with others the wonder of what is, and in the case of A World Worth Imagining, the wonder of what could be.

As I mentioned in my video, I'm a believer and I truly believe there is hope for our future and for a world our kids can look forward to.   I also believe, now more than ever, our kids and all of us really, need to be seeing the images and hearing the voices that speak of hope.  And so, I wrote this story.

 

THE INSPIRATION

A World Worth Imagining was inspired by a wonderful group of young people I have taught for many years.  One Earth Day morning standing by our pond, I invited the children to close their eyes and imagine what it might look like in one hundred years.  One of the girls refused, believing that the world would have been destroyed by then.  There was sadness in her eyes as she spoke and I realized then, that our young people understand the crisis facing the planet and its people, that message is coming to them loud and clear.  They hear it, feel it, and they understand the responsibility that comes with it.  What they are not hearing are the voices of visionaries and dreamers, those who can see the possibilities of a new and brighter future. 

On that morning sitting by the pond, I committed to creating a different kind of story for our children, one with a different kind of message -- hope.

And here it is!!!  A World Worth Imagining. 

I have read versions of this story to that same group of kids for the last four Earth Days,  and we all agree, it's ready!  It has been quite the journey so far, but it's not over.   It is time to get it out to the world and to help it be one of those voices that inspires hope in the hearts  of others.

I would love if you helped me make this happen!

 

THE STORY

A World Worth Imagining is seen through the eyes of a young girl in the future reflecting on the beauty of her world.  Seeing all that she has, it is hard for her to imagine the world the elders speak of-- the time when many were driven by fear and self -interest, when the earth was sick from the ways of the people and needed to fight back to reclaim its balance.  She wonders about the bravery and determination it must have taken for her ancestors to forge a new path.  With gratitude, the young girl looks down on her village and sees what becomes in a world guided by respect and compassion.

 

THE ILLUSTRATOR

The search for the perfect illustrator has taken a few years.  I have always felt the story needs truly beautiful images to bring it alive.  After a lengthy search, I am super excited and fortunate to have found and partnered up with the amazing artist, Amanda Clark!!! Amanda is an artist and illustrator that creates from her heart and intuition.   She has created many works of incredible art.  You will see!

Amanda is busy working on the images for this book, but here is a taste of some her other work.

If you want to see more, visit her website: http://earthangelsart.com/. or find her on Facebook --https://www.facebook.com/xamandaclarkx

 

What We Need...

Creating A World Worth Imagining continues to be quite an extraordinary adventure.  I love that it exists in the world and that there is this little piece of hope that someone might cling to.  I love that the Forest School kids helped bring it into form, and have come along with me for the ride.  I love that my 13 year old said, when hearing a rather dark doomsday conversation, "but what if mom's story comes true?"  That's all I want, is to plant a seed of hope.

With your help,  we can make this happen.

 

My campaign goal of $13,000 will cover the costs of getting the book ready for print.

$1500 editing

$8000 illustrations

$3500 cover and design

Total: $13,000

All monies that are raised will go to seeing this book get out in the world!  If I exceed my goal, the money will be put towards the printing and marketing of A World Worth Imagining. 

 

What You Get...

$5-  A HUGE THANK YOU

$25- 1 Signed copy of the book & a beautifully illustrated bookmark

$50- 2 Signed copies of the book & a beautifully illustrated bookmark

$75.00- 2 Signed copies of the book PLUS one, 8X10 print of the book illustration  of your choice & a beautifully illustrated bookmark

$100.00- 2 Signed copies of the book PLUS two, 8x10 prints of the book illustrations of your choice & a beautifully illustrated bookmark

$150.00- 3 Signed copies of the book, PLUS three, 8X10 prints of the book illustrations of your choice & a beautifully illustrated bookmark

$250- EARTH SPEAKS WORKSHOP for 10 with Sue, PLUS 1 Signed copy of the book.  (other options available for non Thunder Bay residents)

Risks & Challenges

I think the biggest risk will be not reaching my funding goal.  The reality is, however, that I am totally committed to this project, and so it will happen somehow.  It just might take a little longer.

There is also the risk that something unforeseen will arise in the process that makes it impossible to meet the target distribution date.  I will be sure to keep all supporters in the loop, to try and avoid any disappointment.

The biggest part of this project for me was writing it.  The rest feels a little bit out of my control.  (which sometimes can be challenging for me).  To ensure the production stays consistent with my vision, I will be diligent in communicating clearly and working closely with the folks in whose hands it now lies, and have faith in their expertise.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I would be forever grateful if you would share this campaign with as many friends and contacts as you can.  Every cent is going to help in getting this story published.

Thank you so much!

Sue

A heartfelt THANK YOU to Joel Hearing, my 12 year old Forest School friend, for making my video!
